title: House Cleaner - Full-time
description:
WELCOME! We are so excited to be welcoming more team members in. We are a residential cleaning company and growing fast! Cleaning is in demand and our team needs your help!

We are looking for:
POSITION: Residential Cleaning Technician
PAY: $19 - $21/hr
LOCATION: Newmarket, Ontario
SHIFT: Day time, Afternoon Typically 8-6 pm
HOURS: Part Time or Full Time, if desired.

If you are ready to work somewhere you love:

  • Ready to make a difference in people's lives.
  • Get rewarded for your hard work! (Up to $840 / Week)
  • Enjoy a flexible work-life balance.
  • Enjoy working with happy customers, and accepting tips!
  • Love having a consistent schedule that you can rely on
  • Dental/Medical benefits after 6 months
  • Get paid every week
  • Allowance & Travel time compensation
  • Get 4 raises after the first year
  • Unlimited time off with notice

There's a reason our cleaners LOVE staying with us for years and we would love to show you why!

Duties:

  • Clean homes, air BnB rentals, cabins, resorts.
  • Clean kitchens, bathrooms, dishes, bedding, refill soaps, wash laundry, baseboards, cobwebs, floors, etc.
  • Clean & organize team supplies before and after shift neatly.
  • Work smart and efficiently with your partner to get the houses done for the day.

Requirements:

  • Paid House Cleaning Experience
  • Reliable Transportation
  • Smart Phone

Enjoy working with a 5 Star Cleaning Service and Join the Team Today!

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $19.00-$21.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

title: P.M. Maid (Night Maid)
description:
The Niagara Falls Courtyard Marriott is looking for a P.M. Maid to join their team! The successful candidate will be responsible for cleaning and supplying guest rooms between the hours of 3:00pm and 11:30pm.

WHY JOIN OUR TEAM?

  • Referral Program - earn up to $600 for referring a new Room Attendant
  • Extended health and dental benefit plan
  • Monthly summer lunches
  • Free on-site parking
  • Weekly prize draws - 6 winners each week
  • 20% discount at the Keg Steakhouse + Bar
  • 20% discount at Starbucks
  • Monthly out of uniform day

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Assist housekeepers when needed
  • Make all cots in linen rooms
  • Answer all guest calls
  • Clean guest rooms as needed throughout shift
  • Completes special cleaning projects as directed by management
  • Empty garbage on each floor
  • Clean, check and restock public washrooms as needed

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Must be able to read, write and follow oral and written direction in English
  • Previous cleaning experience an asset
  • Must be capable of meeting the physical demands of the position; repetitive bending, lifting, pushing and pulling a moderate weight
  • Ability to prioritize tasks
  • Must have reliable transportation
  • Required to provide a certificate proving completion of the Health and Safety Awareness Training for Workers (free e-course provided by the Ministry of Labour)

The Courtyard Marriott welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $15.50 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Holidays
  • Weekend availability

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Niagara Falls, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

Experience:

  • Cleaning: 1 year (preferred)

title: ❤️ House Cleaner, Maid, Housekeeper - up to $23/hr + benefit...
description:
Hire A Maid of Durham (www.hireamaid.ca) is looking for housekeeping professionals who love to clean and want to earn excellent pay to join our fantastic team of House Cleaners in the Pickering, Ajax, and Durham region.

Past house cleaning experience is not necessary since we provide Full Training on our award-winning cleaning methods -- we hire from the customer service, retail, restaurant, food service, psw, landscape labourer, nanny and housekeeper fields.

** Please note - you must be legally eligible to work in Canada and have your own vehicle to be considered for this position **

Hire A Maid offers:

✓* Solo House Cleaner pay of $18-$23 per hour *(based on Durham hours, pay ranges from $1,000 to $1,300 biweekly depending on the hours worked), plus Bonuses and Tips

✓* Paid statutory holidays and 4% vacation pay included with each pay*

✓* Employee Health Benefits *(after 3 months) -- including dental, medical and vision care

✓* Mileage rate of 50 cents per km for drivers' *travel between homes

✓* Fully paid training on our high quality cleaning methods. Prior housekeeping or cleaning experience is not required*

✓***No Nights! No Weekends! *Full-time and Part-time solo house cleaner positions are available (your choice)

✓* WSIB coverage, and CPP and EI contributions by Hire A Maid*

✓* Career advancement opportunities*

About Hire A Maid:

Hire A Maid is an award-winning independent cleaning company that is celebrating our 13th year in business. Hire A Maid Solo House Cleaners are employees who are eligible to work in Canada, and receive all benefits of employees.

title: newBarman(maid) Junior / Junior Bartender , Restaurant Marcus &...
description:
Barman(maid) Junior, Restaurant Marcus & Lounge

Département : Restaurant Marcus & Lounge
Se rapporte à : Assistants responsables de la restauration
Statut : Temps plein
Taux horaire : 17,88$ + pourboires
  • En raison des lois locales, nous considérerons prioritairement les candidats l’autorisation de travailler au Canada, et s’exprimant parfaitement en français et en anglais, à l’oral et à l’écrit.
Le Four Seasons Hôtel Montréal est à la recherche d’une personne qui partage notre passion pour l’excellence et cherche à créer une expérience mémorable pour nos employés et nos invités. Nous recherchons une personne qui a une solide éthique de travail, un haut niveau d’intégrité, un souci de qualité, une sensibilité culturelle et un sens du service client.
Résumé
Le rôle de barman(maid) junior est un poste d'entrée qui vise à donner l'outil pour développer la capacité à devenir un barman de haut niveau comme l'exige Four Seasons. Les tâches seront axées sur la préparation et le service des cocktails.
Principales responsabilités
  • Offrir aux clients du Bar un service distingué et agréable conformément aux critères de qualité Four Seasons ;
  • Anticiper les demandes des clients et y répondre de manière proactive ;
  • Servir les boissons en ayant une bonne connaissance de la carte des boissons ;
  • Développer une connaissance complète de tous les produits offerts par le Bar comme les vins, les cocktails, les bières, les armagnacs, les cognacs, les eaux de vie et les autres boissons ;
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le barman ;
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec le Sommelier pour assurer une rotation adéquate des produits vinicoles ;
  • Effectuer toutes les tâches d'ouverture et de fermeture du bar ; être capable de dresser les tables selon les normes requises ;
  • Présenter les menus de boissons et de nourriture et offrir des suggestions aux clients ;
  • Avoir une connaissance détaillée de tous les éléments du menu, qu'il s'agisse de nourriture ou de boissons ;
  • Débarrasser et stocker toute la vaisselle, la porcelaine, l'argenterie, la verrerie, les boissons et la nourriture ;
  • Savoir utiliser le système informatique de l'hôtel (micros), pour la facturation des produits, pour l’impression des factures et effectuer les transactions ;
  • Porter les plateaux, savoir débarrasser et redresser les tables ;
  • Ranger et nettoyer la zone du bar pendant le service ;
  • S’assurer que tous les détails du service soient parfaits et que chaque client reçoive la meilleure qualité de service ;
  • S’assurer que le bar est stocké en tout temps et que toutes les responsabilités d’ouverture et de fermeture sont bien accomplies ;
  • Accueillir les clients avec un comportement chaleureux et courtois en établissant un contact visuel avec un sourire et une présentation appropriée ;
  • Rapporter tout incident ou situation atypique immédiatement à son superviseur ;
  • Répondre correctement aux divers cas d’urgence et aux situations de sécurité ;
  • S’assurer de la satisfaction du client et à prendre en main tout problème qui pourrait survenir, informer un superviseur par la suite ;
  • Exécuter d’autres tâches ou projets assignés par la Direction de l’hôtel.
Qualifications et compétences souhaitées
  • Avoir une bonne maîtrise des langues française et anglaise ;
  • Avoir une excellente résistance au stress et le gérer de manière positive et efficace ;
  • Être à l’aise dans un environnement à cadence rapide ;
  • 1 année d’expérience dans un poste similaire, idéalement dans un milieu hôtelier de luxe ;
  • Une affinité pour le service à la clientèle ;
  • Bonnes aptitudes interpersonnelles puisque ce poste implique un contact constant avec la clientèle ;
  • Être debout/marcher pendant de longues périodes tout au long de la journée ;
  • Soulever des charges jusqu’à 13kg ;
  • Travailler des horaires atypiques et être disponible les jours, soirs, nuits, fin de semaines et fériés ;
  • Le candidat idéal aura des connaissances solides en nourriture et boissons, une attention marquée pour les détails et la capacité à effectuer plusieurs tâches ;
  • Excellentes connaissances au niveau des cocktails classiques et modernes ;
Avantages pour vous
  • Couverture maladie complémentaire (soins dentaires, vision, assurance-vie, médicaments sur ordonnance, etc.)
  • Réductions au restaurant MARCUS et à notre spa 5 étoiles
  • Journées et événements pour les employés tels qu'Employé du mois, célébrations des années de service, événements d'anniversaire, et plus encore
  • Repas gratuit par quart de travail dans la salle à manger de nos employés (Café 1440)
  • Plan de retraite avec contribution de l'employeur
  • Congés payés : jours de maladie, jours de vacances et 2 jours fériés flottants supplémentaires par an
  • Opportunités de formation, de développement et de mobilité
  • Programme de voyage des employés, y compris les séjours gratuits au Four Seasons dans le monde (selon la durée du service et sous réserve de disponibilité)
  • Et plus !
La liste des tâches précisées ci-dessus n’est pas exhaustive, votre fonction supposera une adaptation constante à des situations de forte activité et de gestion spécifique de relations clients.
Notre organisation est un employeur sensibilisé envers l’équité professionnelle et qui s'engage à recruter une main-d'œuvre diversifiée et à maintenir une culture inclusive. L’usage du masculin n’est utilisé qu’aux fins d’alléger le texte. Nous ne discriminons pas en fonction du genre, de l'appartenance ethnique, de la religion, de l'orientation sexuelle, de l'âge, du handicap ou de toute autre base protégée par les lois provinciales ou fédérales.
-
Junior Bartender, MARCUS Restaurant & Lounge
Department: MARCUS Restaurant & Lounge
Reports to: Assistant Food and Beverage Managers
Status: Full-Time
Hourly Rate: $17,88 + Tips
Due to local laws, we prioritize applicants who have permission to work in Canada, and are fluent in both English and French, both orally and in writing.
The Four Seasons Hotel Montreal is looking for someone who shares our passion for excellence and seeks to create a memorable experience for our employees and guests. We are looking for a person who has a strong work ethic, a high level of integrity, a concern for quality, a cultural sensitivity and a sense of customer service.
Summary
The junior bartender role is an entry position that is meant to give the tool to develop the ability to become a top-level bartender as required by Four Seasons. The tasks will focus on cocktail preparation and service.
Core Responsibilities
  • Offer guests at the bar a distinguished and pleasant service as per Four Seasons quality standards;
  • Anticipate guest needs and responds in a proactive manner;
  • Serve a variety of beverages and have excellent knowledge of the beverage menu;
  • Develop complete knowledge of all products offered by the bar such as wines, cocktails, beers, Armagnacs, cognacs, spirits and all other beverages;
  • Work closely with the Bartender ;
  • Work closely with the Sommelier to ensure proper rotation of wine products;
  • Perform all opening and closing tasks at the bar; be able to set-up tables as per required standards;
  • Present beverage and food menus and offer clients suggestions;
  • Have detailed knowledge of all menu items whether it be food or beverages;
  • Remove and stock all tableware, porcelain, silverware, glassware, beverages and food;
  • Ability to use the hotel’s computer system (micros) for product billing, printing invoices and to close payments in the correct payment system;
  • Bring plates to clients, clean up and reset tables;
  • Tidy up and clean bar area during service hours;
  • Ensure all details of service are delivered to perfection and that each client is given the best quality service;
  • Ensure bar is properly stocked at all times and that opening and closing tasks are executed;
  • Welcome guests with a warm, courteous demeanor by making eye contact with a smile and proper presentation;
  • Immediately report all incidents or atypical situations to the supervisor;
  • Correctly respond to various emergency or security situations;
  • Ensure client satisfaction and take ownership of any problem that may arise, advise supervisors afterwards;
  • Perform all other tasks or projects assigned by hotel management;
Desired Qualifications and Skills
  • Strong command of the French and English languages;
  • Have a good resistance to stress and manage it positively and effectively;
  • 2 – 3 years’ experience in the same role, ideally in a luxury hotel environment;
  • An affinity for guest service;
  • Good interpersonal skills. This position involves a large volume of guest contact and excellent communication skills are required;
  • Move about facility and stand for long periods of time;
  • The ability to carry up to 30lbs (13kg);
  • A flexible schedule with the ability to work all shifts: days, nights, weekends and holidays;
  • The ideal candidate will also have solid food and wine knowledge, a strong attention to detail and the ability to multitask;
  • Excellent knowledge of modern and classic cocktails;
What's in it for you?
  • Extended Health Coverage (dental, vision, life insurance, RMT, prescription drugs, etc.) after probationary period
  • Discounts at MARCUS Restaurant and our 5 Star Spa
  • Employee theme recognition days and events- Employee of the month, Years of service celebrations, birthday events, etc.
  • Complimentary meal per shift in our employee dining room (Café 1440)
  • Retirement plan with employer match
  • Paid time off, vacation days and 2 additional floating holidays per year
  • Excellent training and development program
  • Employee Travel Program, including complimentary stays at Four Seasons globally (by length of service and subject to availability)
  • And more!
The list of tasks specified above is not exhaustive, the function will require a constant adaptation to situations of high activity and specific management of customer relations.
  • Our organization is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. We do not discriminate on the basis of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, age, disability or any other basis protected under provincial or federal laws.

  • En raison des lois locales, nous considérerons prioritairement les candidats l’autorisation de travailler au Canada, et s’exprimant parfaitement en français et en anglais, à l’oral et à l’écrit.
Le Four Seasons Hôtel Montréal est à la recherche d’une personne qui partage notre passion pour l’excellence et cherche à créer une expérience mémorable pour nos employés et nos invités. Nous recherchons une personne qui a une solide éthique de travail, un haut niveau d’intégrité, un souci de qualité, une sensibilité culturelle et un sens du service client.
Principales responsabilités
  • Offrir aux clients du Bar un service distingué et agréable conformément aux critères de qualité Four Seasons ;
  • Anticiper les demandes des clients et y répondre de manière proactive ;
  • Servir les boissons en ayant une bonne connaissance de la carte des boissons
  • Développer une connaissance complète de tous les produits offerts par le Bar comme les vins, les cocktails, les bières, les armagnacs, les cognacs, les eaux de vie et les autres boissons ;
  • Travailler étroitement avec le Sommelier pour assurer une rotation des produits de vins ;
  • Effectuer autant le service d’ouverture que de fermeture du Bar ; savoir dresser les tables selon les normes requises ;
  • Présenter la carte et chaque menu en conseillant les clients ;
  • Connaître en détail tous les menus, que ce soit pour les plats ou les boissons ;
  • Débarrasser et stocker le linge, la porcelaine, l’argenterie, la verrerie, les boissons et la nourriture ;
  • Savoir utiliser le système informatique de l'hôtel (micros), pour la facturation des produits, pour l’impression des factures et effectuer les transactions ;
  • Porter les plateaux, savoir débarrasser et redresser les tables ;
  • Ranger et nettoyer le bar pendant le service ;
  • S’assurer que tous les détails du service soient parfaits et que chaque client reçoive la meilleure qualité de service ;
  • S’assurer que le bar est stocké en tout temps et que toutes les responsabilités d’ouverture et de fermeture sont bien accomplies ;
  • Saluer le client chaleureusement, avec courtoisie, avec le contact des yeux, en souriant et avec une bonne présentation ;
  • Rapporter tout incident ou situation atypique immédiatement à son superviseur ;
  • Répondre correctement aux divers cas d’urgence et aux situations de sécurité ;
  • S’assurer de la satisfaction du client et à prendre en main tout problème qui pourrait survenir, informer un superviseur par la suite ;
  • Exécuter d’autres tâches ou projets assignés par la Direction de l’hôtel.
Qualifications et compétences souhaitées
  • Fortes aptitudes de communication en français et en anglais ;
  • Être à l’aise dans un environnement à cadence rapide ;
  • 2-3 années d’expérience dans un poste similaire, idéalement dans un milieu hôtelier de luxe ;
  • Des affinités pour le service à la clientèle ;
  • Bonnes aptitudes interpersonnelles puisque ce poste implique un contact constant avec la clientèle ;
  • Être debout/marcher pendant de longues périodes tout au long de la journée ;
  • Soulever des charges jusqu’à 13kg ;
  • Travailler des horaires atypiques et être disponible les jours, soirs, nuits, fin de semaines et fériés ;
  • Le candidat idéal aura des connaissances solides en nourriture et boissons, une attention marquée pour les détails et la capacité à effectuer plusieurs tâches ;
  • Excellentes connaissances au niveau des cocktails classiques et modernes ;
Avantages pour vous
  • Couverture maladie complémentaire (soins dentaires, vision, assurance-vie, médicaments sur ordonnance, etc.)
  • Réductions au restaurant MARCUS et à notre spa 5 étoiles
  • Journées et événements pour les employés tels qu'Employé du mois, célébrations des années de service, événements d'anniversaire, et plus encore
  • Repas gratuit par quart de travail dans la salle à manger de nos employés (Café 1440)
  • Plan de retraite avec contribution de l'employeur
  • Congés payés : jours de maladie, jours de vacances et 2 jours fériés flottants supplémentaires par an
  • Opportunités de formation, de développement et de mobilité
  • Programme de voyage des employés, y compris les séjours gratuits au Four Seasons dans le monde (selon la durée du service et sous réserve de disponibilité)
  • Et plus !
La liste des tâches précisées ci-dessus n’est pas exhaustive, votre fonction supposera une adaptation constante à des situations de forte activité et de gestion spécifique de relations clients.
Notre organisation est un employeur sensibilisé envers l’équité professionnelle et qui s'engage à recruter une main-d'œuvre diversifiée et à maintenir une culture inclusive. L’usage du masculin n’est utilisé qu’aux fins d’alléger le texte. Nous ne discriminons pas en fonction du genre, de l'appartenance ethnique, de la religion, de l'orientation sexuelle, de l'âge, du handicap ou de toute autre base protégée par les lois provinciales ou fédérales.

____________________________________________________
Bartender, MARCUS Restaurant & Lounge
Department: MARCUS Restaurant & Lounge
Reports to: Assistant Food and Beverage Managers
Status: Full-Time
Hourly Rate: 18,63$ + Tips
Due to local laws, we prioritize applicants who have permission to work in Canada, and are fluent in both English and French, both orally and in writing.
The Four Seasons Hotel Montreal is looking for someone who shares our passion for excellence and seeks to create a memorable experience for our employees and guests. We are looking for a person who has a strong work ethic, a high level of integrity, a concern for quality, a cultural sensitivity and a sense of customer service.
Core Responsibilities
  • Offer guests at the bar a distinguished and pleasant service as per Four Seasons quality standards;
  • Anticipate guest needs and responds in a proactive manner;
  • Serve a variety of beverages and have excellent knowledge of the beverage menu;
  • Develop complete knowledge of all products offered by the bar such as wines, cocktails, beers, Armagnacs, cognacs, spirits and all other beverages;
  • Work closely with the Sommelier to ensure proper rotation of wine products;
  • Perform all opening and closing tasks at the bar; be able to set-up tables as per required standards;
  • Present beverage and food menus and offer clients suggestions;
  • Have detailed knowledge of all menu items whether it be food or beverages;
  • Remove and stock all tableware, porcelain, silverware, glassware, beverages and food;
  • Ability to use the hotel’s computer system (micros) for product billing, printing invoices and to close payments in the correct payment system;
  • Bring plates to clients, clean up and reset tables;
  • Tidy up and clean bar area during service hours;
  • Ensure all details of service are delivered to perfection and that each client is given the best quality service;
  • Ensure bar is properly stocked at all times and that opening and closing tasks are executed;
  • Welcome guests with a warm, courteous demeanor by making eye contact with a smile and proper presentation;
  • Immediately report all incidents or atypical situations to the supervisor;
  • Correctly respond to various emergency or security situations;
  • Ensure client satisfaction and take ownership of any problem that may arise, advise supervisors afterwards;
  • Perform all other tasks or projects assigned by hotel management;
Desired Qualifications and Skills
  • Strong command of the French and English languages;
  • 2 – 3 years’ experience in the same role, ideally in a luxury hotel environment;
  • An affinity for guest service;
  • Good interpersonal skills. This position involves a large volume of guest contact and excellent communication skills are required;
  • Excellent bartending and cocktail knowledge;
  • Move about facility and stand for long periods of time;
  • The ability to carry up to 30lbs (13kg);
  • A flexible schedule with the ability to work all shifts: days, nights, weekends and holidays;
  • The ideal candidate will also have solid food and wine knowledge, a strong attention to detail and the ability to multitask;
  • Excellent knowledge of modern and classic cocktails;
What's in it for you?
  • Extended Health Coverage (dental, vision, life insurance, RMT, prescription drugs, etc.) after probationary period
  • Discounts at MARCUS Restaurant and our 5 Star Spa
  • Employee theme recognition days and events- Employee of the month, Years of service celebrations, birthday events, etc.
  • Complimentary meal per shift in our employee dining room (Café 1440)
  • Retirement plan with employer match
  • Paid time off, vacation days and 2 additional floating holidays per year
  • Excellent training and development program
  • Employee Travel Program, including complimentary stays at Four Seasons globally (by length of service and subject to availability)
  • And more!
The list of tasks specified above is not exhaustive, the function will require a constant adaptation to situations of high activity and specific management of customer relations.
  • Our organization is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. We do not discriminate on the basis of gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, age, disability or any other basis protected under provincial or federal laws.

title: newRoom Attendant - Casual Hours
description:
This job is "MAID" for you! (pun intended) We are looking for the BEST Room Attendants! Come work with the BEST Housekeeping Team!

Let's start with the GREAT benefits!

Benefits:

  • Up to 6 Discounted Mayfield Dinner Theatre Tickets
  • 50% Discount in Stages Restaurant & Bar
  • Extensive Hilton Discounted Room Rates

Each year we survey Team Members about what excites them the most about working at Hilton so we can build on the positive aspects of their experiences at work. Here’s what they have said:

· The people I work with

· Opportunities to grow my career

· Pride in the brand

· Connections with guests and customers

· Meaningful and fun work

· Special and Unique benefits

Major Responsibilities:

Completes assigned rooms during shift, including check outs and stay overs. Reports any delays in completing assigned rooms as soon as aware.

  • Vacuuming carpets and sweeping floors
  • Washing / steaming floors
  • Dusting, brushing, polishing and vacuuming furniture
  • Dusting and cleaning room decorations, appliances and structural surfaces (e.g. wall fixtures, window sills, vents)
  • Changing linen and making beds, checking for damaged or stained linen
  • Cleaning showers, tubs, sinks and bathroom items
  • Ensures proper guest supplies, amenities, and advertising are in the rooms.
  • Ensures the security of keys and guest information, as well as individual safety while cleaning.
  • Ensures guest requests are met by either fulfilling the request or reporting it to a leader.
  • Consistently ensures room cleanliness meets Hilton standards.

Skills, Knowledge and Abilities Required:

  • Must be extremely fit as the position is very physical
  • Energetic and flexible, able to work under pressure
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Self-motivated, honest, creative, capable of working in a team environment

Experience, Training and Education (demonstrating requirements):

  • Minimum one year hotel cleaning experience is preferred.
  • Previous customer service experience is an asset
  • WHMIS training

This job posting is for a position at a hotel that is owned and operated by an independent franchisee (SilverBirch Hotels & Resorts). The franchisee controls all aspects of the hotel’s employment practices, including recruiting, hiring, salary, benefits and compensation decisions, and the collection and processing of the personal data that you provide on this website. If you accept this position, you will be employed by a franchisee and not by Hilton. You will not be eligible from compensation or benefits from Hilton. You will be eligible for compensation or benefits only as may be provided to you by the independent franchisee.

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent, Casual

Pay: $17.30 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Discounted or free food
  • Employee assistance program
  • On-site gym
  • On-site parking
  • Store discount

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Holidays
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

Application question(s):

  • Have you ever done housekeeping in a hotel before? If so - how many rooms per day would you complete?"
  • Shifts are typically 8 am - 4:30 pm. Do you have any limitations to working that shift on any day in the week?
  • Do you currently live in Canada?

Experience:

  • Housekeeping: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • WHMIS Certification (preferred)

title: newResidential Cleaner
description:
We are rapidly growing and are looking for 3-4 new team members to grow with us!

Are you a highly motivated individual, who is energetic, career-oriented, and wants to do excellent work? (and be compensated generously!) We are looking for awesome people who love to clean, who are dependable, friendly, and have an eye for detail.

We service homes and offices in the Halifax Regional Municipality. Our cleaning products are not harsh to keep our staff, clients, and the earth healthy and happy. House cleaning is the perfect position for someone who does not want to be chained to a desk all day and enjoys seeing results in a job well done. We have a great company culture where everyone is valued, and treated with respect.

What We're Looking For

  • A pleasant and positive attitude
  • High energy & motivation
  • Physical ability to lift & bend
  • Thorough and high attention to detail
  • Dependable
  • Punctual
  • Trustworthy
  • Full-time availability
  • Ability to work well independently without direct supervision
  • You have a reliable car

Required Certifications

  • Valid driver’s license and your own reliable transportation

What We Offer

  • Great compensation & a motivation-based salary system, starting salary $17/hour
  • Gratuities
  • Bonuses & perks
  • Room for growth
  • Low stress & a casual dress code

Does this sound like a job for you? If you feel that you're a good fit, apply below to join our team of housekeeping professionals.

MAID 4U is committed to Employment Equity and encourages anyone fitting the above position requirements to apply. All applications will be reviewed as received, and interviews will begin for qualified candidates as soon as possible. Please note that the available positions may be filled before this posting closes. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Part-time hours: 25-30 per week

Salary: $17.00-$21.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Tips

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

title: newHouse Cleaner
description:
Beaver Maids is looking for additional cleaners to add to our fast-growing team in Ottawa Area!

In this role, you can work with a flexible schedule with full-time or part-time cleaning hours.

Why work with Beaver Maids Cleaning Services:

  • Compensation: high pay + 100% of the tips + yearly bonuses
  • Bi-Weekly payouts: You will be paid direct deposit to your bank account every two weeks!
  • Flexible Service Areas: Choose where you want to work, if you want to work in Orleans, no problem! If you live in the west end and can only work near Kanata, no problem!
  • Flexible Schedule: You set your own hours and work as much or as little as you want. Ultimate freedom with a flexible schedule!
  • Be your own boss! With your own flexible schedule, you can also write off your gas, cleaning supplies, cell phone bill, lunches on the go, and other possible expenses regarding your scope of work.
  • Your own online account: to manage and track your schedule and logistics.

Interested Candidates Must Have:

  • 6 months+ experience in the residential/housekeeping/hotel cleaning experience
  • Authorized to work in Canada
  • Able to pass criminal background check
  • Valid driver's license & reliable vehicle
  • Be able to read, speak, and understand basic English.
  • Comfortable with technology (internet, email, taking photos, etc.)
  • Ability to work conflict free within a small team
  • Smartphone with internet access
  • Availability to work between Monday-Saturday (pick your own schedule)

* We service Clients all around Ottawa and the surrounding areas, so please make sure to specify which area you live in so we can potentially set you up to work with the least commute time possible.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $22.00-$25.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

We are looking for enthusiastic, energetic, dependable and hardworking individuals to join our growing team in the Kingston and surrounding areas.
Drivers licence required

title: house cleaning
description:
As a house cleaner on the Merry Maids team, you will use specialized Merry Maids cleaning products and procedures to provide clients with exceptional home cleaning services that ensure customer satisfaction is consistently maintained. This Oakville house cleaning job does not require evening or weekend work.

Responsibilities

  • Prepare cleaning products for the day
  • Load products and equipment into vehicle
  • Use cleaning products and procedures to Merry Maids specifications
  • Clean, dust and vacuum bedrooms, living room, dining room, family room etc.
  • Clean and sanitize kitchen and bathrooms
  • Vacuum and wash hard surface floors on hands and knees
  • Clean and dust light fixtures, baseboards, doors, door frames and windowsills
  • Move reasonably light furniture in rooms to clean under and behind
  • Operate a personal motor vehicle to transport team members, materials, and cleaning supplies to each home (where necessary)

Why you should work for Merry Maids of Oakville:

  • Competitive compensation package, make up to $18/hour
  • Paid mileage
  • A professional, caring and fun culture
  • We always put our team members and customers first!
  • No evenings, weekends, or holidays

Must-have requirements:

  • Must be able to communicate with customers and co-workers effectively in English
  • Valid Driver’s Licence
  • Daily access to a vehicle
  • Must be bondable
  • Strong references
  • Ability to perform physical tasks
  • Available Monday to Friday (35+ hours per week)
  • Strong sense of customer service
  • A GREAT attitude

title: Barman(maid)
description:
Gestev est une entreprise dynamique et créative spécialisée en gestion d’événements sportifs, gestion de sites, marketing expérientiel, spectacles et divertissements au Québec et ailleurs. À l’impossible tous sont tenus !

Gestev est aussi gestionnaire de la Baie de Beauport, le site de villégiature par excellence pour les familles, les sportifs et les amateurs de sports nautiques. À cinq minutes du centre-ville de Québec, c’est le lieu de différentes activités corporatives, mariages, événements spéciaux, etc.

Nous sommes à la recherche d’un(e) Barman (maid) pour se joindre à notre superbe équipe.

Durée du contrat : Juin à septembre 2022

Lieu d’emploi : Baie de Beauport

Horaire/statut : Saisonnier, temps plein

Horaire variable selon l’achalandage et la météo (jour, soir et fin de semaine)

Salaire : À discuter

Avantages : Stationnement gratuit, ambiance de travail chaleureuse, rabais sur la nourriture et les activités.

La personne qui occupera le poste devra se conformer à l’ensemble des politiques de la société notamment celle en matière de vaccination pour la Covid-19.

Merci pour ton intérêt, nous avons hâte de te rencontrer ! Toutefois, seules les personnes dont la candidature aura été retenue seront contactées.

Ta mission :

  • Interagir avec les clients, prendre les commandes, préparer et servir les boissons alcoolisées ou non alcoolisées pour les clients du bar et du restaurant ;
  • Évaluer les besoins et préférences des clients et leur faire des suggestions ;
  • Vérifier les papiers des clients pour savoir s’ils ont l’âge légal de consommer de l’alcool ;
  • Remplir et refaire le stock d’ingrédients et d’accessoires pour le bar ;
  • Respecter toutes les réglementations en matière de nourriture et de boissons ;
  • Accueillir la clientèle de façon courtoise ;
  • Renseigner la clientèle sur les différents produits et services offerts sur le site ;
  • Opérer une caisse et gérer les paiements ;
  • S’assurer quotidiennement de la propreté du lieu de travail ;
  • Effectuer son dépôt et sa fermeture de caisse ;
  • Prévenir les responsables en cas de difficulté d’intervention ;
  • Exécuter toutes autres tâches connexes.

Ton bagage et ta personnalité :

  • Attitudes et comportement professionnels (aptitudes pour le travail d’équipe, autonomie, dynamisme, entregent, honnêteté, polyvalence, sens de l’initiative, sens de l’organisation, positivisme, etc.) ;
  • Aptitudes pour le service à la clientèle ;
  • Capacité à garder un bar rangé, rempli et propre ;
  • Connaissance minimale du français et de l’anglais. La maîtrise d’autres langues constitue un atout ;
  • Connaissance du milieu événementiel un atout ;
  • Leadership et capacité de prise de décisions ;
  • Bonne tolérance au stress.

title: Cleaning Team Member
description:
SPECIALLY MAID - a better experience in Home and Office Cleaning Services.

Based in Stony Plain, we are passionate about improving lives for our clients, employees, and the communities we serve.

Immediate opening for an experienced cleaning professional

Hours: Mon-Fri (occasional weekends offered) 20-30+ hours per week.

Service Area: Parkland County, Stony Plain, Spruce Grove, Edmonton.

Compensation:

$19-22/hr based on performance

>20km mileage subsidy

Paid kit maintenance

Shoe allowance

Performance bonuses

DESCRIPTION

Taking care of our clients' homes requires self-discipline and excellent time management skills. We strive for perfection, working hard to provide the highest level of customer satisfaction possible - a pristine home that our clients have come to expect. We have a passion for making things shine - We hope you have it, too!

We work alone and in teams. We rely on one another and support each other till the job is done, and done right! This means doubling back and checking our teammates' work as well as our own. In this line of work, the success of each individual means the success of the entire team.

Can you see yourself being a part of our organization? We want to meet you!

REQUIREMENTS

  • Physically able to lift 30lbs, reach, bend, crouch, twist, and, kneel
  • Able to load your gear and drive yourself to appointments
  • Over the age of 18
  • Legally eligible to work in Canada
  • Valid driver’s license and reliable vehicle required.

YOU’RE AN IDEAL CANDIDATE IF YOU ARE…

  • Highly motivated, a self-starter with integrity and a strong work ethic.
  • Meticulous, professional, and someone who genuinely loves cleaning.
  • Customer-oriented, caring, and trustworthy.
  • A dependable team player, and an overachiever with a fun attitude.

This position will start with part-time hours moving into full-time. The right candidate will be transitioned from Team Member to Team Lead.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $19.00-$22.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Tips

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Stony Plain, AB: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Experience:

  • Cleaning: 1 year (required)

Expected start date: 2022-04-11

title: MAID Coordinator
description:
Union: ONA Nursing

Location: Forty Green

Work Type: Part Time

Shift: Monday – Friday, Days

Summary:

As a new position within the Quality, Risk and Patient Experience portfolio, the MAID Coordinator is accountable for the development, implementation and supporting delivery of Medical Assistance in Dying services (MAID) for Grand River Hospital’s clinical programs. The Coordinator supports health care providers, patients and family caregivers to access appropriate services and resources based on current legislative protocols and program specific best practice, and in accordance with the clinical and ethical standards of Grand River Hospital. Working autonomously and in a collaborative practice model with physicians, professional pratice, advanced practice colleagues, patient relations and clinical leadership at all levels, the MAID Coordinator will coordinate all aspects of the MAID process including navigation of requests from internal and external sources, assisting with documentation and reporting requirements both provincially and federally, and developing and maintaining a robust repository of education resources.

Qualifications:

  • Current RN (Extended Class) registration with the College of Nurses of Ontario; and/or eligible to write Extended Class exam
  • Masters preferred
  • Completion of an accredited controlled substance course according to College of Nurses of Ontario standard
  • Minimum of 5 years demonstrated experience in a health care setting with a broad knowledge base in health systems navigation
  • Demonstrated knowledge of Medical Assistance in Dying in Canada and Ontario
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively and assertively within an inter professional health care team and with community partners
  • Well-developed communication, interpersonal skills as well as negotiation, consultation and client advocacy skills that keep the patient at the centre of the work
  • Demonstrated ability to support patients, families and staff through crisis situations
  • Demonstrated excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to build effective working relationships and teams
  • Ability to be self-directed and work autonomously
  • Ability to function within a collaborative practice model
  • Ability to promote professional education and advances knowledge through research and scholarly activities
  • Good attendance record
  • Basic Cardiac Life Support required. Advanced Cardiac Life Support an asset

Preferred Qualifications

  • Training and experience in project management
  • Crucial Conversations or equivalent
  • Understanding of communication styles and navigating difficult communication
  • Canadian Nursing Association Certification in Hospice Palliative Care or relevant specialty certification preferred
  • Post-graduate certificate and experience in palliative care
  • 3 to 5 years’ experience in working with MAID, hospice or palliative care


As part of our commitment to the health and safety of our patients, staff and community from COVID-19, subject to any accommodation required by applicable human rights legislation, Grand River Hospital requires that all staff have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada.

APPLICATIONS WILL BE RECEIVED UNTIL THE POSTING IS CLOSED.

Please include a resume with your application in order to ensure that your qualifications are appropriately considered in the hiring process.

Grand River Hospital is committed to fair and equitable employment and in our recruitment and selection practices. We strongly believe in inclusion and diversity within our organization, and welcome all applicants including, but not limited to: racialized communities, all religions and ethnicities, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ2S+ persons, Indigenous people, and all others who may contribute to the further diversification of our Hospital community. We are committed to providing and fostering a respectful workplace for all employees, free from violence and harassment. Grand River Hospital is a proud member of the Canadian Centre for Diversity and Inclusion (CCDI).

Upon individual request, the hospital will endeavour to remove any barrier to the hiring process to accommodate candidates, including those with disabilities. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application, interview or selection processes, please contact Human Resources in advance for assistance.

title: Housekeeper
description:
Elmhirst’s Resort is a family owned and operated year-round Resort business, located on Rice Lake (approximately 25 minutes from Peterborough). Our guests include international travelers, families, groups, and conference delegates. The Housekeeping Team is accountable for general cleanliness of guest cottages, public areas, laundry and guest laundry rooms, meeting rooms, food & beverage outlets.

What do we offer:

- A positive and constructive work environment

- An opportunity to work workday shifts only, full and part time availability

- Fair scheduling, (no “on-call” shifts, collaboration in schedule building)

- Paid 40 min break every shift

- All training is conducted during paid shifts, on the job training

- Staff meals during all shifts

- Opportunities for professional development and cross train with other Resort departments

- Access to resort facilities at no charge, some restrictions apply

- Regular performance reviews

- A culture that is diverse and inclusive (2SLGBTQIA+ Chamber of Commerce, Rainbow Registered Accredited)

- A beautiful rural, lakefront environment and a real commitment to sustainability (Sustainable Tourism 2030 Gold Certified member)

- Recognized as a leader in hospitality careers and employment (TIAO Tourism Employer of the Year 2019)

Housekeeper Responsibilities:

- Ensuring cottages are clean and perfectly staged for guest arrival

- Maid service and towel exchange, refreshing conference rooms

- Laundry of towels, linens, bedding and dining room napkins

- Working to standards outlined in company manuals

- Reports to Supervisor on duty

- Handling special requests (crib deliveries, welcome packages)

- Working as part of the Housekeeping Team in conjunction with other departments

- Working without supervision on occasion

- Keen attention to detail

- Complete spring and fall cleaning in cottages

- Driving company vehicle on property in a responsible manner

- Adhere to a health and safety protocols

- Always display a professional appearance

- Other tasks identified by Supervisor as required

Requirements

- This position requires physical activity (making beds, moving furniture, vacuuming, dusting, lifting laundry from commercial washers to dryers, spring and fall cleaning duties)

- Able to lift 40lbs

- Ability to work day time, weekday, weekend and holiday shifts

- Previous experience an asset but not required

Work Remotely

  • No

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent, Seasonal
Part-time hours: 24-40 per week

Salary: From $17.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Overtime pay
  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Discounted or free food
  • Employee assistance program
  • Flexible schedule
  • On-site gym
  • On-site parking
  • Store discount

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Holidays
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability
  • Weekends only

COVID-19 considerations:
Elmhirst's Resorts follows all COVID safety protocols set out by the Ontario Government and Peterborough Public Health.

title: Room Attendant
description:
Harrison Hot Springs Resort is currently recruiting for the position of Room Attendant -

(Temporary Staff Accommodation available)

About our company:

Harrison Hot Springs and the Eastern Fraser Valley is a beautiful place to live, work and play.
We would love to have you join our amazing team and share the high quality of life that we
have come to enjoy.

At Harrison Hot Springs Resort, our guests discover a location unlike any other destination in
the world. We know the care and customer service we offer our guests leads to special
experiences for them. We endeavour to exceed guest expectations and deliver outstanding
products and hospitality services. Even though we welcome thousands of guests each year, we
will focus on individuals and what we can do to make them feel like they are at home.

Overlooking Harrison Lake, the Harrison Hot Springs Resort offers the following amenities: five
mineral hot springs pools, the Healing Springs Spa, three restaurants and a coffee bar, extensive
banquet and catering options, Resort Golf Course and Resort Marina.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

1. Reports for scheduled shift in complete uniform, signs -in on; Housekeeping sign-in
sheet collects zone sheets, room attendant task sheet, and signs for daily pass keys on
Housekeeping key control at scheduled time.

2. Attends morning meeting with the Manager or Housekeeping Supervisors.
3. Checks ZONE sheet and discusses special instructions with the Manager or

Housekeeping Supervisor.
4. Checks needs lists and bring items listed to assigned floors. (When needed)
5. Places zone sheets on clipboard and keeps zone sheet up to date at all times, by signing

name and a ‘OK” for Vacant and clean rooms or a “ to signify a stay-over room by the
room number. Zone sheet are to never be displayed on a Room Attendants cart when
cart is not attended.

6. Room Attendant is to ensure the cart is well stocked and organized.
7. Checks and maintains vacuum to ensure vacuum brushes are debris free, checks

disposable vacuum bags to ensure bag is not full and empties all cloth vacuum bags on a
daily basis.

8. Begins day with an inspection of hallways, picking up room service tray and placing
them in the appropriate area picking up any debris on carpets or floors ensuring the
absence of cobwebs and dust on hallways furniture (where applicable) spot vacuuming
any areas with excessive debris. Reporting any damage or maintenance / engineering
issues (e.g. ripped wall paper, Burnt out lighting).

9. Begins cleaning vacant and dirty rooms, stay-over room with the make-up sign displayed
and concentrating mainly on “Queued” check-out room and check-out rooms after
11:00 AM, ensuring all check-out room are completed for 4:00 PM check-in times.

10. Enters guest room by knock three times and announcing “Housekeeping”, keeping in
mind that rooms listed on zone sheet, as a stay-over room, displaying a “Do Not Disturb
sign” are not to be disturbed, and rooms that are listed as a check-out room on the daily
zone sheet are not to be entered until after 11:00 AM, unless instructed by the Manager
or Housekeeping Supervisors.

11. Responds willingly to guest requests for immediate service in a guest room keeping in
mind guest security and confidentiality.

12. Props open guest room doors and positions Room Attendant carts while working in a
room to ensure guest and team member safety.

13. Ensures complete cleaning of guest rooms, including patios and windows, and daily
tasks (as specified on Room Attendants’ check-list, to established Resort standards.

14. Ensures “GREENLIFE” recycling procedures are followed to resort standards, changing
linen and placing recyclable items in appropriate bins/bags where applicable. Ensuring
all chemicals are properly labeled and dispended.

15. Lost and found items are to be bagged and labeled with description of item, location of
where item was found, current date and name of room attendant. All lost and found
items are to be brought down to lost and found department at earliest convenience on
daily basis.

16. Ensures all rooms are cleaned ensuring amenities, guest letters and applicable stock is
placed or replaced in rooms to resort standards.

17. Ensures all patios and guest room doors are secured on completion of room cleaning.
Turning out lights and setting heat/air conditioning to appropriate seasonal settings.

18. Reports any suspicious activities or behaviour on the floors to the Manager or
Housekeeping Supervisors.

19. Makes notes of damages or damaged items in rooms and forwards immediate requests
to engineering or maintenance department, all maintenance request or engineering
request not fulfilled during the day must be brought forward to the Manager or
Housekeeping Supervisors.

20. Able to accept constructive criticism from the Manager or Housekeeping Supervisors
and correct any oversight mistakes or changes upon room checks.

21. Keeps and maintains a clean and organized working area all times.
22. Replenishes cart with linen and supplies. Bags dirty rags for delivery to laundry

department and replenishes ragbag with fresh rags. Distributes all recyclable goods to
appropriate containers.

23. Counts remaining linen in Rooms attendant’s linen closet cleans and prepares closet for
next day. (Taking up needs to floors when time permits)

24. Turns in keys, and signs key control to verify return. Turns in zone sheets, daily linen
inventory, daily rooms’ linen inventory, and room attendant daily check list, insuring
that the Manager or Housekeeping Supervisors are aware of any uncompleted rooms,
work orders, or guest concerns at the end of shift.

25. Sign out on the Housekeeping sign -in sheet noting hours worked and initial.
26. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential

duty satisfactorily. And within time frames allotted by resort standards the
requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability

required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with
disabilities to perform the essential functions.

27. Room Attendants are to clean and maintain an average of approximately 14 rooms
during an 8 hours shift, 12 rooms during a 7 hours shift and 10 rooms during a 6 hour
shift.

28. Some stress resulting from daily guest interactions (internal and external), budgetary,
and time constraints.

29. Other job related duties may be assigned.



NIGHT DELIVERIES (Room Attendant)


SUMMARY:

The Night Deliveries (Room Attendant) ensures the comfort of our guests by ensuring turn

down service, deliveries of items requested by guest and cleaning tasks assigned by the

Manager or Housekeeping Supervisor.

1. Deliveries are variable hours but predominately 2:30 PM to 11:30 PM.
2. Night Deliveries person is responsible in receive and confirm all radio calls directed to

deliveries.
3. Night Deliveries include the deliveries of robe, towels and various or additional

amenities
4. Hand in Daily Cot Delivery sheet to front desk at end of shift.
5. Spot check all public washrooms, restaurant outlets washrooms and outdoor change

rooms.
6. Collect and make up all cot and cribs remaining in resort hallways or Housekeeping.
7. Restock Housekeeping cupboards of all supplies needed.
8. Vacuum Housekeeping out area including seamstress area.
9. Pick up list for turn down service from front desk area before 6:30 PM.
10. Mange and perform all nightly turn downs
11. Deliver needs to the Room Attendant cupboards as specified on the needs list, including

water to the appropriate cupboards on odd and even days.
12. Ensure new linen is delivered and dirty linens are picked up from the Healing Springs Spa

before 9:00 PM.
13. Clean and organize night maid desk.
14. Clean Housekeeping lunch room.


END OF SHIFT TASKS

1. Complete all paperwork detailing all deliveries and completed tasks.
2. Ensure uniform door is shut at end of shift.
3. Turn off radio and plug in to appropriate charger.
4. Ensure back door, back door with lock, housekeeping linen door are locked and secured.
5. Hand in completed task sheet under door in housekeeping office.
6. Hand in keys.


SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Minimum 1 year of proven previous work history in a high-paced, physically demanding
work environment preferred
  • Minimum 1 year of proven previous cleaning work history preferred
  • Ability to safely lift, push, pull, carry, possibly up to 50 pounds depending on the task
required
  • Proven ability to carry out instructions in standardized situations
  • Ability to work with tight deadlines in an efficient manner
  • WHMIS preferred
  • Ability to observe all safety procedures when handling chemicals
  • Proven previous experience as both an independent worker and as a team player
required
  • Ability to communicate effectively with all internal and external guests
  • Ability to prioritize efficiently and provide service based on prompt service of changing
guests’ needs
  • Proven ability to follow company and resort standards, rules and regulations
  • Proven ability to multi-task and take direction well required
  • Proven Safe Work and reliable attendance record required
  • Proven organizational skills required
  • Being multi-lingual is an asset
  • Flexible to a changing schedule


Interested, qualified candidates are invited to submit their resume and cover letter to
hhshr@harrisonresort.com or facsimile at 604-796-4712.

We thank all candidates in advance for your interest in our resort; however, only those
qualified candidates will be contacted.


ONLY APPLICANTS LEGALLY ELIGIBLE TO WORK IN CANADA WILL BE CONSIDERED

Work Setting

  • Vacuum carpeting, area rugs, draperies and upholstered furniture

title: newOperations Manager, Cleaning Company
description:
Miraculous Maids provides homeowners in our local community with superior cleaning services. With 10+ years of experience in the cleaning industry, our maids have the systems, structures, and training to make your home look miraculous!. Miraculous Maids is part of the Mosaic Home Services Group, and we are looking to add to our leadership team.


The successful candidate will have experience in the Edmonton cleaning market and be accountable for the overall business operations of the company. Reporting to the President of Mosaic Home Services, the role will be supported by the Leadership Team in the execution of Miraculous Maid’s growth and operational objectives.


Key responsibilities and areas of focus for this role:

  • Executing on sales and operational targets
  • Understanding and meeting expectations of customer cleaning experience
  • Leadership to 5 - 10 cleaning teams
  • Scheduling and monitoring of project execution
  • Inspects the work on an ongoing basis to ensure performance is at the expected levels.
  • Assists with site training of new cleaning personnel
  • Trains and implements Health & Safety procedures
  • Respond to customer and team requests and ensure follow up.
  • Responsible for inventory control and supplies management

The successful candidate will have the following:

  • 2+ years cleaning and supervisory experience
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities, and execute tasks with minimal supervision.
  • High-level communication skills, Spanish is valuable
  • Experience working to meet and exceed targets

title: newCleaning and Sanitation -Part-Time Production Worker (Night...
description:
Facility Location- Calgary

Work Location -

Posting Locations - Calgary

Department - Calgary Production Team 4

Job Function - Warehouse Operations

Employee Type - Regular Employee PT Hourly

Shift/Hours –

About Us

Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!


Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.


We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love.


We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.


Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy®, and A&W®.

Responsibilities

  • Shift: Night Shift 11:30pm-6:45am
  • Pay: $21.13/hour


  • Clean and sanitize as per company requirements
  • Follow cleaning and sanitation schedule and other instructions for cleaning/sanitizing.
  • Regularly perform heavy lifting, up to 40 lbs
  • External cleaning of equipment
  • Chemical preparation as per company policies.
  • Internal and external cleaning and sanitation of equipment; foaming of surfaces
  • Read production schedule, Sanitation matrix to perform required CIP
  • Perform testing to check concentration of chemicals
  • Maintain proper documentation; ensure all logs are properly and accurately recorded.
  • Work within the confines of company safety, food safety and environmental policies.
  • Work at heights - on genie boom and scissor lift as required.

Qualifications

  • High School Diploma or GED preferred
  • 1-3 year of general work experience required
  • Prior production/manufacturing machine operation experience preferred
  • Previous experience within high-speed industrial environment
  • Ability to operate manufacturing equipment
  • Ability to stand for long periods of time and complete repetitive tasks
  • Knowledge of industrial technology a plus

Important

All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada Bottling”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification and drivers abstract review. Please advise the Talent Acquisition team if you have any questions or concerns in regards to this once you are contacted for further consideration.


Coke Canada Bottling is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce with several programs, policies and resources in place to support our people. For individuals requiring accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-844-383-2653 or email HR@cokecanada.com.

For more information about Coke Canada Bottling, please visit cokecanada.com

title: Barman(maid)
description:
Ta mission :

  • Interagir avec les clients, prendre les commandes, préparer et servir les boissons alcoolisées ou non alcoolisées pour les clients du bar et du restaurant ;
  • Évaluer les besoins et préférences des clients et leur faire des suggestions ;
  • Vérifier les papiers des clients pour savoir s’ils ont l’âge légal de consommer de l’alcool ;
  • Remplir et refaire le stock d’ingrédients et d’accessoires pour le bar ;
  • Respecter toutes les réglementations en matière de nourriture et de boissons ;
  • Accueillir la clientèle de façon courtoise ;
  • Renseigner la clientèle sur les différents produits et services offerts sur le site ;
  • Opérer une caisse et gérer les paiements ;
  • S’assurer quotidiennement de la propreté du lieu de travail ;
  • Effectuer son dépôt et sa fermeture de caisse ;
  • Prévenir les responsables en cas de difficulté d’intervention ;
  • Exécuter toutes autres tâches connexes.

Ton bagage et ta personnalité :

  • Attitudes et comportement professionnels (aptitudes pour le travail d’équipe, autonomie, dynamisme, entregent, honnêteté, polyvalence, sens de l’initiative, sens de l’organisation, positivisme, etc.) ;
  • Aptitudes pour le service à la clientèle ;
  • Capacité à garder un bar rangé, rempli et propre ;
  • Connaissance minimale du français et de l’anglais. La maîtrise d’autres langues constitue un atout ;
  • Connaissance du milieu événementiel un atout ;
  • Leadership et capacité de prise de décisions ;
  • Bonne tolérance au stress.

Horaire : Horaire variable selon l’achalandage et la météo (jour, soir et fin de semaine)

La personne qui occupera le poste devra se conformer à l’ensemble des politiques de la société notamment celle en matière de vaccination pour la Covid-19.

Type d'emploi : Temps plein, Temps partiel, Contrat à durée déterminée, Saisonnier
La durée du contrat : 3 mois

Avantages :

  • Événements d'Entreprise
  • Nourriture à Prix Réduit ou Gratuite
  • Programme d'Aide aux Employés
  • Réductions Tarifaires
  • Stationnement sur place

Horaire :

  • Du Lundi au Vendredi
  • Toutes les fins de semaine

Rémunération supplémentaire :

  • Pourboires

Date limite de candidature : 2022-05-01
Date de début prévue : 2022-06-01

title: newFull-time and part-time house cleaners
company: Merry Maids of Brampton, Bolton, Caledon &...
description:
Looking for a fun place to work, with a flexible schedule and competitive pay? Then come live the Merry MaidsTM life!

As a Merry Maids team member, you will belong to an award-winning company and become a part of a close-knit team – a team that works together to provide the best cleaning solutions and customer service to our clients.

Whether you’re looking for a full-time career or a more flexible part-time job to supplement your income, we’re here to support you. Merry Maids depends on exceptional teammates, just like you, to provide our award-winning service while enriching your own life.

Ready to create brighter days for you and your customers?

Unlike the competition, with Merry Maids you will get:

  • Flexible schedules that work for you! Whether you need full-time or part-time, we understand that life is complicated, and things come up.
  • Get paid for the entire time you work, including time spent in the car, scheduling, and other duties, not just the hours you’re in-home cleaning.
  • You clean the homes; we clean the supplies. No more bringing home rags and towels to clean in your own time. We’ll take care of the laundry, so you can take care of the clients!
  • Paid gas. We understand it’s expensive to get around, that’s why Merry Maids will always compensate you for your time, mileage, and gas.
  • We keep track of customer keys, so you don’t have to worry about more than you should. The only time you’ll be responsible for a customer’s keys is when you are going to/from a customer’s home, otherwise we keep them safe and locked up in our office.
  • We communicate with the clients, so you can spend time focusing on the cleaning. Running late? Need to re-schedule? We will liaise with the clients to ensure everyone is always on the same page.
  • We offer real opportunities for advancement. You have ambitions and we want to cultivate them, which is why we offer genuine opportunities for advancement within our company. We understand what an asset a hard-working employee is, which is why we reward those who work hard for us!

Benefits

  • No night, weekend, or holiday work
  • Guaranteed weekly pay (from $17 per hour plus tips)
  • Weekly bonuses based on performance
  • Paid training
  • Paid gas
  • Paid mileage
  • Employee discounts and benefits
  • Extended health care, Costco memberships and CAA memberships
  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Full time and part-time positions available
  • A supportive and uplifting team environment
  • Additional benefits vary by franchise, so contact us today to learn more!

Job Duties & Responsibilities

Merry Maids is one of the largest home cleaning companies in the world, with 900 franchise locations across North America. We strive to provide our customers with the best possible service, allowing them to spend more time with their friends and families.

Whether you work with us as a solo house cleaner or as part of a close-knit team, you will deliver each cleaning using Merry Maids’ world-class cleaning methods and customer service. All our cleaners double as brand ambassadors, ensuring that each client’s day is brightened by bringing Merry Maids into their home.

  • Preparing cleaning products for the day
  • Loading cleaning products and equipment into a vehicle
  • Using cleaning products and procedures to provide an exceptional clean in customers’ homes
  • Cleaning, dusting, and vacuuming bedrooms, living rooms, dining rooms, family rooms, etc.
  • Cleaning and sanitizing kitchens and bathrooms
  • Vacuuming and washing hard surface floors on hands and knees
  • Cleaning and dusting light fixtures, baseboards, doors, door frames, and windowsills
  • Moving reasonably light furniture in rooms to clean under and behind
  • Operating a company car or personal motor vehicle to transport team members, materials, and cleaning supplies to each home (where necessary)
  • Working in a safe and methodical manner
  • Contributing to a positive work environment with a pleasant attitude, punctuality, and a team player mindset
  • Having respect and an understanding for co-workers and customers
  • Taking pride and being passionate about the work you do

Qualifications

  • Must have a valid work permit and reside in Canada
  • An own vehicle, valid driver’s licence and clean driving record is an asset
  • Clean police record
  • Strong references
  • A great attitude and ability to commit to the team
  • Ability to differentiate between cleaning products and uses
  • Ability to read cleaning instructions
  • Strong communication, interpersonal, customer service, and time management skills
  • Ability to lift and carry 20 lbs of equipment
  • Ability to withstand regular physical contact with dog and cat hair, mold, dust, mildew, and cleaning solutions
  • Ability to drive to and from various job sites

title: Summer Cleaning Positions Available
description:
No evenings, Weekends or Holidays.
**
**
As a house cleaner on the Merry Maids team, you will use specialized Merry Maids cleaning products and procedures to provide clients with exceptional home cleaning services that ensure customer satisfaction is consistently maintained.
This Ottawa house cleaning job does not require evening or weekend work. All applicants would be required to travel to our office at 2620 Lancaster Road daily before leaving to clean client homes. Please consider this before submitting your application. It is recommended you live within the local area before applying.

What we will be looking for in a solo cleaner:
**
**
We are looking for people who know what hard work is. They know the feeling of satisfaction that comes after putting in a hard day’s work. It does not matter if you are a college graduate or a high school graduate. We are simply looking for people who want a fulfilling career with Merry Maids.

Our expectations:
**
**
This is a physical job, and we hold our staff and ourselves to a very high level of cleaning perfection. We work for our clients to ensure they are satisfied with our results. High-quality cleaning services are very important to maintaining the Merry Maids brand.

Minimum requirements:
**
**
A valid Canadian Drivers license and liability insurance are required
Having a reliable vehicle is a plus but is not required. You may be required to take your own vehicle at times, however, if you do your mileage costs will be reimbursed.

Time commitment and Schedule:
**
**
As a Merry Maids Cleaner, you would work Monday to Friday from 8:00 am to 5:30 pm.

Perks:
**
· Starting pay $18.00/Hr
· Option to group benefits after the probation period
· Bonuses
· Paid vehicle mileage
· Tips

If you think you might have what it takes to work for Merry Maids contact us today. Please note that only serious candidates need apply
Location: 2620 Lancaster Road, Ottawa, Ontario K1B 4Z4
Hide

Location: 2620 Lancaster Road, Ottawa, Ontario K1B 4Z4

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent

Salary: $18.00-$21.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care

title: newRoom Attendant - FT
description:
NOTE: We are currently not recruiting foreign workers. Please only apply if you are living in Canada and are legally able to work in Canada.

This job is "MAID" for you! (pun intended) We are looking for the BEST Room Attendants! Come work with the BEST Housekeeping Team!

Let's start with the GREAT benefits!

Benefits:

  • Up to 6 Discounted Mayfield Dinner Theatre Tickets
  • 50% Discount in Stages Restaurant & Bar
  • Extensive Hilton Discounted Room Rates
  • Health, Dental, Vision, STD, Life

Each year we survey Team Members about what excites them the most about working at Hilton so we can build on the positive aspects of their experiences at work. Here’s what they have said:

· The people I work with

· Opportunities to grow my career

· Pride in the brand

· Connections with guests and customers

· Meaningful and fun work

· Special and Unique benefits

Major Responsibilities:

Completes assigned rooms during shift, including check outs and stay overs. Reports any delays in completing assigned rooms as soon as aware.

  • Vacuuming carpets and sweeping floors
  • Washing / steaming floors
  • Dusting, brushing, polishing and vacuuming furniture
  • Dusting and cleaning room decorations, appliances and structural surfaces (e.g. wall fixtures, window sills, vents)
  • Changing linen and making beds, checking for damaged or stained linen
  • Cleaning showers, tubs, sinks and bathroom items
  • Ensures proper guest supplies, amenities, and advertising are in the rooms.
  • Ensures the security of keys and guest information, as well as individual safety while cleaning.
  • Ensures guest requests are met by either fulfilling the request or reporting it to a leader.
  • Consistently ensures room cleanliness meets Hilton standards.

Skills, Knowledge and Abilities Required:

  • Must be extremely fit as the position is very physical
  • Energetic and flexible, able to work under pressure
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Self-motivated, honest, creative, capable of working in a team environment

Experience, Training and Education (demonstrating requirements):

  • Minimum one year hotel cleaning experience is preferred.
  • Previous customer service experience is an asset
  • WHMIS training

This job posting is for a position at a hotel that is owned and operated by an independent franchisee (SilverBirch Hotels & Resorts). The franchisee controls all aspects of the hotel’s employment practices, including recruiting, hiring, salary, benefits and compensation decisions, and the collection and processing of the personal data that you provide on this website. If you accept this position, you will be employed by a franchisee and not by Hilton. You will not be eligible from compensation or benefits from Hilton. You will be eligible for compensation or benefits only as may be provided to you by the independent franchisee.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: $17.30 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Discounted or free food
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site gym
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • Store discount
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Holidays
  • Monday to Friday
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

Application question(s):

  • Have you ever done housekeeping in a hotel before? If so - how many rooms per day would you complete?"
  • Shifts are typically 8 am - 4:30 pm. Do you have any limitations to working that shift on any day in the week?
  • Do you currently reside in Canada?

Experience:

  • Housekeeping: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • WHMIS Certification (preferred)

title: newHousekeeper
description:
**
Housekeeper – Flexible Schedule/NO Nights or Weekends
**
Benefits:
· Never work weekends again - NO nights, weekends, or holidays
· Be home for dinner every night
· Paid weekly
· Paid training

Role:
· Provide basic housekeeping duties, including vacuuming, dusting, mopping, and cleaning bathrooms**
· Create a clean and healthy environment for your customers and their families
· Deliver great customer service**
**
Requirements:
· Available Monday – Friday, 7:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.
· Driver’s license
· Must love pets!
· Reliable transportation to drive to homes

Why Merry Maids?
For over 40 years, Merry Maids has created clean homes and given customers peace of mind. As a Merry Maids team member, you’ll make a difference in the lives of your customers. We do more than just clean houses, we give people back time in their busy schedules. Our Merry Maids team values are focused on support and family. The health and safety of our team members and customers is a top priority. We provide personal protective equipment, follow social distancing guidelines, and have disinfecting procedures in place.

Do you love working with others and making a difference in people’s lives? Then we’d love to have you join our Merry Maids family!
Additional Information
Merry Maids is a great opportunity whether you’re looking for a part-time or full-time job. No previous house cleaning experience is needed and training is provided to you. Government issued driver's license required. If you have previous job experience working in customer service, hospitality, healthcare, retail, or restaurants, Merry Maids is the perfect place to put your experience to work. Career advancement opportunities are available in training, quality assurance, office management, and sales.

Location: 1841 Oak Bay Avenue, Victoria, British Columbia V8R 1C4

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $20.00-$24.00 per hour

title: Full-time house cleaner
description:
no evenings, weekends or holidays!

As a house cleaner on the Merry Maids team, you will use specialized Merry Maids cleaning products and procedures to provide clients with exceptional home cleaning services that ensure customer satisfaction is consistently maintained. This Ottawa house cleaning job does not require evening or weekend work.

All applicants would be required to travel to our office at 301 Moodie Drive daily before leaving to clean customer’s homes. Please consider this before submitting your application. It is recommended you live within the local area before applying.


What we want in a cleaner:

We’re looking for people who know what hard work is. They know the feeling of satisfaction that comes after putting in a hard day’s work. We don’t care if you’re a college graduate or a high school graduate. We’re looking for people who want a fulfilling career with Merry Maids. We’re looking for people who want to join the Merry Maids team and grow our business together. The more we succeed as individuals, the more we all succeed together.

Our expectations:

This is a physical job and we hold our staff and ourselves to a very high level of cleaning perfection. We work for our customers to ensure they’re happy with our results. High-quality cleaning services are integral to maintaining the Merry Maids brand.

Minimum requirements

  • A valid Ontario driver’s licence, reliable transportation and liability insurance are required
  • Your transportation costs will be reimbursed

Time commitment

  • As a Merry Maids Cleaner you would work Monday to Friday from 8:00 am – 5:00 pm.

Perks:

  • Bonuses
  • Paid vehicle mileage reimbursement

If you think you might have what it takes to work for Merry Maids contact us today. Please note that only serious candidates need apply.
