title: Room Attendant
company: Home2 Suites par Hilton Montréal Dorval
description:
Room Attendant

The Home2 Suites by Hilton Montréal Dorval is looking for a Room Attendant to join our team and provide excellent customer service to our hotel guests.

Room attendant responsibilities include changing towels, making beds and cleaning bathrooms. You will also address clients’ queries and make sure our rooms are fully stocked, clean and inviting at all times. Ultimately, you will ensure a pleasant and comfortable experience for our guests during their stay with us.

Responsibilities

· Change bed linen and make beds

· Replace used towels

· Sweep and mop floors

· Vacuum carpets

· Dust furniture

· Replenish bath care products (e.g. soap and shampoo)

· Clean public areas, like corridors

· Report any technical issues and maintenance needs

· Address guests’ queries (e.g. on additional services)

· Help guests retrieve lost items

· Ensure all assigned rooms are clean and tidy by the end of the shift

· Follow hotel security guidelines

Requirements

· Must be able to communicate in French and English

· Proven work experience as a Room Attendant or Maid is an asset

· Experience with industrial cleaning equipment and products

· Good physical health and stamina

· Flexibility to work on weekends and Holidays

· Ability to work with little or no supervision while meeting high-performance standards

· Excellent organization skills

· Ability to follow instructions

· High school diploma required

__________________________________________________________________________________________

Entretien Ménager

Le Home2 Suites par Hilton Montréal Dorval, est à la recherche de préposé(e) aux chambres pour se joindre à notre équipe et offrir un excellent service à la clientèle à nos clients.

Les responsabilités des préposés aux chambres comprennent le changement des serviettes, le changement de draps et le nettoyage des salles de bain. Vous répondrez également aux demandes des clients et veillerez à ce que nos chambres soient entièrement approvisionnées, propres et invitantes en tout temps. En fin de compte, vous assurerez une expérience agréable et confortable pour nos clients pendant leur séjour avec nous.

Responsabilités

· Changer les draps et faire les lits

· Remplacer les serviettes utilisées

· Balayer et vadrouiller les planchers

· Passer l’aspirateur

· Épousseter les meubles

· Remplacer les produits de bain (par exemple savon et shampoing)

· Nettoyer les espaces publics, comme les couloirs

· Signaler les problèmes techniques et les besoins de maintenance

· Répondre aux requêtes des clients (par exemple sur des services supplémentaires)

· Aidez les clients à récupérer les objets perdus

· S’assurer que toutes les chambres assignées sont propres et rangées à la fin du quart de travail

· Suivez les consignes de sécurité de l'hôtel

Exigences

· Doit pouvoir communiquer en français et en anglais

· Expérience pertinente en service à la clientèle et/ou en entretien ménager sera considéré un atout

· Expérience avec l'équipement et les produits de nettoyage industriel

· Bonne santé physique et endurance

· Flexibilité pour travailler les week-ends et les jours fériés

· Capacité de travailler avec peu ou pas de supervision tout en respectant les normes de rendement élevé

· Excellentes compétences organisationnelles

· Capacité à suivre les instructions

· Diplôme d'études secondaires requis

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent

Salary: $16.00-$17.00 per hour

Additional pay:

title: newHouse Person
description:
Hiring for immediate start!

2$ per hour bonus from May 1st till September 30th

$2.00 per hour housing allowance if you do not need staff housing

$13/night staff housing available

Department: Housekeeping

Position: House person

Reports to: Housekeeping Manager, Housekeeping Supervisor

Primary Function:

The Douglas Fir Resort & Chalets employ House persons that are responsible for cleaning the Resort and maintaining a clean, safe, and fun environment for guests while providing excellent customer service.

Position Responsibilities:

· Ensure all assigned rooms are clean by the 4 pm Check In time.

· Interacts with guests and customers in a positive manner

· Get assignments, keys radio and special guest requests from your supervisor or manager at the beginning of your shift.

· Clean and maintain the cleanliness and appearance of the lobbies, hallways, public restrooms and public areas of the hotel.

· Clean and maintain the appearance of the surrounding outdoor areas of the Resort, including the sidewalks, BBQ area, Garbage and Recycling Bin, Recycling and Wood Shed.

· Clean Pool Deck & Changing Rooms – bring dirty towels to laundry throughout all shifts

· Assist with stripping of rooms and cleaning of fireplaces, decks and check for any maintenance issues.

· Delivery of wood and kindling.

· Maintain the Golf Cars & HSKP Carts.

· Restocking of Maids Room Amenities (Evening House person)

· Collect Dirty Linens and Garbage.

· Cleaning of assigned areas of the Resort including the shampooing of soiled public area carpets, light fixtures, elevators and wood chopping area.

· Chop and bundle kindling.

· Deliver items to guest rooms upon request from the front desk.

· Perform duties of a Room Attendant when necessary.

· Support Room Attendants with moving furniture or heavy items.

· Complying with Health & Safety Standards

· Any other task assigned by the Housekeeping Manager or Housekeeping Supervisor

Qualifications:

· Excellent customer service skills.

· Good cross cultural communication skills and the ability to work with a diverse population.

· Ability to communicate effectively in English, both written and verbal.

· Ability to effectively communicate in both one on one and group settings.

Physical Requirements:

· Ability to frequently walk, run, stand or stoop

· Regularly lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects weighing up to 25 lbs.

· Speech, hearing, literacy, and vision

· Ability to tolerate extreme weather conditions

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $16.00-$20.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Extended health care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

Application question(s):

  • Are you located in the Bow Valley or planning on relocating in the next 2 weeks?

title: Fantastic Cleaners!
description:
Please fill out our job application here: https://bit.ly/3unrSnA

Join the fastest-growing cleaning company in the Fraser Valley! We are a professional cleaning company that specializes in high-quality work, servicing homes and apartment buildings in Abbotsford, Langley & Mission. We are committed to using environmentally friendly and non-toxic cleaning products, for a safer environment for our clients and our employees. As an ever-growing cleaning business, and growing fast, we are now looking to hire service-oriented and positive people like you!

What’s in it For You?

  • Our pay is far above the national average in the industry - up to $25/hour
  • No nights. No Weekends. No major Holidays! (unless you want it!)
  • Flexible schedule. Get as much or as little work as you want!
  • LOW-STRESS work environment - working hard doesn't have to mean stressing hard!
  • Your personal development, health, and wellbeing are essential to us!
  • Weekly pay - You keep all tips! Did we say bonuses too? ;)
  • Leave straight from home. No need to report to an office!

➔ Do you love to make a positive impact on people's lives?

➔ Is punctuality a priority for you?

➔ Are you high energy, and prefer to be active?

➔ Do you thrive in detail-orientated settings?

Then you may be perfect for Maid Fantastic! We are a local, residential cleaning business based in the Fraser Valley. Most of the cleaning involves maintaining high-end homes. We are looking for cleaners who are available to work 15-30 hours a week. The ideal candidate must have access to their own car.

Interviews are taking place immediately

Some Requirements from You

  • Must have a driver's license, insurance, and dependable car
  • Must be able and willing to have us run a background check
  • Authorized to work in Canada
  • Smartphone with texting, camera and GPS
  • Speak fluent English
  • Be motivated to provide excellent service every day!
  • High standard of cleanliness

Skills

  • Excellent time management skills, ability to multitask and maintain schedule while responding to incidents
  • Great interpersonal and communication skills
  • Proactive and the ability to work independently with minimal supervision

What we are looking for

  • Pleasant & Positive Attitude
  • High Energy
  • Dependability
  • Trustworthiness
  • Attention to detail

We look forward to hearing from you!

Please fill out our job application here: https://bit.ly/3unrSnA

**

**

APPLY TODAY, START TRAINING ASAP! We love our employees and they love our clients!

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent, Fixed term contract, Casual, Freelance, Seasonal

Salary: $18.00-$25.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Commuter benefits
  • Company events
  • Flexible schedule
  • On-site parking
  • Store discount
  • Wellness program

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • No weekends
  • On call
  • Overtime

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Langley, BC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Application question(s):

  • Do you have a reliable vehicle to drive?

Licence/Certification:

  • Driver's License (required)

Application deadline: 2022-05-20
Expected start date: 2022-05-23

title: Fulltime Residential Cleaner $18.00 - $21.00/HR
description:
Our Company and Culture

Merry Maids is a professional housecleaning company that offers the best cleaning solutions and customer service to our clients. We are trusted in-home professionals and we work hard to provide clients with a clean home they look forward to coming home too.

We Offer:

· Paid Training · Weekly Pay· Monday to Friday· No Nights, No Weekends, No Evenings· Career Path Opportunities / Hire Within· Positive team atmosphere

Job Description:

Professionally clean client homes using Merry Maids procedures and products. As a team member, it will be your responsibility to provide exceptional customer service in each and very client home.

What we will be looking for in a solo cleaner:

We are looking for people who know what hard work is. They know the feeling of satisfaction that comes after putting in a hard day’s work. It does not matter if you are a college graduate or a high school graduate. We are simply looking for people who want a fulfilling career with Merry Maids.

Responsibilities:

· Use Merry Maids products and procedures to clean client homes.· Use provided equipment including vacuums and microfiber cleaning cloths and mop.· Clean all surfaces in home, including fans, vents, blinds, light fixtures, baseboards, fixtures, counters, showers, toilets, cabinets, and floors.· Ability to clean floors on hands and knees in kitchens and bathrooms.· Vacuum all stairs, carpet, and hard wood.· Carry all cleaning products and equipment to and from office, vehicle, and client homes.· Assist in keeping supplies stocked and maintain equipment.· Contribute to a positive work climate with a pleasant attitude and contribute to the overall team effort including being in proper uniform.· Must be dependable and on time· Has respect and understanding for co-workers and customers

Requirements:

Must have a Canadian Drivers License and be able to drive to and from cleans.

Ability to differentiate between cleaning products and uses

Ability to read cleaning instructions

Strong communication and customer service skills

Ability lift and carry 20 lbs. of equipment

Ability to withstand regular physical contact with dog and cat hair, mold, dust, mildew, and cleaning solutions

This franchise is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this franchisee. All inquiries about employment at this franchisee should be made directly to the franchise location, and not to The ServiceMaster Company, LLC.

title: Cleaner
description:
Commercial Cleaners Wanted

Maid in Heaven is a new company looking to hire a team of cleaners for commercial businesses in Montreal and the Greater Montreal Area. Maid in Heaven staff are to ensure that the spaces to which they are assigned remain tidy and orderly. Our cleaners work in a variety of settings such as office spaces, restaurants, and private establishments. All employees are expected to work successfully alone or with a team.

Both Full Time and Part Time hours are available.

Job Highlights:

- Flexible scheduling (25-40 hours per week)

- Starting from $17 per hour, more depending on experience, with biweekly pay

- Paid gas/kilometre and paid time between job sites

- On the job paid training

- Team of two+ cleaners per job site

- Cleaning products, equipment, two uniforms provided by the company (additional for purchase)

Job Duties:

- Deep cleaning and restocking common areas (common workspace areas, staff room, kitchen, washrooms)

- Sweep, vacuum and mop floors

- Empty trash bins

- Clean interior windows and mirrored surfaces

- Dust shelving and other surfaces as needed

- Baseboard and wall washing

- Other duties as needed depending on the client’s request

Requirements and Qualifications:

- 1-year prior cleaning experience strongly preferred

- Knowledge of cleaning equipment and products

- Integrity and self-motivation as you may work unsupervised

- Ready access to a reliable vehicle

- Clean driving record and a valid driver’s licence

- A clean criminal record (background check will be done prior to hiring)

- Ability to lift 20 pounds, standing for extended periods of time and perform physical tasks (bending, crouching, kneeling, reach above shoulders)

- High attention to detail

- Ability to communicate fluently in French and English

- Ability to work under pressure and complete time deadlines

Expected start date:

Mid-late April

Nettoyeurs commerciaux recherchés

Maid in Heaven est une nouvelle entreprise qui cherche à embaucher une équipe de nettoyeurs pour des entreprises commerciales à Montréal et dans la grande région de Montréal. Le personnel de Maid in Heaven doit s’assurer que les espaces auxquels ils sont affectés restent bien rangés et ordonnés. Nos nettoyeurs travaillent dans une variété de contextes tels que des espaces de bureau, des restaurants et des établissements privés. On s’attend à ce que tous les employés travaillent avec succès seuls ou en équipe.

Des heures à temps plein et à temps partiel sont disponibles.

Faits saillants du poste :

- Horaire flexible (25-40 heures par semaine)

- À partir de 17 $ l’heure, plus selon l’expérience, avec un salaire bi hebdomadaire

- Essence payée/kilomètre et temps payé entre les chantiers

- Formation rémunérée en cours d’emploi

- Équipe de plus de deux nettoyeurs par chantier

- Produits de nettoyage, équipements, deux uniformes fournis par l’entreprise (supplémentaires à l’achat)

Tâches :

- Nettoyage en profondeur et réapprovisionnement des espaces communs (espaces de travail communs, salle du personnel, cuisine, toilettes)

- Balayage, aspirateur et vadrouille des sols

- Poubelles vides

- Nettoyer les fenêtres intérieures et les surfaces en miroir

- Étagères à poussière et autres surfaces au besoin

- Plinthes et lavage mural

- Autres tâches au besoin en fonction de la demande du client

Exigences et qualifications :

- 1 an d’expérience préalable en nettoyage fortement préférée

- Connaissance des équipements et produits de nettoyage

- Intégrité et motivation personnelle car vous pouvez travailler sans supervision

- Accès facile à un véhicule fiable

- Dossier de conduite vierge et permis de conduire valide

- Un casier judiciaire vierge (une vérification des antécédents sera effectuée avant l’embauche)

- Capacité de soulever 20 livres, de rester debout pendant de longues périodes et d’effectuer des tâches physiques (se pencher, s’accroupir, s’agenouiller, atteindre au-dessus des épaules)

- Grande attention aux détails

- Capacité à communiquer couramment en Français et Anglais

- Capacité à travailler sous pression et à respecter les délais

Date de début prévue :

Mi-fin avril

  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

  • Montreal, QC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred)

title: newHouse Cleaner
company: Merry Maids of Uxbridge, Port Perry, Durham North...
description:
Company and Culture At Merry Maids, the goal of our home cleaning company is to provide our customers with the best possible experience and highest quality service. To achieve this, we depend on exceptional teammates, just like you, to be great brand ambassadors that provide outstanding service each and every visit to a customer’s home. Merry Maids clearly understands the value and importance of our teammates, and that investing in them is the first step towards making us a successful company. So, when you join Merry Maids of Uxbridge and Port Perry, you are joining a family that cares and values you, 100%. We Provide:
  • Paid training
  • Competitive weekly paycheques
  • Paid travel expenses and mileage
  • Flexible schedules and working hours to fit your lifestyle
  • A career and growth-oriented culture
  • A caring and supportive team environment. We are a diversified group of individuals that respects each and every member equally. Many of our decisions that drive this business are based on the input of the team as a whole, meaning your voice is welcome and heard. To us, our team members’ safety is paramount and dealt with accordingly. Most of all, we are a truly a family that cares and looks out for each other in every way possible.
Job Description: Whether you work with us as a solo cleaner or as part of a team, you will deliver Merry Maids’ world-class service to every client. You will clean utilizing our unique procedures and products. As a Merry Maids team member, you are also a Merry Maids brand ambassador. This means building a great rapport with clients and ensuring we are providing a completely exceptional experience for them each and every visit. Job Responsibilities:
  • Being a great Merry Maids brand ambassador
  • Using Merry Maids cleaning products, equipment and procedures to provide and exceptional clean in customers’ homes
  • Working in a safe and methodical manner
  • Contributing to a positive work environment with a pleasant attitude, punctuality, and a team player mindset
  • Having respect and an understanding for co-workers and customers
  • Taking pride and being passionate about the work you do
Qualifications:
  • A great attitude and ability to commit to the team
  • Ability to differentiate between cleaning products and uses
  • Ability to read cleaning instructions
  • Strong communication and customer service skills
  • Ability to lift and carry 20 lbs. of equipment
  • Ability to withstand regular physical contact with dog and cat hair, mold, dust, mildew and cleaning solutions
  • Ability to drive to and from various job sites
Disclaimer For Applicants The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by associates assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed. You are free to modify the material, of course, to reflect your individual business. Remember that employment laws and practices change over time and vary significantly from province to province, so you should consult an employment law attorney in your province to determine the appropriateness of practices, policies, and forms for your business. There is no guarantee that following the recommendation will result in business success or that your results will be the same as other franchisees or company stores. Success is determined by many factors including market conditions, which may vary widely as well as individual talents and effort. Merry Maids wants you!

Looking for a fun place to work, with a flexible schedule and competitive pay? Then come and live the Merry Maids™ life!

As a Merry Maids team member, you would belong to an award-winning company and be a part of our close-knit team — a team that works together to provide the best cleaning solutions and customer service to our clients.

We offer paid training, excellent work/life balance and real opportunities for advancement. You may start off as a team member, but you are then able to tailor a career path that matches your interests and goals – including becoming a team captain, trainer, quality assurance supervisor, or manager.

We take great pride in improving our clients' lives by allowing them to spend more time with family or doing activities they enjoy. As trusted in-home professionals, we form strong relationships with our clients and are often considered part of their extended families.

Are you ready to create brighter days for you and our customers?

Apply today!

title: Janitor/Runner
description:
Do you love exploring and playing in the outdoors, making new friends, hanging around the campfire, canoeing, kayaking, stand up paddle boarding, snowboarding, skiing, and snowshoeing? Well we have that, and more. Manning Park Resort is a year round resort located between Hope and Princeton, BC. If you are ready to leave the hustle and bustle of city life, and enjoy outdoor fun and adventure, this is a great place to work. Staff housing is available, so your dream of living in the mountains is part of your adventure at Manning Park Resort.


We are presently searching for our next great team member as a Janitor/Runner to join our Accommodations team. If you can provide our guests with an amazing experience, combined with working as an energetic part of our resort, we want to hear from you.


Responsibilities include: (but not limited to)

  • Ensure the lodge, Loon Lagoon (pool & fitness facility), restaurant, banquet rooms, washrooms and hallways are cleaned to a high standard.
  • General cleaning of public areas including; vacuuming/sweeping/mopping walkways and stairways, dusting and wiping down high touch surfaces, washing windows, removing garbage.
  • Snow removal from building entrances and general outdoor cleaning duties.
  • Follow all Covid-19 protocols for sanitizing public and private areas.
  • Assist the housekeeping team by stripping rooms, loading up carts & trucks and stocking maids rooms.
  • Assist the accommodations team with general duties around the resort.
  • Deliver additional linens & guest amenities to accommodations.
  • Assist with Housekeeping duties as required.


Job Requirements / Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of safety protocols
  • Previous experience as a janitor or custodian
  • Good physical condition, as position can be physically demanding
  • Minimum Class 5 Driver's License
  • Excellent communication skills, as well as excellent problem solving abilities


This is a year round position with a minimum commitment of 6 Months


Benefits:

  • Free Rent - Monthly Utilities of $260 (Including water, hydro, waste & heat)
  • Free Wi-Fi and Calls within Canada & USA
  • Free Seasonal Activities Pass (Alpine & Nordic in Winter, Boathouse in Summer)
  • Free Rentals & Lessons (Alpine & Nordic in Winter, Boathouse in Summer)
  • Monthly onsite Medical & Wellness Services
  • Regular Grocery Pick Up Service
  • Food & Retail Discounts in our Country Store, Pinewoods Restaurant, Bears Den Pub & Daylodge


Be Your Natural Self!

Being your natural self means that you are constantly engaged and empowered to instill change and positivity in the work environment whilst being proud of who you are! We are constantly striving to build and nourish a culture where inclusivity and tolerance are not just the norm, but are the elements which serve as our strength and identity. Being your Natural self means you love everything about the outdoors and are committed to helping preserve the beauty of the land we are on. In caring for our environment and for the natural beauty of Manning Park Resort, we are equally committed to paving the way in building an inclusive environment for everyone and are actively encouraging applicants with differing backgrounds, sexual orientations, and religious beliefs. No regard shall be given to an applicant’s race, religion, skin colour, sexual orientation, and political belief. Applications are reviewed based on merit, bondability, and experience.

title: Residential Cleaner
description:
Cleaning Duties

Are you looking for a career that offers you the ability to advance and improve as a direct result of your performance? Stars A1 Maid Service might be for you. As the leader in residential house cleaning services throughout the Brampton area, we strive to reward the hard work of our dedicated team members. We are always interested in meeting those looking for a house cleaning job in Toronto. For those who desire a long-term working relationship, in turn we try to compensate accordingly.
What You’ll Receive With Stars A1 Maid Service

  • Bi-Weekly paycheque
  • Extensive Bonus Plan (Quaterly bonus Payments)
  • Incentive pay * Paid training
  • Paid vacation and holidays
  • Paid Mileage
  • Fun, friendly atmosphere
  • Career advancement opportunities

Expectations of this house cleaning job: This is a physical job and we hold our staff and ourselves to a very high level of cleaning perfection. We work for our customers to ensure they’re happy with our results. High-quality cleaning services are integral to maintaining the A1 Maids brand. Some of your duties may include but are not limited to:

* Clean residential homes, businesses, or office locations
* Ensure a clean and orderly environment
* Sterilize various tools and equipment
* Move reasonably small furniture as necessary
* Maintain working condition of cleaning equipment

If you like to work and be active during the day, this is a great opportunity for you. Whether you work part-time or full-time, you will be trained to deliver a high-quality cleaning to keep customers happy. Your tasks would include:

  • Vacuuming, and washing all hard surface floors
  • Cleaning light fixtures, baseboards and windowsills
  • Cleaning/dusting under and behind moveable furniture and decorative items (light lifting required)
  • Providing customer service and quality control
  • Reporting/resolving any customer issues before leaving home

Qualifications:
* Previous experience in cleaning, maintenance, or other related fields
* Familiarity with cleaning materials and equipment
* Strong attention to detail
* Strong work ethic
* High school diploma or GED
* Working hours are Monday to Friday from 8:30 am-4:30 pm.
* No weekends or night shifts required
* NO SUMMER STUDENTS, serious candidates only.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Salary: $17.00-$20.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Commuter benefits

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Vaccinated personnel preferred. You must wear a mask and practice social distancing while at our jobs.

Experience:

  • cleaning: 2 years (required)

title: Commercial and Residential Cleaner
description:
Wanted - we are looking to expand our team, and a full time, and part time team member. Part time candidates who work 20+ hours are enrolled in Health/Dental Benefits. Part time must be available for 3 full days/week, which can be different each week, or set, based on your availability. Start time is no later than 8am. We do not do a superficial cleaning, we get into the nooks and crannies, we move furniture, we clean the stank!

Duties would include;
-cleaning of clients homes
-cleaning of businesses
-bending, lifting, moving of furniture
-answering client inquiries
-keeping proper inventory of supplies
-taking payments from clients and recording properly
-problem solving, able to think on your feet

What we offer
-positive, upbeat work environment
-paid uniforms
-dental, vision, health plan benefits
-life insurance
-vehicle maintenance assistance for drivers
-daily gas allowance
-paid training
-premium for working weekends

Employment Requirements
-must have valid licence and a reliable vehicle, and a safe driver.
-must have clean criminal record
-must be available between the hours of 7am-5pm
-not afraid of animals, rodents or nasty smells (we are cleaning toilets)
-a Non-smoker preferred, but not a requirement
-must follow CPHO guidelines during current pandemic, and be comfortable wearing a mask while working
-ability to stand, bend, lift, and work at a steady pace. (we do have deadlines in homes)

title: Cleaner / Housekeeper - Medical Benefits - Langley
description:
Our team is growing! You too could be part of this amazing group of Home Service Professionals.

Other great news? If you have your licence and become a Route Manager, you could get access to a company car 24/7. We pay for insurance and your mileage during the workday, you need only worry about the gas you use on your personal time.

Here are just a few other highlights of working with our team:

  • Work Monday-Friday, day time hours. That’s right! Your evenings and weekends are your own!
  • We offer extended medical and dental benefits for our team members.
  • Access to a company car for Route Managers and to use the vehicle on evenings and weekends. Pick up and drop off at home for Route Assistants.
  • We provide an opportunity for growth, moving from Assistant Manager to Route Manager with opportunities to advance into a Supervisor role.
  • We like to celebrate as a team, summer BBQs, holiday parties and the annual MOLLY MAID Day to name a few.
  • Work independently in a team of two – we put trust in our teams to get the job done!
  • Potential to earn more than $26 per hour.
  • No need to stress over what to wear – our team uniforms take a little pressure off of your morning routine.
  • We provide you with Personal Protective Equipment for your cleans.
  • Oh, and you can cancel your gym membership, you’re going to earn your steps in this role!
  • We provide on-the-job training that you actually get paid for.
  • We are proud supporters of our community.
  • We also understand that not all appointments can be done after hours, we work with you to give you the flexibility to take care of yourself and your family.

What a strong team member looks like:

  • You like to work and take pride in doing the best job for the best cleaning brand in Canada.
  • Your friendly manner and professional attitude make team members and customers alike want to work with you.
  • Hard work is what you live for.
  • You want to work between 25 and 35 hours per week.
  • Have a clean criminal record check'

title: Housekeeping Room Attendant
description:
Position Description: Housekeeping Room Attendant

Come join our fun! As a 111-room boutique hotel we have a team that works closely together on a daily basis. Be more then just a member of the department, be a part of the OSI family. We are currently seeking individuals to join our team as Housekeeping Room Attendants. We have both part time and full-time positions available for the right candidate.

Our Room Attendants maintain the quality of guest room and public space cleanliness according to standards, policies and procedures as established by the housekeeping department. We ensure that all guest requests are honoured while being hospitable to guests, providing assistance and answering questions to enhance guest's visits at the hotel. Room Attendants also communicate room deficiencies to management and maintenance department.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Ability to work as a member of a team in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to follow instructions from supervisors.
  • Some written and oral communication skills.
  • Previous housekeeping experience is an asset, but willing to train the right candidate.
  • Must be able to provide criminal reference check.
  • WHMIS and/or First Aid training an asset.

PHYSICAL/ENVIRONMENTAL:

  • Physically fit to endure lifting, stretching, bending, kneeling and climbing stairs.
  • Maybe exposure to certain weather while cleaning outside rooms, i.e. heat, snow, rain.
  • Regular exposure to cleaning chemicals, such as, but not limited to, general purpose disinfectant, glass cleaner, furniture polish, carpet stain remover etc.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • To prioritize room cleaning assignments in order to complete rooms in most efficient manner for guest satisfaction and to meet check-in deadlines.
  • To maintain clean hallways, including vacuuming, cleaning mirrors and windows.
  • To adhere to the lost and found procedures as established by Old Stone Inn management.
  • To adhere to policies and procedures as determined by Management and/or Housekeeping Department of the Old Stone Inn.
  • Room cleaning, includes but is not limited to:
  • Stripping rooms of garbage and used linen and terry
  • Making beds
  • Cleaning and disinfecting tubs, toilets and sinks
  • Flushing Jacuzzi and whirlpool tubs
  • Dusting furniture including, desk, dresser, TV, armoire, wardrobe, etc
  • Stocking amenities, towels, condiments, coffee, tea, etc.
  • Cleaning coffee stations
  • Vacuuming and washing floors
  • Cleaning mirrors and windows
  • Maintain an orderly cart and closet
  • Keep inventory control of beverages provided in the guest rooms. As well as reporting usage as per the policy set forth by the Old Stone Inn management.
  • To complete deep cleaning/project cleaning/special assignments such as preventative maintenance and carpet stains.
  • To maintain a well-kept work area including, but not limited to hallways and public spaces. Which includes maids’ carts and returning those carts to a closet or room when not in use.
  • To ensure the Old Stone Inn health and safety and emergency procedures and practices are followed.
  • To participate in daily team meeting.
  • Any other duties as assigned.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $16.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Discounted or free food
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift

Application question(s):

  • Are you currently located within the Niagara Region?

Experience:

  • Cleaning: 1 year (preferred)

Language:

  • English (preferred)

Shift availability:

  • Day Shift (required)

title: newMaid Service $18-$25/hour (willing to train)
description:
DUST BUSTERS is the company everyone's talking about!

We are a small FAMILY here and take care of each other no matter what! We are extremely giving people, and work HARD towards a common goal! If you want to join a family like this, read on!

DUST BUSTERS Cleaning service is a local, residential, house cleaning company looking to grow our team by recruiting A players who want to make a difference!

This job provides lasting satisfaction, great exercise, new skills, and personal responsibility.

One important requirement is that you must be friggin AWESOME!

What We Provide:

  • Health Benefit
  • Paid Vacation
  • Comprehensive Paid Training. This isn't like cleaning your own home. We are going to show you how the pros do it!
  • Positive Work Environment - Negativity & drama are not welcome here.
  • Fun Work Environment - We work hard AND play harder!
  • Weekly Compensation - Our cleaners average $500 - $700+ per week plus tips
  • No Nights or Weekends required
  • Advancement Opportunities
  • Emphasis on Personal Growth
  • Apply Today Start Tomorrow!

How Do We Define AWESOME!

  • Go-Getter: You have a hard time sitting at a desk all day because you like to move and stay busy? You Follow Directions and have a keen EYE FOR DETAIL - you notice little things that others miss!
  • Excellent Communication: You know how to listen to others and express yourself clearly.
  • Must LOVE Cleaning: we thrive on ensuring our clients experience the feeling of entering a clean environment. To be successful, you must feel the same way. This is essential.
  • Early Bird: You are a morning person who loves to start their day with a BANG!!
  • Optimistic: You see the glass as half full & don't allow challenges to detail your day.
  • eagerness to Grow & Learn: You give 100% all the time are always looking for the opportunity to improve. You like feedback and strive to do your best. ABCD always going above and beyond the call of duty!
  • You can rub your belly & pat your head a the same time. When given big projects with many small pieces, you say "BRING IT ON!"

COVID-19 considerations:
We use the protocols we have always used. If employees are sick, they need to stay home and take care of themselves. If clients are sick, they will communicate the same to us.
We respect all necessary precautions when cleaning and clean like we always have as a professional cleaning company. Regular hand washing. Cleaners have to option for mask wearing or not.

title: Residential Cleaner
description:
Hi there!

We are a local residential cleaning company here in Vancouver, BC who focuses on cleaning apartments in Downtown Vancouver with a growing team of fun, honest and hardworking staff. We are all about being positive and creating a happy working environment that we all love to be at!

We are excited to hire more great people as our happy client list keeps growing so we need extra help!

We have dedicated team drivers who can drop you off at each clean along with all of the supplies which we provide.

Below are the positions we are hiring for and we think you might be a great fit for are:

1.) Part-time/Casual positions: You get to choose the days and hours (minimum of 15 hours/week) you are available each week and we send you cleanings during those times. Our starting pay is $17/hour for these part-time cleanings + bonuses for performance and positive reviews.

OR

2.) Full-time position: We are looking for a team member who is available to clean for 30-40 hours/week. We will provide you with rides to/from cleaning jobs and all supplies and the starting pay will be $20/hour.

If you are interested please apply with your resume and phone number and we will contact you.

Thanks!

title: CLEANING $18/HR + TIPS!! MONDAY TO FRIDAY ONLY
description:
If you need part-time leading up to full time, we can help. Merry Maids of Ottawa is looking for people to join our successful cleaning team.

As a House Cleaner on the Merry Maids team, you will use specialized Merry Maids’ cleaning products and procedures to provide clients with exceptional home cleaning services that ensure customer satisfaction is consistently maintained. This position does not require evening or weekend work.

Why Work with Merry Maids?
  • Team members make $18.00 to $21.00 per hour including travel time.
  • Weekly pay check via direct deposit
  • No night, weekend or holiday work
  • Paid vacation and holidays
  • Paid training
  • Health Benefits
  • Use of company car or paid mileage for personal vehicle
  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Fun, friendly atmosphere

Your Responsibilities:
  • Sweep, vacuum, and wash all hard surface floors
  • Clean all hanging light fixtures, baseboards and windowsills
  • Clean under and behind portable furniture and decorations (light lifting required)
  • Provide customer service and quality control as needed

Here’s All You Need to Apply:
  • High school diploma or GED.
  • Valid driver’s license. (G2 or G license)

Here at Merry Maids, we take COVID very seriously. We do daily health assessments of each employee and provide PPE if needed. Our equipment is disinfected between every home with hospital grade products to ensure the safety of both our employees and our loyal customers. We are taking every precaution to keep out work place happy and safe through this difficult time.

This franchise is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this franchisee. All inquiries about employment at this franchisee should be made directly to the franchise location, and not to The ServiceMaster Company, LLC.

title: Lodge Housekeeper/Server
description:
Wilderness North is an adventure tourism operator based in Thunder Bay, Ontario. Through our fly-in properties along the Albany and Ogoki River watersheds, we offer a variety of exceptional outdoor-centered guest experiences, from traditional fishing trips to adventure tourism. We cater to many different types of guests, all looking for a relaxing stay in the wilderness. We are seeking positive, outgoing, and motivated individuals to serve as housekeeper/servers at our remote full service lodges.

Housekeepers/servers work together with a team of five or six other lodge staff to ensure an exceptional experience for our guests. As this is a customer service oriented position, Housekeepers/servers must be well groomed, professional, and courteous to staff and guests at all times.Daily housekeeping/maid service involves mopping/vacuuming cabin floors, cleaning bathrooms and refilling toiletries, washing and sanitizing counter tops, making beds, collecting garbage and sorting recycling refuse in proper bins, polishing kitchen appliances, and laundry service for all linens and staff clothing. Meal service may include delivering coffee to guest rooms in the early morning, setting dining room tables appropriately for meals, waiting on tables (breakfast & dinner), helping to make sandwiches and put together shore lunch kits, and offering assistance when required.

Candidates should maintain a positive attitude under pressure and exhibit a strong work ethic. The position requires initiative, creativity, flexibility, willingness to take on multiple tasks, and the ability to cheerfully deal with the unexpected. Candidates must be able to think on their feet and are expected to creatively problem-solve and adapt to changing conditions. A valid First Aid certificate and proof of COVID-19 vaccination is required.

Positions run through September. Candidates must be able to live and work in a wilderness environment as part of a close-knit team. Competitive starting salaries are based on experience and are in addition to room & board.

Visit www.WildernessNorth.com to learn more about our company.

Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Contract length: 4 months

Application deadline: 2022-02-28

Expected start date: 2022-05-10

Job Types: Full-time, Seasonal

Salary: From $15.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Discounted or free food

COVID-19 considerations:
Wilderness North will be following COVID-19 protocols for staff and guests. Proof of vaccination is required.

Work remotely:

  • No

title: Cleaning Professional
description:
Company and CultureAt Merry Maids, the goal of our home cleaning company is to provide our customers with the best possible experience and highest quality service. To achieve this, we depend on exceptional teammates, just like you, to be great brand ambassadors that provide outstanding service each and every visit to a customer’s home. Merry Maids clearly understands the value and importance of our teammates, and that investing in them is the first step towards making us a successful company. So, when you join Merry Maids, you are joining a family that cares and values you, 100%. We Provide:
  • Paid training
  • Competitive Bi -Weekly pay
  • Paid travel expenses and mileage
  • Flexible schedules and working hours to fit your lifestyle
  • A career and growth-oriented culture
  • A caring and supportive team environment. We are a diversified group of individuals that respects each and every member equally. Many of our decisions that drive this business are based on the input of the team as a whole, meaning your voice is welcome and heard. To us, our team members’ safety is paramount and dealt with accordingly. Most of all, we are truly a family that cares and looks out for each other in every way possible.
Job Description:Whether you work with us as a solo cleaner or as part of a team, you will deliver Merry Maids’ world-class service to every client. You will clean utilizing our unique procedures and products. As a Merry Maids team member, you are also a Merry Maids brand ambassador. This means building a great rapport with clients and ensuring we are providing a completely exceptional experience for them each and every visit. Job Responsibilities:
  • Being a great Merry Maids brand ambassador
  • Using Merry Maids cleaning products, equipment and procedures to provide and exceptional clean in customers’ homes
  • Working in a safe and methodical manner
  • Contributing to a positive work environment with a pleasant attitude, punctuality, and a team player mindset
  • Having respect and an understanding for co-workers and customers
  • Taking pride and being passionate about the work you do
Qualifications:
  • A great attitude and ability to commit to the team
  • Ability to differentiate between cleaning products and uses
  • Ability to read cleaning instructions
  • Strong communication and customer service skills
  • Ability to lift and carry 20 lbs. of equipment
  • Ability to withstand regular physical contact with dog and cat hair, mold, dust, mildew and cleaning solutions
  • Ability to drive to and from various job sites
Merry Maids wants you!Looking for a fun place to work, with a flexible schedule and competitive pay? Then come and live the Merry Maids™ life!As a Merry Maids team member, you would belong to an award-winning company and be a part of our close-knit team — a team that works together to provide the best cleaning solutions and customer service to our clients. We offer paid training, excellent work/life balance and real opportunities for advancement. You may start off as a team member, but you are then able to tailor a career path that matches your interests and goals – including becoming a team captain, trainer, quality assurance supervisor, or manager.We take great pride in improving our clients' lives by allowing them to spend more time with family or doing activities they enjoy. As trusted in-home professionals, we form strong relationships with our clients and are often considered part of their extended families.Are you ready to create brighter days for you and our customers? Apply today!

This franchise is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this franchisee. All inquiries about employment at this franchisee should be made directly to the franchise location, and not to The ServiceMaster Company, LLC.

title: Houseperson
description:
Respond promptly to requests from guests and Front Desk. Performs any combination of the following tasks to maintain guestrooms, working areas, and the hotel premises in general in a clean and tidy manner. Identify and report preventative or other maintenance issues in public areas or guest rooms.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Cleans rugs, carpets and upholstered furniture using a vacuum cleaner, broom and carpet shampoo machine.
  • Cleans rooms, corridors and washrooms.
  • Washes walls and ceiling, moves furnitures and turn mattresses.
  • Sweeps, mops, scrubs, waxes and polishes floor.
  • Dusts and polishes metalwork.
  • Collects soiled linen for laundering.
  • Received linen supplies from floor shoots.
  • Maintains housekeeping carts.
  • Removes trash collected by room attendants.
  • Walk all assigned floors at beginning and end of shift to collect debris.
  • Pickup clean linen and refill the par stock of linen in maid's closet on every floor.
  • Deliver towels, cribs, cots and other items to the guest rooms upon request.
  • Perform duties of room attendant when necessary.
  • Sort linen, stock room attendant closets.
  • Refill the par stock of guest aminities and supplies on each floor pantry.
  • Clean all public areas following department standard operating procedures.
  • Remove soiled linen and trash from the pool side and other service area according to procedure.
  • Report missing / found articles, damage or merchandise problems to the supervisor.
  • Respond at all times in a friendly, helpful manner to guests and other collegues.
  • Take up any tasks assigned by the supervisor as and when needed.
  • Report to work in required uniform according to hotel standards.
  • Must be able to work independently and as a team player

PREREQUISITES:

Speak with others using clear and professional language. Support team to reach common goals. Ensure adherence to quality expectations and standards.

Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 30 pounds without assistance.

EDUCATION:

High School or equivalent

EXPERIENCE:

Previous housekeeping experience preferred

Part-time hours: 20 per week

Job Types: Part-time, Permanent

Salary: $15.00-$16.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekends

Experience:

  • housekeeping: 1 year (preferred)

title: Crowne Plaza - Night Maid
description:
Niagara Falls-based Canadian Niagara Hotels Group of Companies is one of Canada’s largest and most successful diversified entertainment businesses, with more than 2500 talented professionals spread across its various Hotels, Spas, Conference Centres, Restaurants, Craft Brewery and Distillery, Indoor Waterpark, City Touring, Entertainment and Specialty Retail businesses - with more to come! We are home to world-class brands including Marriott, Sheraton, IHG, Morton’s, Milestones, Hard Rock Café, Rainforest Café, Hershey and Starbucks - to name a few. Regardless of what business or role you start with, career development opportunities and rewards are endless for people delivering exceptional guest satisfaction and attaining business results.

Night Maid Responsibilities:
  • Respond promptly to requests from guests and other departments
  • Identify and report preventative or other maintenance issues in public areas or guest rooms
  • Complete any Room Attendant duties, should there be a need
  • Check and clean restrooms in the lobby area and supply with toilet paper, paper towels and hand soap
  • Check and clean Guest elevators
  • Clean all glass on entrance doors
  • Collect soiled pool towels and re-stock counter with clean towels
  • Remove garbage
  • Dust and polish the railing on the main staircase
  • Vacuum all carpeted areas; make sure all chairs and sofas are clean
  • Keep marble floors clean and free of dust and footprints
  • Report all concerns related to Engineering, Health and Safety, Security or Suspicious circumstances
  • Follow all Occupational Health and Safety policies, procedures and regulations
  • Complete various housekeeping duties assigned by your manager or supervisor
Qualifications:
  • Previous housekeeping experience is an asset
  • High School Diploma or GED
  • Possess a good command of the English language and the ability to clearly and pleasantly communicate
  • Enthusiasm, willingness to learn and a positive attitude
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality and security of all guests
  • Must be dependable and demonstrate organizational skills
  • Ability to work flexible hours including weekends, evenings, overnights, split duties and public holidays
  • Must have attention to detail
  • Ability to work well under pressure
  • Ability to prioritize, organize and follow up
  • Ability to perform job function with minimum supervision
  • Ability to maintain and portray Marriott Standards and Policies
  • Ability to work cohesively with other departments and team members to work laterally with departments to convey concerns and come to solutions
  • Able to work well independently with little supervision
  • Capable of lifting heavy laundry loads, approximately 40-50 lbs
  • Able to work in an efficient and timely manner
To learn more about Canadian Niagara Hotels Group of Businesses or view other current and future job opportunities please visit CNHCAREERS.CA

We also understand that diversity includes people with disabilities who might require reasonable accommodation in order to fully participate and contribute to their full capabilities or candidates for employment interested in reviewing or receiving information pertaining to careers at Canadian Niagara Hotels. This includes being able to fully participate in the Resort’s candidate selection process, including personal interviews in many circumstances, wherever possible and practical. If you would like to receive information in another format or other communications supports please send an email to hr@niagarafallshotels.com or by telephone at 905-374-4446 extension 4850.

This key position focuses on washing, cleaning & detailing both the exterior and interior of Recreational Vehicles (Motorhomes & Travel Trailers), and is crucial to the performance, image, and reputation of the company.

title: Night Houseperson
description:
Night Houseperson - Copper Point Resort

Job Summary:

As a night houseperson you are the support for the entire housekeeping team as well as the bellman for guests. You will need to ensure that all maids rooms are stocked and tidy and garbage removed for the morning as well as be responsible for the overall cleanliness of the public spaces around the resort.

Duties:

  • Ensure the resort public spaces are kept clean and well-stocked with amenities.
  • Ensure public spaces are sanitized properly according to the health and safety guidelines.
  • Cleans rugs, carpets and upholstered furniture using a vacuum cleaner, broom, and carpet shampoo machine.
  • Answer room calls as requested from the front desk.
  • Empty garbage’s.
  • Collect and empty soiled linen.
  • Look for issues throughout the resort and report or repair them as needed.
  • Work well with the front desk team to ensure overall guest satisfaction.
  • Work well with the housekeeping team to ensure to ensure a positive guest experience.
  • Work well with the maintenance team to ensure anything needing repair is reported and fixed in a timely manner.

Working Conditions:

  • Work with cleaning chemicals; proper use training will be provided.
  • Shifts are: 11pm-7:30am
  • On your feet all day with lots of travel around resort. Great job for those who like to stay fit.
  • Fun, team-oriented atmosphere.

Qualifications:

  • Ability to be proactive and handle a high paced environment when resort is at full capacity.
  • Ability to strategically organize and plan task order for efficient delivery.
  • Very friendly and helpful with both guests and fellow staff.
  • Ability to handle guest concerns with the support of the management team.
  • Ability to lift 50lbs safely.
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision.
  • Excellent communication skills.

Required Education, Training and Experience:

  • High School diploma or less

Required licenses, certificates and registrations:

  • First aid is an asset.

Who We Are:

Copper Point Resort is part of INNHotels, a family of independent hotels. We have properties in Canmore, Jasper, Red Deer, Stony Plain, Grande Cache, Valemount and Invermere.

We Offer:

  • A great work environment with opportunities for development and career advancement within Copper Point Resort and the INNHotels family of hotels;
  • A competitive compensation package;
  • Group health plan;
  • Staff events and seasonal discounts on local adventure activities;
  • Hotel Discounts as part of the INNHotels family of hotels;

title: Houseperson
description:
Houseperson - Copper Point Resort

Job Summary:

As a houseperson you are the support for the entire housekeeping team as well as the bellman for guests. You will need to ensure that all maids rooms are stocked and tidy each day as well as be responsible for the overall cleanliness of the public spaces around the resort.

Duties:

  • Ensure the resort public spaces are kept clean and well-stocked with amenities.
  • Ensure public spaces are sanitized properly according to the health and safety guidelines.
  • Cleans rugs, carpets and upholstered furniture using a vacuum cleaner, broom, and carpet shampoo machine.
  • Answer room calls as requested from the front desk.
  • Empty garbage’s.
  • Collect and empty soiled linen.
  • Look for issues throughout the resort and report or repair them as needed.
  • Work well with the front desk team to ensure overall guest satisfaction.
  • Work well with the housekeeping team to ensure to ensure a positive guest experience.
  • Work well with the maintenance team to ensure anything needing repair is reported and fixed in a timely manner.

Working Conditions:

  • Work with cleaning chemicals; proper use training will be provided.
  • Shifts are: 8:00am-4:30pm or 2:00pm-10:30pm or 11pm-7:30am depending on availability.
  • On your feet all day with lots of travel around resort. Great job for those who like to stay fit.
  • Fun, team-oriented atmosphere.

Qualifications:

Required Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:

  • Ability to be proactive and handle a high paced environment when resort is at full capacity.
  • Ability to strategically organize and plan task order for efficient delivery.
  • Very friendly and helpful with both guests and fellow staff.
  • Ability to handle guest concerns with the support of the management team.
  • Ability to lift 50lbs safely.
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision.
  • Excellent communication skills.

Required Education, Training and Experience:

  • High School diploma or less

Required licenses, certificates and registrations:

  • First aid is an asset.

We Offer:

  • A great work environment with opportunities for development and career advancement within Copper Point Resort and the INNHotels family of hotels;
  • A competitive compensation package;
  • Group health plan;
  • Staff events and seasonal discounts on local adventure activities;
  • Hotel Discounts as part of the INNHotels family of hotels;
  • The opportunity to live and work in the beautiful Columbia Valley;
  • Staff accommodation available

Do you think you’d make a good candidate? Send your resume to our Executive Housekeeper at the email below. We’d like to thank all applicants for applying; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $17.00-$18.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Night shift
  • Weekend availability

COVID-19 considerations:
We are following all BC Health guidelines pertaining to COVID-19

title: newProfessional House Cleaner
description:
Company and Culture

Merry Maids is a professional housecleaning company that offers the best cleaning solutions and customer service to our clients. As trusted in-home professionals, we form strong relationships with our clients and are often considered part of their extended families.

  • Paid Training
  • Competitive Pay
  • Monday to Friday
  • No Nights, No Weekends, No Evenings
  • Career Path Opportunities
  • Positive team atmosphere

Job Position Description:

Professionally clean customer homes using Merry Maids’ unique cleaning procedures and products. As a team member, you will be responsible to provide exceptional customer service by consistently cleaning homes.

Responsibilities:

  • Use Merry Maids cleaning products and procedures to clean in customer homes
  • Use provided equipment including vacuums and microfiber cleaning cloths
  • Clean all surfaces in home, including fans, blinds, light fixtures, baseboards, fixtures, counters, showers, toilets, cabinets, and floors
  • Ability to clean floors on hands and knees in kitchens and bathrooms
  • Vacuum all stairs, carpet, hard surface floors and furniture
  • Move all reasonably moveable furniture to clean under and behind
  • Carry all cleaning products and equipment to and from office, vehicle, and customers’ homes
  • Assist in keeping supplies stocked and maintain equipment
  • Contribute to a positive work climate with a pleasant attitude and contribute to the overall team effort including being in uniform, dependable and on time
  • Has respect and understanding for co-workers and customers

Qualifications:

  • Ability to differentiate between cleaning products and uses
  • Ability to read cleaning instructions
  • Strong communication and customer service skills
  • Ability lift and carry 20 lbs. of equipment
  • Ability to withstand regular physical contact with dog and cat hair, mold, dust, mildew and cleaning solutions
  • Ability to drive to and from various job sites

This Job Description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by those assigned to this position. This is not a comprehensive list of all responsibilities, duties, skills, efforts, and conditions associated with this position. The Company reserves the right to modify this description in the future, with or without notice to the employee. This Job Description does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, and employment with the Company remains at will. These responsibilities are subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.

Looking for a fun place to work, with a flexible schedule and competitive pay? Then come live the Merry Maids™ life!

As a Merry Maids team member, you would belong to an award-winning company and be a part of our close-knit team — a team that works together to provide the best cleaning solutions and customer service to our clients. We offer paid training, excellent work/life balance and real opportunities for advancement. You may start off as a team member, but you are then able to tailor a career path that matches your interests and goals – including becoming a team captain, trainer, quality assurance supervisor or manager.

We take pleasure in improving our clients' lives by allowing them to spend more time with family or doing activities they enjoy. As trusted in-home professionals, we form strong relationships with our clients and are often considered part of their extended families.

Ready to create brighter days for you and our customers?

Apply today!

https://maidinwindsor.com/

title: Houseperson
description:
The House Person is responsible for the cleanliness of the public and guest areas of the hotel and restaurant.
Major Duties and Responsibilities
  • Responsible for the cleaning of corridors, guest areas, service areas, and linen closets.
  • Empties maids’ trash and linen bags.
  • Deposits linen down chute and carries trash to dumpster.
  • Vacuums corridors and/or guestrooms.
  • Delivers cots and cribs to guestrooms.
  • Stocks supplies needed for linen closets.
  • Vacuums public areas.
  • Sweeps and mops service landings.
  • Mops vending machine areas and keeps machines clean.
  • Checks all public restrooms for cleanliness several times daily.
  • Checks all public restrooms for cleanliness several times daily.
  • Checks each floor to make sure fire doors are open.
  • Checks elevators for cleanliness.
  • Assists with luggage handling.
  • Cleans rooms when needed.
  • Checks lights and changes bulbs.
  • Maintains outside grounds daily.
  • Assists in the unloading of deliveries and their proper storage.
  • Maintenance of the marquee.
Minimum Qualifications and Skills
  • High school graduate or equivalent.
  • Must be able to speak, read, write, and understand the primary language(s) used in the workplace.
  • Must be able to speak, read, write, and understand the primary language(s) used by guests visiting the workplace.
Mental Effort
  • Mental effort required in multi-tasking and handling interruptions that require refocusing.
  • Listening and mental attentiveness in tasks assigned by Housekeeping Manager.
Physical Effort
  • Some heavy lifting required.
  • Standing for long periods of time.
Type of Supervision Required

Reports to the Housekeeping Manager or General Manager. Works under general instructions to prioritize and complete assigned tasks.

title: HOUSE CLEANERS-MUST HAVE VALID BC DRIVERS LICENSE AND A CAR
description:
Want to help make people’s lives better, and get some exercise in the process?! If that sounds like you, toss that gym membership away and come work for Merry Maids of Vancouver!

Merry Maids is now hiring for Part Time staff (3-4 days a week) to join our successful, fun, and caring team of Cleaning Professionals!

The Pros – where do we begin?

· No experience? No problem! We take the time and care to train each new team member to ensure their success.

· Flexible Schedules – You tell us what days of the week you’re available, and we’ll schedule you accordingly!

· Independence – you get to be on the road through the day, rather than cooped up in an office or behind a counter!

· Paid mileage – paid to workout and drive? What a steal!

· Paid vacation days and holidays! – need we say more?

· Weekly paycheck – never go into the weekend without money again!

· Fun and Friendly atmosphere – you’re not just joining a company, you’re joining a family who genuinely cares about you and your well being

Job Description? It’s simple! Provide your clients with a professional home cleaning! That’s it! (There’s a bit more detail needed, but don’t worry, we’ll teach you all about it!)

Okay, this all sounds great but what about Covid?

Our teams' safety is the top priority for us, and we have taken every possible measure to make sure that you are safe from this virus while visiting your clients. These safety measures include:

· Wearing PPE while in clients homes, which is provided to you always!

· Maintaining a social distance from clients while in the home – they’ll stay in one room while you clean the rest of the house, then you can swap!

· All vehicles, equipment, and our office, are disinfected daily!

· All of our team members are provided with as much hand sanitizer as they need to feel safe and secure in our clients homes!

This all sounds amazing! What qualifications do you need?

- A positive attitude!

- Desire to help people

- Enjoyment of exercise

- A driver’s license

- Bondable – so our clients can feel safe knowing we hire the best of the best!

If this sounds like something you would be interested in, we cannot wait to hear from you! Please send your resume to set up an interview!

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent, Casual
Part-time hours: 20-30 per week

Salary: $18.00-$26.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Commission pay
  • Tips

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • On call

Application question(s):

  • ARE YOU DOUBLE VACCINATED?

Experience:

  • Cleaning: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • BC DRIVERS LICENSE AND A CAR (required)

title: Cleaner / Housekeeper - Fredericton/Oromocto
description:
We are currently looking for full-time Housekeepers/Cleaners to join our team of cleaning professionals!
Cleanings are done using the MOLLY MAID Healthy Home Cleaning System, created to keep team members and customer’s safe during this time of COVID-19.

We offer our Housekeepers/Cleaners/Drivers:

  • Daytime hours - no evening, weekend or holiday clean
  • Competitive wages
  • On the job paid training
  • A company vehicle for qualified drivers
  • Personal Protective Equipment provided for all cleans

We are seeking Housekeepers/Cleaners who:

  • Are motivated and enjoy cleaning
  • Work well in teams of two cleaners without direct supervision
  • Have a valid driver's license
  • Have a clean criminal record check

Previous cleaning, housekeeping, hotel cleaning, room attendant, residential cleaning, office cleaning or general cleaning experience is an asset however, not required.

Sound like a job for you? If so, apply today and join our team of housekeeping professionals! You’ll be glad you did!

(Please note: applicants without a valid license will not be contacted.)

About MOLLY MAID Canada:

Founded in Canada in 1979, MOLLY MAID is one of the world’s largest professional home cleaning services, completing over 2 million residential cleans every year worldwide. We offer our customers a flexible and personalized cleaning service at an affordable price, based on a free, no-obligation, in-home estimate.

COVID-19 precaution(s):

  • Remote interview process
  • Personal protective equipment provided or required
  • Social distancing guidelines in place
  • Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

Work remotely

  • No

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $16.00-$20.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • No weekends

COVID-19 considerations:
MOLLY MAID Fredericton is working to keep our team members and customers safe during the pandemic with cleaning under the guidelines from the Healthy Home Cleaning System.

Application question(s):

  • Do you live in the Frederitcon area?

Licence/Certification:

  • Driver's Licence (preferred)

title: Professional cleaner
description:
Professional Residential Cleaner
CASH PAID WEEKLY

What We're Looking For:

MUST HAVE Residential/Housekeeping experience of 6 months or more.

Must have your own supplies

You must be reliable and have your own car

Valid driver's license

Excellent verbal communication skills

Ability to pass a background check

Most importantly, must know how to clean!

This is an excellent position that allows our housekeepers/cleaners to choose either full-time or part-time housecleaning work.

Do you enjoy cleaning and take pride in your work? Do you want to be rewarded for your hard-work? If so, then join Cleaner In Victoria! We are a small company but we are the best at what we do!! We have super flexible positions with part time or full time hours available.

Job Summary

We're looking for hardworking and reliable house cleaners. You'll be responsible for cleaning residential homes in the Victoria area.

Why should you work with Cleaner In Victoria?

Flexible Schedule - Like having Mondays off? Need to pick up and/or drop off your kids? No problem! All our residential cleaners get to set their own part time or full time cleaning schedule.

Get paid cash weekly for your work. Whether you are working with us part time or full time, there is no need to wait a month for your pay!

Write off your expenses! Being a contractor allows you to write off your gas, cleaning supplies, cell phone bill and other possible expenses such as lunches on the go.

Never be bored. You'll meet some very nice clients. Every day will be different and you'll never be stuck in some boring or mindless job.

We take pride in giving people like you an opportunity to make great money while working around your schedule - something that most companies just don't do. We provide the option of both part time or full-time hours to accommodate our house cleaner's busy schedules.

We'll take care of the customer service, scheduling appointments, marketing, and administration hassles so you don't have to.

You'll also get friendly support staff to help you with: finding and getting directions to a home and other appointment details.

All you have to do is show up and clean and figure out what music to listen to while you're cleaning!

Part-time hours: 5-40 per week

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Casual

Salary: $25.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Tips

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • Do you have your own cleaning supplies and tools (incl. vacuum/mop)?
  • Do you have your own vehicle?

Experience:

  • cleaning: 1 year (required)

Work remotely:

  • No

title: ️Dump the Nights, Ditch the Weekend Hours – Do House Cleanin...
description:
At MaidPro, our mission is to improve the lives of those in our community by helping them get more time back in their busy lives, live with dignity, and ensure their homes are clean and safe.

✅We are a fun company with perks such as:

  • Great pay - starting at $17.50/hr + TIPS!
  • Benefits package including dental, prescription, life insurance and more!
  • Paid training, travel time & fuel reimbursement
  • Performance bonuses! Based on attendance and customer reviews!
  • Advancement opportunities - become a trainer, supply manager or office staff

✅PLUS:

  • Flexible weekday hours
  • no nights/weekends!
  • We offer full and part-time positions
  • perfect for parents or university/college students!
  • We have a great company culture where everyone is valued and treated with respect.
  • No cleaning experience is required!

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

✅Must have own vehicle, driver's license and insurance

✅Hard working and reliable with a great attitude

✅Able to work weekday hours Monday to Friday or only certain days of the week

Looking for a great job right now? MaidPro is growing fast and needs to hire rockstar cleaners to keep us growing! Cleaning experience is not required. We have an amazing training program to get you all the skills you need to achieve rockstar status!

Looking for an active and low-stress lifestyle? Get out from behind your desk or cash register and get moving! Our PROs travel to different work sites and have lots of independence on the job. Our PROs say that cleaning is their "therapy" or "zen".

Want to advance your career? MaidPro is also seeking trainers, sales/customer service associates, and managers to help grow the business. All of our current managers have been promoted from within. Build marketable job skills with MaidPro.

Ready to really make a difference? This could be the career you have been looking for. Why? Our PROs develop deep relationships with our clients and make a huge impact on their lives. But unlike home healthcare positions, we don’t have the constant heartache that goes along with losing clients.
MaidPro is looking for enthusiastic and reliable people to clean homes around Thornhill, Vaughan, Markham, Maple, North York and Richmond Hill. We work Monday through Friday between the hours of 8:30am - 4:30pm. No nights, no weekends!

Well MaidPro might be just right for you!!
Questions? Call us at (289)807-0408 ext 3 or Text Us at (647)933-6670

title: Room Attendant - Marriott Fallsview Hotel & Spa
description:
Niagara Falls-based Canadian Niagara Hotels Group of Companies is one of Canada’s largest and most successful diversified entertainment businesses, with more than 2500 talented professionals spread across its various Hotels, Spas, Conference Centres, Restaurants, Craft Brewery and Distillery, Indoor Waterpark, City Touring, Entertainment and Specialty Retail businesses - with more to come! We are home to world-class brands including Marriott, Sheraton, IHG, Morton’s, Milestones, Hard Rock Café, Rainforest Café, Hershey and Starbucks - to name a few. Regardless of what business or role you start with, career development opportunities and rewards are endless for people delivering exceptional guest satisfaction and attaining business results.

Hourly Wage: $16.50 to $17.00/hour

Areas of Responsibility:
  • Fill cart with supplies and transport cart to assigned area.
  • Enter guest rooms following procedures for gaining access and ensuring vacancy before entering.
  • Replace guest amenities and supplies in room.
  • Replace dirty linen and terry with clean items.
  • Check that all appliances are present in the room and in working order.
  • Remove all garbage from room.
  • Straighten desk items, furniture, and appliances.
  • Dust, polish, sanitize, and remove marks from walls, doors, windows and furnishings in the room and bathroom.
  • Vacuum carpets and perform floor care duties.
  • Report any maintenance issues found in the room.
  • Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisor/Manager
Requirements:
  • No Experience Required - On the Job Training Provided
  • Superior attention to detail.
  • Ability to multitask and organize time effectively and efficiently.
Working Conditions:
  • Must be available to weekends and holidays.
  • Stand, sit and walk for extended periods of time.
  • Move, lift, carry, push or pull objects weighing less than or equal to 25 lbs.
  • Ability to work independently.
  • Must be able to provide exemplary customer service.
SOME BENEFITS MARRIOTT EMPLOYEES ENJOY:
  • Complimentary daily staff meal.
  • Immediate access to the Associate/Friends and Family hotel and dining discounts at any participating Marriott and Starwood brands hotels worldwide.
  • Complimentary parking
  • Complimentary Company sponsored events.
  • Personalized electronic access to your pay statements and annual T4 statements- accessible from the comfort of your own home, any computer, tablet or smartphone 24 hours per day, 7 days a week via. online.
Housekeeping
Maid
Cleaner
Chambermaid

To learn more about Canadian Niagara Hotels Group of Businesses or view other current and future job opportunities please visit CNHCAREERS.CA

We also understand that diversity includes people with disabilities who might require reasonable accommodation in order to fully participate and contribute to their full capabilities or candidates for employment interested in reviewing or receiving information pertaining to careers at Canadian Niagara Hotels. This includes being able to fully participate in the Resort’s candidate selection process, including personal interviews in many circumstances, wherever possible and practical. If you would like to receive information in another format or other communications supports please send an email to hr@niagarafallshotels.com or by telephone at 905-374-4446 extension 4850.
