title: Executive Housekeeper
description:
Luxurious hotel living with classic European style, The Sutton Place Hotel's luxury hospitality experience is coming to Halifax. An integral part of Nova Centre, and located in the heart of our city, The Sutton Place Hotel Halifax offers elegant modern charm in a marriage of traditional and contemporary design with the warmth of East Coast Hospitality.

Each of our 262 guest rooms and suites are fully automated with lights, temperature, and fan regulators all accessed through the Allure in-room wall control, iPhone, Android, or manually. An outdoor hot tub, fully equipped fitness centre, on-site Chop Steakhouse & Bar, outdoor fire pits along with underground parking are a few of the amenities that provide the ultimate in service, comfort, and style unique to our well-appointed location.

Our new property perfectly blends luxury and cosmopolitan ambience. Those familiar with our other hotels, The Sutton Place Hotel Vancouver, The Sutton Place Hotel and Revelstoke Mountain and The Sutton Place Hotel Edmonton will recognize the style and service we bring to Halifax.

The key to providing this exceptional service level is our team and we are currently considering candidates for the following position:

Executive Housekeeper

Key Responsibilities

The successful candidate will be a proven Housekeeping leader, with experience in a luxury environment. Responsibilities include (but not limited to):

  • Ensuring exceptional cleanliness and orderliness of the guest rooms and suites, public areas, back-of-house areas, as well as efficient operation of the laundry department
  • Maintaining supply and equipment inventories while monitoring expenditures and cost controls
  • Reports to the General Manager, and collaborates daily with all other department leaders, in particular the Front Office Manager and the Maintenance Manager.
  • Ensuring that Health, Wellness & Safety standards are met and exceeded, including knowledge of and proper use of cleaning and other chemicals, proper lifting procedures, etc.
  • Motivating, coaching and developing team members to provide exceptional services to our guests
  • Overseeing fair and effective scheduling and performance management of the team members in conjunction with the Housekeeping Assistant/Supervisor and Human Resources
  • Effective planning, problem-solving, budgeting/forecasting & reporting in order to continually improve operations & efficiency, and achieve service goals as well as financial targets

Qualifications:

This is an excellent opportunity for a strategic, energetic, self-motivated, team-oriented individual, with a minimum of four (4) years Housekeeping Leadership experience in a similar property environment.

  • Strong knowledge of all facets of housekeeping operations, with a commitment to service excellence, and the ability to develop and execute effective training programs
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills, with clearly demonstrated leadership and motivational abilities
  • The initiative to identify opportunities for improvement and resolve them in a timely manner with sound decision-making skills
  • Strong organizational skills & outstanding attention to detail, with an emphasis on achieving objectives within deadlines
  • Degree/Diploma in Hospitality Management or comparable experience is preferred.
  • Working knowledge of MS Word, Excel, OPERA or similar Property Management System.
  • Must be legally able to work in Canada

SUMMATION:

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.

You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.

**Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.

**We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities with The Sutton Place Hotel, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

**ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

title: Housekeeping Aide (Casual) – Extendicare Medex
description:
Housekeeping Aide (Casual) – Extendicare Medex

 

Extendicare is a leading provider of care and services for seniors throughout Canada. Through our network of over 115 senior care and living centres as well as our home health care operations, we are committed to delivering care throughout the health care continuum to meet the needs of a growing seniors’ population in Canada. Our qualified and highly trained workforce of 23,700 team members are united by a dedication to quality care and by our vision of being the best provider of senior care and services in Canada.

 

Candidates are invited to apply for permanent part-time and casual Housekeeping Aide positions to work at our Extendicare Medex facility, a 193-bed long-term care home, located in Ottawa, Ontario.

 

Reporting to the Support Service Manager, the Housekeeping aide maintains high standards of cleanliness and sanitation throughout the client’s home by cleaning and sanitizing rooms and furnishings in assigned work areas following established policies and procedures.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • As a housekeeper; using specified cleaning/disinfecting/sanitizing agents, and following specific procedures, work patterns, and routines, performs tasks such as;
  • Vacuuming, sweeping, dry/wet mopping, scrubbing, sanitizing/disinfecting floors; spot cleaning walls, windows and doors, dusting, rearranging furniture, removing waste;
  • daily cleaning and disinfecting of resident rooms; cleaning floors, fixtures and furnishings in rooms, kitchen, closets; may also include heavy cleaning duties such as deep cleaning.
  • As a laundry aide; operating industrial washing machines and dryers to maintain a continual supply of quality linen for the home. Handling, folding, hanging, and checking quality of linen supplies. Washing, labeling & organizing personal clothing
  • Ensure privacy of residents during performance of duties.
  • Adhere to established company policies and procedures regarding quality assurance, health & safety, infection control, emergency preparedness and all other applicable policies and procedures
  • Cooperates with other departments in such tasks as transferring residents, moving and storing supplies furniture and equipment.
  • Must be available for call ins on short notice

 

QUALIFICATIONS

  •        Clear vulnerable sector police check
  •        Initiative
  •        Ability to work in a team and independently
  •        Ability to walk, stand, bend, kneel, crouch, squat and lift (40lbs.) for long periods of time
  •        Ability and willingness to follow instruction
  •        Ability to read, write and understand English required
  •        Knowledge of housekeeping & laundry procedures and Best Practices principles an asset
  •        Knowledge of infection prevention and control practices an asset
  •        Long-term care experience an asset

 

CLOSING DATE: May 17, 2022

Interested applicants may forward their resume in confidence to the attention of:

 

Scott Sinnett
Support Service Manager

cnh_medex@extendicare.com

 

In Ontario, Extendicare, ParaMed Home Health Care and affiliated organizations including our partner homes in Extendicare Assist, accommodate the needs of job applicants throughout its recruitment and selection processes in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.  Accommodation needs must be provided in advance.   To discuss your needs, please contact the individual noted in the posting.

Extendicare recognizes the importance of immunization to protect our residents, patients, team members and visitors from COVID-19. As such, subject to medical exemptions, a condition of employment with Extendicare is requiring that all new hires have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada.

title: Executive Housekeeper, BCE
description:
Job Description

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage the day-to-day operations of the housekeeping department.
  • Assist in managing other departments when required.
  • Manage daily housekeeping services for scheduled rooms.
  • Manage linen and laundry processes, commissary and lounge, if applicable.
  • Maintain company service standards.
  • Assist in performance reviews, scheduling, payroll/daily sales & labor, forecasting, and inventory/par stocks.
  • Manage linen, laundry processes, commissary and lounge, if applicable.
  • Manage staffing levels to ensure that guest service, operational needs, and financial objectives are met.
  • Maintain all guest rooms and public areas to guarantee that the highest standard of cleanliness.
  • Ensure productivity goals are met.
  • Ensure quality staff are hired and trained to meet the company standards.
  • Provide leadership, guidance and coaching to direct reports.
  • Participate in departmental meetings.
  • Communicate clear and consistent information regarding the departmental goals to produce desired results.
  • Provide superior customer service to guests by responding to their requests promptly and professionally.
  • Strives to improve service performance.
  • Take lead in guest recovery, addressing guest comments and concerns.
  • Establish performance standards and expectations.
  • Develop and implement standard operating procedures.
  • Inspect and ensure tasks are performed by adhering highest safety standards.
  • Ensuring compliance with licensing laws, health and safety and other statutory regulations.
  • Collaborate with the Lodge manager to lead and develop a safety culture.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications
  • Post- secondary education in a related discipline.
  • 3-6 years of progressive experience in hotel management.
  • Class 5 Operator's License, with a 5-year driving record satisfactory to Civeo' s driving criteria.
  • Front office experience would be an asset.
  • Familiarity with hotel management/ property systems would be an asset.
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office programs.
  • Exceptional leadership and management skills.
  • Ability to maintain a professional demeanor in all interaction with clients, guests and staff.
  • Conflict resolutions skills.
  • Aptitude to establish and maintain effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Ability to develop and motivate staff to achieve challenging goals.
  • Superior oral and written communication skills.
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills.
  • Ability to solve problems logically, and make decisions in unique situations.
  • Must be able to pass a pre-access Drug & Alcohol test

Civeo is committed to the principle of employment equity. We welcome diversity and encourage all who are qualified to express their interest.About Us

Civeo Services Employees LP is a premier remote workforce lodge operator in the Alberta resource industry. We help people maintain healthy, productive and connected lives while living and working away from home. Our unique approach focuses on guest wellbeing, operational efficiency and community building - making us a leading provider of accommodation solutions.

title: Housekeeping Summer Students
description:
Job Number:
J0522-0217
Job Title:
Housekeeping Summer Students
Job Type:
Temp F/T
City, Province, Country:
Guelph, Ontario, Canada
Job Category:
Environmental Services
Open Positions:
3

Make a difference in a growing, innovative mental health organization and centre of excellence in people-centered care. Work with supportive colleagues who are passionate about improving lives and champions for quality and continuous learning.

Position Summary

As a Housekeeper, you will be an integral part of a collaborative team focused on delivering seamless services and programs to our clients and customers. If you are looking for a company that is constantly moving forward in pursuit of successful outcomes, get ready to love it here!

Hours: This is a UFCW temporary full-time position until August 31, 2022. 37.5 hours a week.

What you'll be doing

The housekeeper performs a variety of important duties across the health centre, following health, safety, hygiene and infection control policies and procedures to ensure a safe environment for all, including:

• Clean patient rooms and perform duties such as mopping floors, washing furniture, cleaning and washing bathroom fixtures, dusting overhead and bed lamps, stripping and remaking beds, turning mattresses and other general cleaning work
• Utilize cleaning equipment such as vacuums, mops, and other cleaning tools
• Clean common areas, restrooms, corridors, hallways, stairways and other work spaces while keeping the prescribed health and hygiene standards
• Clean and sanitize toilets, showers/bathtubs, countertops and sinks
• Wash walls, ceilings, doors, and trim by hand or with washing equipment
• Clean, wash, dust, or polish hardware, brass, furniture, mirrors, lighting fixtures, windows, window sills, screens, vents, radiators, and exterior of cabinets and equipment
• Sort, wash, load, and unload laundry
• Keep bathrooms stocked with clean linens, toiletries, and other supplies
• Empty waste paper baskets, trash containers and replace liners

What we're looking for

• Housekeeping experience in a hospital, hotel, or institutional environment is an asset
• Infection prevention and control training preferred
• Ability to use good judgment in deciding priorities with a fluctuating workload
• Proven customer service and attention to detail
• Ability to work independently and within a team
• Excellent work ethic and attendance record
• Able to work all shifts, including weekdays, weekends, and afternoon shifts, as per the posted schedule.
• Physically able to perform the duties of the position including lifting up to 30lbs, kneeling, squatting, pushing, pulling, reaching and various repetitive movements
• Demonstrated commitment to Homewood’s Core Competencies (Service Excellence, Innovation, Collaboration, Integrity)
• Commitment to working within Homewood’s Health and Safety Policy

As part of our commitment to the health and safety of our patients, staff and community from COVID-19, subject to any accommodation required by applicable human rights legislation, Homewood Health Centre requires that all staff have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada.

Why work with us

Homewood Health is Canada’s largest and leading service provider for medically focused, evidence-based treatment of mental health and addiction disorders. Our organizational culture values service excellence, integrity, collaboration and innovation. Our people make a difference!As an equal opportunity employer, Homewood Health is committed to employment accessibility, diversity, equity and inclusion. For this reason, we encourage applications from members of equity-seeking groups including women, racialized and indigenous communities, persons with disabilities, and persons of all sexual orientations and gender identities/expressions.

Join us at Homewood Health™ and be part of a diverse team helping Canadians live healthier, more productive and fulfilling lives.

Work with supportive colleagues who are passionate about improving lives and champions for quality and continuous learning.', 'Join us at Homewood Health™ and be part of a diverse team helping Canadians live healthier, more productive and fulfilling lives.']

title: Professional Home Cleaner
description:
About the Housecleaner position

We're a successful maid service company looking for people who enjoy cleaning, like working in a fun team-based environment, who take pride in a job well done and love receiving lots of positive inspiring feedback from management and clients!

We offer:

· Pay up to $22/hr + TIPS

· Paid training

· Performance bonuses

· Flexible weekday hours - no nights/weekends!

· Full and part-time positions - perfect for moms!

· Weekly pay

If you have never done team cleaning before, here is how it works:

· We train you on our cleaning methods and so prior experience is not required

· We clean in teams of two people

· A team of two people would typically clean three - four homes in a day

· You need to have a car

· When you start working here we will assign you a partner.

· Travel to our equally awesome and very appreciative clients' homes -- usually your end time depends on how big the homes are, how many people are on your team and how long it has been since the client last had their home cleaned by us

· Next Day: Get lots of terrific feedback for the amazing job you did the day before, and do it again!

Job Requirements:

· Must have own vehicle, driver's license and insurance (for driver's position)

· (For non-driver position - no vehicle necessary)

· Hard working and reliable with a great attitude

· Able to work weekday hours Monday to Friday

· Must be willing to provide a recent police check upon hiring

Candidates to live in Mississauga, Toronto

Please Note: The position available requires a vehicle, so please be sure to mention in your reply if you have a vehicle.

If you don't have a car, feel free to apply to be considered for a non-driver role.

title: Housekeeping Supervisor (MUST be available during weekends)
description:
MUST be available during weekends.


JOB OVERVIEW

Supervise and inspect the work of assigned room and/or public area attendants to ensure product quality standards are met and that optimum service is provided to hotel guests according to hotel and company business objectives.


DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Assist with scheduling and room assignments to ensure proper coverage.
  • Monitor performance and recommend disciplinary action in accordance with company rules and policies. Alert management of potentially serious issues.
  • Ensure all staff is properly trained and have the tools and equipment needed to effectively carry out their respective job duties.
  • Inspect all assigned areas to ensure furnishings, guest rooms/suites, equipment, linens, and public areas are clean and in good repair to meet guest satisfaction. Advise employees of deficiencies and instruct on corrective action. Provide adequate retraining as needed.
  • Assists in the ordering and receiving of linen and cleaning supplies to maintain appropriate inventory levels necessary for efficient operation of the department; assists with monthly linen and supply inventory.
  • Ensures the completion of the Housekeeper’s Report and communicates clean and available rooms to the Guest Services Department.
  • Inspect storage rooms and room attendant carts for neatness, cleanliness, adequate supplies, and good repair.
  • Respond to guest complaints, special requests and ensure corrective action is taken to achieve complete guest satisfaction.
  • Control expenses and minimize waste within all areas of housekeeping.
  • Complete all paperwork and closing duties such as filling out supply requisitions, maintenance request forms, and updating logbooks, etc.
  • Promote teamwork and quality service through daily communication and coordination with other departments.
  • Ma guest rooms to ensure guest satisfaction.
  • Report, turn in, and/or log all lost and found items according to established procedures.
  • May regularly assist with deep cleaning projects.
  • Refer to attached additional job responsibilities and Health & Safety duties and responsibility
  • May perform all housekeeping duties necessary including makings beds and vacuuming and cleaning
  • Assist with other duties as assigned


QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS

Minimum: High School Diploma or equivalent. Some college an asset.

1-2 years housekeeping experience, preferably in a hotel of similar size and complexity, including some supervisory training/experience. S/he must speak fluent English.

Other:

  • Communication skills are utilized a significant amount of time when interacting with guests and employees.
  • Reading and writing abilities are utilized often when compiling departmental records, logs, or paperwork.
  • Basic mathematical skills are used occasionally.
  • May be required to work nights, weekends, and/or holidays.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

This job requires ability to perform the following:

  • Carrying or lifting items weighing up to 50 pounds and pushing and or pulling approximately 200 pounds
  • Frequently standing up and moving about the facility
  • Remain stationary for extended periods of time
  • Frequently handling objects and equipment to maintain the facility
  • Frequently bending, stooping, and kneeling

title: Housekeeping Room Attendant
description:
We celebrate Housekeeping Room Attendants as the heart of our hotels. Without you, we simply could not open. Your passion for cleanliness and eagle-eye for detail really help to set us apart, and your commitment to friendly customer service brings our guests back time after time. On top of a competitive compensation package and flexible schedule, we're committed to your professional development and offer real career growth. We know you'd love to hear about our perks-incredible team rates and discounts at all 7 of our restaurant brands is just the beginning! With over 60 hotels (and growing!) there has never been a more exciting time to join our team.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  • No education or experience required, we will train one on one
  • Ability to follow instruction
  • Good communication skills are an asset
  • Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) is an asset
  • Able to deal with people sensitively, tactfully, diplomatically, and professionally at all times
  • Professional appearance and manners

DUTIES:

  • Clean rooms according to Sandman Hotels standards
  • Maintains an up to date knowledge of all chemicals and cleaning products, and the correct handling procedures
  • Responds to guests and staff inquiries, requests and complaints in a prompt and courteous manner
  • Ensures all lost property items left in guest rooms are recorded on the worksheet and handed in to the Supervisor/Manager at the end of the shift
  • Ensures all maintenance and safety hazards are promptly reported to the Supervisor/Manager to minimize hazard risk
  • Takes personal responsibility for equipment, ensuring it is operated correctly and secure at all times
  • Reports any unusual or suspicious persons/activities happening in the area of security to the manager
  • Reports any maintenance issues including burned out light bulbs
  • Check under bed, drawers, and closet for left behind articles and or trash
  • Cleans sink and fixtures and restock all terry, soap, glasses, comment cards, coffee and other amenities
  • Clean coffee pots when needed, - ensures pots are plugged in
  • Arrange furniture following use by guests
  • Ensure security of guest rooms and privacy of guests
  • Perform Laundry tasks when necessary including collect, sort, transport laundry at the beginning of each shift.
  • Remove laundry from dryers and fold immediately to prevent wrinkling.
  • Stock linen supply room with clean linens for use for next day.
  • Laundry to include: bed linens, blankets, Duvets/Comforters, towels & face cloths, and restaurant table linens. At end of day all cleaning cloths will also be washed, dried and folded for housekeeping needs.
  • Small mending repairs required as needed.
  • Perform Houseperson duties if required.

APPLICABLE SKILLS:

  • Excellent customer relations.
  • Must have time-management skills.
  • Adaptable to change and be able to handle multiple priorities under pressure.
  • Eager and focused to exceed guest expectations.

PERKS:

  • Team rates from $59 per night
  • 25% discount at our restaurants for up to 6 people
  • ½ price passes/lift tickets at Grouse Mountain and Revelstoke Mountain Resort
  • RRSP Matching for eligible employees
  • HumanaCare - free mental health support & counselling
  • Employment milestone rewards
  • Ongoing employee events, incentives and recognition

SUMMATION:

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities with The Sandman Hotel Group, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

**ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

Sandman Hotel Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. Sandman Hotel Group does not discriminate on the basis of disability, veteran status or any other basis protected under federal, provincial or local laws. Sandman Hotel Group takes seriously its obligations under the Human Rights Code.

Area: Northern BC

title: Home Cleaner
description:
Company Description

Spectrum Health Care is hiring Part Time Home Cleaners in North York, Toronto!  We are hiring in North York near the Bathurst and Sheppard area including Armour Heights, Don Mills, Downsview, Clanton Park, York Heights, Lawrence, Don Valley and Bayview Village, and Bathurst Manor. 

If you are looking for an opportunity to help seniors in your community apply today! 

At Spectrum Health Care our mission is re-imagining home care for clients and families to provide products and services they need, whenever care is required, delivered by the most qualified and compassionate staff. 

Our people are the cornerstone of our business. By joining Spectrum Health Care you will be part of one of Canada’s Best Managed companies and a committed member of a team of highly skilled healthcare professionals. 

Job Description

  • Dust, vacuum and mop floors
  • Clean bathrooms and showers
  • Dust and/or clean furniture and appliances
  • Wash dishes, clean kitchen countertops 
  • Take out garbage as required
  • Assist with laundry and the preparing of bedding
  • Light grocery shopping and meal prep as needed 
  • Utilize routine practices and appropriate PPE as applicable
Qualifications

 

  • Prior cleaning experience an asset
  • Effective English communication skills; other languages an asset
  • Ability to interact with others in a caring, tactful and courteous manner
  • Ability to work independently within scope of role and request supervision as necessary
  • Valid ‘G’ driver’s license is considered an asset

#shc_cleaner



Additional Information

Spectrum Health Care is thrilled to be named one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. This award recognizes top companies across Canada for overall performance, sustained growth, strategy, capabilities and innovation, culture and commitment, and leadership. Click here to learn more about this esteemed honour.  

We thank all applicants, however, only those individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act 2005, upon request, support will be provided for accommodations throughout the recruitment process.

If you require accommodation because of disability through the recruitment process, please contact Human Resources at (corphr@spectrumhealthcare.com) for assistance.

title: Room Attendant
description:
PeopleReady of Oshawa has an immediate opening for Room Attendants in Ajax, ON.

Are you committed to holding cleanliness next to godliness? Detail oriented? Room Attendenants perform light cleaning duties to maintain commercial buildings or Hotels. These positions are also a great entry point for other Hospitality positions.

Shift Timing - 1st Shift (Day)

Responsibilities Include:

*

Cleaning areas as assigned by supervisor

* Vacuuming rugs, carpets, upholstered furniture, and draperies

* Dusting and polishing furniture and equipment

* Removing items left behind by previous occupants

Qualifications:

*

Double vaccinated

* Clean background check

* Covid screening before start of shift

 

 

PeopleReady is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity. We do not discriminate based on race, religious affiliation, color, national origin, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other basis protected by law. We will get to know you and connect you with jobs that match your skills, experience and preferences. We work hard every single day to find jobs so each employee has opportunity and variety in their work.

title: Housekeeping Room Attendant
description:
Luxurious hotel living with classic European style, The Sutton Place Hotel's luxury hospitality experience has arrived in Halifax. An integral part of Nova Centre, and located in the heart of our city, The Sutton Place Hotel Halifax offers elegant modern charm in a marriage of traditional and contemporary design with the warmth of East Coast Hospitality.

Each of our 262 guest rooms and suites are fully automated with lights, temperature, and fan regulators all accessed through the Allure in-room wall control, iPhone, Android, or manually. Our fully equipped fitness centre, on-site Chop Steakhouse & Bar, and underground parking are a few of the amenities that provide the ultimate in service, comfort, and style unique to our well-appointed location.

Our dedication to the health and safety of our guests, employees and partners is paramount and we follow our PureClean program- Staying Safe Together.

The key to providing this exceptional service level is our team and we are currently considering candidates for the following position:

Housekeeping Room Attendant

Key Responsibilities

The successful candidate will consistently provide a warm welcome and exceptional experiences to our guests in a prompt and courteous manner within the framework of hotel and departmental guidelines. Responsibilities will include (but are not limited to):

  • Preparing rooms for guest arrival and responding to special guest requests (i.e. allergies, extra supplies/amenities).
  • Strictly adheres to and promotes PureClean guidelines
  • Making and changing beds/sheets and cleaning washrooms
  • Cleaning, sanitizing and disinfecting guest rooms and washrooms
  • Vacuuming, dusting, and polishing.
  • Reporting lost and found articles, unusual circumstances or special room concerns (i.e. smoking in room).
  • Seasonal and deep cleaning of guest rooms as required.
  • Maintaining linen rooms, housekeeping closets and stocking carts.
  • Providing information to guests about hotel services and facilities.
  • Demonstrating teamwork by cooperating and assisting co-workers as needed and consistently practices guest and associate privacy and security.

Qualifications:

  • This is an excellent opportunity for a warm, energetic, self-motivated, team-oriented individual with previous cleaning experience.
  • Previous hotel cleaning experience required
  • Must be able to perform repetitive and physically demanding tasks while maintaining a strong attention to detail.
  • Previous experience using a variety of cleaning supplies, equipment and tools
  • WHMIS certification an asset.

PERKS:

  • Team rates from $59 per night
  • 25% discount at our restaurants for up to 6 people
  • ½ price passes/lift tickets at Grouse Mountain and Revelstoke Mountain Resort
  • RRSP Matching for eligible employees
  • HumanaCare free mental health support & counselling
  • Employment milestone rewards
  • Ongoing employee events, incentives and recognition

SUMMATION:

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.

You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.

**Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.

**We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities with The Sutton Place Hotel, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

**ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

title: Housekeeping Attendant
description:
ROLE PROPOSITION
The Housekeeping Attendant is the heart of the operation as they work to elevate the guests’ lodging experience, ensuring that guest rooms and public areas are clean and welcoming for the guest. While positioned operationally behind the scenes, this role often has guest interactions and opportunities to promote a positive image of the property to guests by being friendly, professional, and able to address problems or special requests. The variety of tasks from working on this team in a resort setting will open up opportunities for advancement internally and externally throughout the Tourism / Hospitality industry.

    ACCOUNTABILITIES

    Room Specific Operations:

    • Executes stayover and departure cleaning of the Hotel and Residences rooms 
    • Ensures at all times the security of guest rooms and privacy of guests 
    • Performs deep cleaning rotational cleaning duties as scheduled 

    Public Space Specific Operations:

    • Monitors and cleans the hotel public areas (Corridors, Washrooms, Lobbies, Stairwells, Health Club & Fitness area, etc.) 
    • Cleans all surfaces of the upper and lower hotel back of house space hallways
    • Removes refuse in public areas including the perimeter of the hotel and the Residences 
    • Cleans administrative areas including removal of waste, recycling, and vacuuming

    Houseperson Specific Operations:

    • Stocks and sorts the supply in all housekeeping closets and carts
    • Collects and sorts soiled linen in prescribed timelines for the laundry service to pick up
    • Collects garbage and recycling from all Hotel and Residence linen closets placing them into correct compactors and bins
    • Delivers required resources to team members
    • Delivers, services, and retrieves all guest requested hotel resources; such as playpens, humidifiers, etc.
    • Ensures at all times the security of guest rooms and privacy of guests 
    • Performs deep cleaning rotational cleaning duties aligned with the schedule

    Guest Experience:

    • Acts with professionalism and provides a service standard that elevates the guest experience
    • Acts as an ambassador of the Hotel & Sun Peaks
    • Delivers quality service when assisting guests with room amenities, cleaning, and additional hotel standard special requests as it relates to their guestroom stay

    Team Commitment / Leadership: 

    • Works as a dynamic team member with a focus on collaboration
    • Demonstrates initiative to help the Rooms department succeed by the willingness to cross-train and assist coworkers with the business needs and leadership team’s direction 
    • Works with integrity and is accountable for performance/completion of daily assigned job tasks

    Ideal Candidate

    • Knowledge of the responsibilities of and working in the housekeeping department is an asset but not required
    • Reliable and responsible person with team-based ethics
    • Physical ability to bend, crouch, lift and be in motion for the majority of the shift
    • Previous customer service experience is an asset
    • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with the ability to multi-task
    • Enjoys rewarding work with the opportunity to finish what you start and see the task completed to end
    • Is or has an interest in working towards a career in the Hospitality / Tourism industry

    What you can expect from us:

    The Sun Peaks Grand culture encourages individual initiative combined with a collaborative approach to delivering our guests' finest mountain resort experience. We value innovation and development that contribute to business success and personal growth. We also know you have a life outside of work and encourage work-life balance, including reaping the benefits of living in a resort and the mountain’s summer and winter activities.

    Incentive Program:

    This role is eligible for an incentive for successful applicants to select fully reimbursed staff accommodation for the Summer season OR a free Alpine/Nordic mountain pass for the Winter 22-23 season.

    If you are a student currently enrolled in a college/university tourism and/or hospitality program (validated by uploading the required documentation and completing the information on your student status in the job application fields), you are eligible for both incentives above.

    Conditions apply to these incentives and will be discussed in detail with successful applicants during the interview and at the job offer stage.

We also know you have a life outside of work and encourage work-life balance, including reaping the benefits of living in a resort and the mountain’s summer and winter activities.", 'Delivers quality service when assisting guests with room amenities, cleaning, and additional hotel standard special requests as it relates to their guestroom stay', 'Ideal Candidate', 'Acts with professionalism and provides a service standard that elevates the guest experience', 'Enjoys rewarding work with the opportunity to finish what you start and see the task completed to end', 'Is or has an interest in working towards a career in the Hospitality / Tourism industry', 'Works with integrity and is accountable for performance/completion of daily assigned job tasks', 'Performs deep cleaning rotational cleaning duties as scheduled', 'Guest Experience:', 'Reliable and responsible person with team-based ethics', 'Performs deep cleaning rotational cleaning duties aligned with the schedule', 'Demonstrates initiative to help the Rooms department succeed by the willingness to cross-train and assist coworkers with the business needs and leadership team’s direction', 'Physical ability to bend, crouch, lift and be in motion for the majority of the shift']

title: Gallery Housekeeping Support Associate
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
RH at its core is about taste, and we believe the idea of scaling taste is large and far reaching.

The RH brand attracts the best designers, artisans, manufacturers and talent in our industry, scaling and rendering their work more valuable across our integrated platform, enabling us to curate the most compelling collection of luxury home furnishings in the world. We are moving the brand beyond curating and selling products to conceptualizing and selling spaces by building an ecosystem of products, places, services and spaces that elevates and establishes the RH brand as a global thought leader, taste and place maker.

At RH we believe deeply that the \"right\" people are our greatest asset. We value people with high energy, who possess the ability to energize others. People who are smart, creative and have a point of view. People who see the answer in every problem, versus those who see the problem in every answer. People who are driven, determined and won't take \"no\" for an answer. We value team players, people who are more concerned with what's right, rather than who's right.

RH is seeking a Housekeeping Support Associate to join our team in providing world-class service to guests while taking great care of our equipment and facilities.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Live Our Vision, Values and Beliefs every day
  • Build and maintain partnerships within the Gallery team
  • Assist in the maintenance of the Gallery at all levels:
    • Vacuuming floors, tidying up rooms, gathering trash and restocking pantries
    • Polishing furniture, deep cleaning rugs, floors, windows and walls
    • Light exterior maintenance and landscaping
    • Deep cleaning and refreshing of restrooms

OUR REQUIREMENTS
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Mental flexibility
  • Strong organizational and time management skills
  • Ability to recognize and respond to multiple priorities
  • Commitment to Quality, detail focused on all levels
  • Delivery of first-class service to our employees and our clients

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
  • Ability to lift and mobilize small to medium items up to 25 lbs. while utilizing appropriate equipment and techniques
  • Ability to maneuver effectively around gallery floor, stock room and office
  • Position entails prolonged standing, twisting, stooping, kneeling, squatting, bending and climbing
ABOUT US
RH is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, marital status, age, disability, sexual orientation, military/veteran status, or any other status protected by federal or state law or local ordinance.

title: Parts Room / Toolcrib Attendant
description:
SUMMARY OF THE ROLE:

We are looking for a result driven and self-motivated individual to join our Equipment Maintenance Department team. The successful candidate will possess some knowledge of general purchasing practices and have the ability to work with tight deadlines while maintaining accuracy. Mammoet offers a challenging work environment with the opportunity to grow personally and within the role.

WHAT YOUÃ¢LL BE DOING:

Responsibilities (including but not limited to)

  • Conduct all business in a professional, respectful manner  
  • Understand and support Mammoet, SHE-Q and business policies, processes, and procedures
  • Ensure compliance with all SHE-Q responsibilities as per SHE-Q manual
  • Report all near misses and incidents to supervision or management
  • Attend monthly EMD and Office Safety Meetings
  • Facilitates the operations of the toolcrib by doing the following:
  •  
    • Issues tools as required
    • Maintains accurate records of tools taken and returned
    • Identifies broken tools and sends them for repairs
    • Replaces missing tools
    • Maintains consumables stock levels

 

  • Facilitates the operations of the parts room by doing the following:

 

    • issues parts/supplies to personnel upon request
    • performs goods receipt of incoming shipments
    • picks inventory as required
    • puts parts away in proper locations
    • ensuring parts room is clean and organized
    • conducts inventory counts
    • controls stock levels
    • restocks parts room as required
    • ability to operate forklift

 

  • Assists Mammoet employees to identify parts and materials
  • Creates purchase orders as required, ensures accurate ordering of parts and materials for EMD inventory and projects
  • Manages and maintains material numbers in SAP
  • Ensures accuracy of inventory, control stock level and reports to parts room supervisor discrepancies
  • Performs other Purchasing Department functions as required
  • Uses and maintains the computerized inventory/purchasing management system in SAP
WHAT YOUÃ¢LL NEED:

Education & Experience

 

Education

  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • Post-Secondary Education in Purchasing or Parts man designation is an asset

Experience

  • Basic to intermediate computer skills
  • 1-2 years parts room experience
  • Experience with parts manuals and identifying components and parts
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience with SAP database system is an asset

Characteristics

  • Ability to work with others and independently
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Organized
  • Able to prioritize
  • Strong communication skills
  • Self-motivated
  • Service orientated
  • Dependable
WHAT YOUÃ¢LL GET:

About our Company

Mammoet helps clients improve construction efficiency and optimize the uptime of plants and installations. For that purpose, we provide solutions for lifting, transporting, installing and decommissioning large and heavy structures.

Our services are focused on the petrochemical and mining industries, civil engineering, power generation and offshore projects. The logistic challenges in these industries are growing daily. Factors such as remote locations, harsh climates and a strong emphasis on the environment are constantly driving us towards smarter and safer solutions.

We provide the following services:

  • Engineered lifting and transportation services
  • Lifting, transportation and installation of modular constructions
  • Factory-to-foundation projects
  • Plant turnaround logistics
  • Salvage and wreck removal
  • Decommissioning of onshore and offshore installations
  • Trading in new and used equipment worldwide

For over two hundred years, weâ€™ve been known for the unique capability of our state-of-the-art equipment. But itâ€™s the trust of our clients that has brought us where we are today. Their confidence inspires 5,000 Mammoet professionals to give it their all each day and truly make a difference in projects all over the world.

 

About our region

This will be a full-time position operating out of our Fort McMurray Office.

 

Benefits

Salary will be commensurate based upon education and experience. Mammoet offers competitive wages and health benefits.   In addition to this, we offer an engaging environment in which a variety of career development and growth opportunities exist to our employees both locally and internationally.   Mammoet is an existing benefactor for variety of local and national charity organizations and also provides support for our own employeesâ€™ extracurricular activities. To view our Human Capital Values, please visit our careers website at www.mammoet.com/en/jobs.

WANT TO KNOW MORE?:

Interested candidates may submit their resumes and salary expectations directly to the job posting following the below link or by visiting http://www.mammoet.com/en/Jobs/Job-opportunities/

 

 

We offer an engaging environment in which a variety of career development and growth opportunities exist to our employees both locally and internationally.   Mammoet is an existing benefactor for variety of local and national charity organizations and also provides support for our own employeesâ€™ extracurricular activities. To view our Human Capital Values, please visit our careers website at www.mammoet.com/en/jobs.

title: Home maker/House keeping
description:
Homemaker/HSK

 

Second Family Care is looking to expand our growing team to support hundreds of homes right in your community. We are experiencing transformational change to best address the needs of our community, with opportunities for progression and promotion closer than ever for the right candidate. We are currently looking for homemakers to help members of the vulnerable sector in our community. Our services create a fulfilling opportunity for vulnerable populations to remain independent in their homes longer.

 

Why Work with Second Family Care?

 

-Higher than industry average wages -- rates up to $22 per hour.

 

-Paid training, support and mentorship are provided for those looking to enter the home care industry.

 

-Health Benefits - We ask you to take care of others; we want to help take care of you! Minimal eligibility requirements.

 

-Get Started Fast - you could be working in two days from now!

 

-Stress-free scheduling - Set your hours, set your days. NO WEEKENDS REQUIRED 

Start and stop when you need. It makes it easy to schedule around; kids, education, vacations and other commitments. Things change; we get it! You set your own part-time or full-time schedule. Commit only to what's right for you!

 

-Client/assignment matching- We don't try to fit a square peg in a round hole! Our assignments need to be the right fit for everyone involved.

 

-Pick your travel - you set the areas you want to travel to

 

-Great support -Work that works for you!

 

-Non-exclusive -- use SFC to fill in the gaps in your schedule. If you love working with us, fill in your whole schedule.

title: Housekeeping Room Attendant
company: Courtyard by Marriott Kingston (Easton's Group of Hotels Inc.)
description:
Job Overview

Clean guest rooms and/or other assigned areas in a timely and thorough manner to ensure total guest satisfaction

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Clean and service assigned rooms or areas according to established standards and procedures including making beds, dusting, vacuuming, cleaning and sanitizing bathrooms, removing trash, etc. May include cleaning of kitchen area, room refrigerator, coffee maker, cups, glasses, silverware, etc.
  • Notify supervisor when service is complete so rooms may be sold or occupied. Report any room unable to be serviced to supervisor according to established procedures.
  • Report to supervisor needed repairs or unsafe conditions.
  • Respond to guest complaints, special requests and ensure corrective action is taken to achieve complete guest satisfaction.
  • Monitor and control supplies/amenities and minimize waste within all areas of housekeeping.
  • Maintains linen cart and supplies neat and organized to department standards.
  • Maintains security of equipment, keys and supplies issued each day.
  • Report, turn in, and/or log all lost and found items according to established procedures.
  • Promote teamwork and quality service through daily communication and coordination with other departments.
  • May regularly assist with deep cleaning projects.
  • May have turndown duties.
  • Perform other duties as assigned. In carrying out your duties you will follow all Company and Brand Standards

QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS

  • Basic reading, writing, and math skills.
  • Some housekeeping experience
  • Friendly and hospitality focused
  • Attention to detail
  • Ability to work under pressure in a fast paced, stressful environment
  • Organizational skills
  • Teamwork
  • Problem solving

title: House Cleaner
description:
New Image Cleaning is looking for enthusiastic and energetic people to join our cleaning teams around York Region area!

If you have previous cleaning experience or are coming from a related field, we would like to hear from you!

High attention to detail, great time management skills, and the ability to work in a team are a must for this position. Preference will be shown to applicants that have a valid driver's license and vehicle.

Responsibilities and Duties:

Build and maintain client relationships by being pleasant, present, and presentable.
Clean houses to company standards and client specifications.
Clean and disinfect bathrooms, kitchens, bedrooms, and living spaces.
Travel to and from clients' houses across the York Region area according to the daily schedule.
Maintain and refill company-provided products and equipment.
Communicate frequently with the manager and scheduler.
Here's what's in it for you:

- Fixed weekday schedule (Monday - Friday).

- Daytime shifts (approx. 8:30am-4:30pm)

- Approx. 30- 40 hours per week.

- Company Vehicle

- Available overtime

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $16.00-$19.00 per hour

Additional pay:

Tips
Benefits:

Dental care
Extended health care
Life insurance
Vision care
Schedule:

8 hour shift
Day shift
Monday to Friday
No weekends
COVID-19 considerations:
To keep our staff safe and healthy we've implemented new health and safety measures.

Experience:

Cleaning: 1 year (preferred)
Licence/Certification:

Drivers License (preferred)

title: Uniform Room Attendant - 2nd Shift
description:
Requisition Number: 113738

Job Description

Cintas is seeking a Uniform Room Attendant - 2nd Shift to help ensure customer satisfaction for our larger customers. The position is located on the customer's premises where the primary responsibility of the Attendant is distributing uniforms to the customer's employees. Responsibilities include promptly and efficiently responding to customer inquiries and concerns face to face; maintaining and stocking inventory; fixing minor repairs; delivering product to various locations of customer facility; ordering and labeling new garments; organizing the room for garment handout; and maintaining a record of daily transactions. This is an independent position which requires the ability to make decisions to ensure high levels of customer service at all times, including making decisions regarding product quality requirements. Attendants must also adhere to both Cintas' and the customer's applicable safety programs/procedures. The Attendant must be a team player and have basic knowledge of computers.

Skills/Qualifications

Required

  • High School Diploma/GED
  • Minimum 1 year of customer service experience
  • Office/clerical work experience

 

Preferred

  • Professional laundry experience
  • Experience using an ironing press and steaming equipment

Our employee-partners enjoy:

 

  • Competitive Pay
  • Weekly Pay Cheques
  • RRSP and DPSP Contribution
  • Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance Package
  • Disability & Life Insurance Package
  • Paid Vacation & Holidays
  • Career Advancement Opportunities

 

Headquartered in Cincinnati, Cintas is a publicly held company traded over the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the symbol CTAS and is a component of both the Standard & Poor’s 500 Index and Nasdaq-100 Index.

Cintas Corporation helps more than 900,000 businesses of all types and sizes get READY™ to open their doors with confidence every day by providing a wide range of products and services that enhance our customers’ image and help keep their facilities and employees clean, safe and looking their best. With products and services including uniforms, mats, mops, restroom supplies, first aid and safety products, fire extinguishers and testing, and safety and compliance training, Cintas helps customers get Ready for the Workday®.

To support our growth across North America, we’re seeking driven professionals with ambition to move up within our company. Our professional culture, our dedication to our employee-partners and limitless career opportunities—these are just a few benefits we’re proud to offer. Our employee-partners know every job is critical, and that teamwork drives innovation. Let’s talk about how you’ll fit into our team and how your hard work will be recognized through competitive pay, world-class benefits and ongoing career development. Are you Ready™ for limitless opportunities at Cintas?

In accordance with applicable laws (including human rights and accessibility legislation), accommodations will be provided in all parts of the hiring process. Applicants are required to make their needs known in advance.



Job Category: Production 
Organization: Global Accounts
Employee Status: Regular
Schedule: Full Time
Shift: 2nd Shift

title: Room attendant-Best Western Plus, Kelowna - full time
description:
Job Description

As a Room Attendant you are authorized to exceed guest expectations by creating “picture perfect” guest experiences throughout the hotel; each and every shift. From the hotel lobby right through to the guest room itself; the Guests’ first impression around cleanliness is a powerful and lasting one.

Some Duties of a Room Attendant include:

  • Own the guest experience by cleaning and presenting the room to its fullest potential.
  • Report maintenance issues by preparing maintenance work orders as soon as you see the deficiency.
  • Prepare for your shift with a well-stocked cart; complete with approved cleaning supplies, linens and guest room supplies. Ensure your vacuum, mop and dusters are clean and in good working order.
  • Respect for guest property and privacy should always be exercised; strict adherence to lost and found procedures on all items found in guest rooms and public areas. Guest articles should never be removed from occupied rooms.
  • Guarding our guests and your own personal safety and security is paramount; you must know and practice all emergency procedures for the hotel and policies that protect the privacy and security of our guests and yourself

Skills/Education/Experience:

  • Previous experience in housekeeping or in a hotel is an asset
  • Desire to work as a team player and establish a connection with coworkers and management to cultivate a positive atmosphere
  • Proficient in English
  • Attention to detail and pride in a quality job done well
  • You must be legally able to work in Canada at this moment

Pomeroy Perks

  • Competitive wages $18.00 per hour, plus summer loyalty bonus and incentive programmes
  • Flexible schedules
  • Paid on the job training with lots of opportunities to grow 
  • Pomeroy and Best Western World wide stay and travel programme for employees and families
  • Best of all you have the chance to work alongside the best people in the world, fun, hard working as well as being a bunch of people who just care !

Working Conditions:

The Housekeeping department is typically the largest department in the hotel, operating 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, and 365 days a year. Room Attendants may experience:

  • Long periods of standing and bending
  • Continuous physical movement during work hours
  • Lifting up to, but not limited to, 30 lbs.
  • Periods of working alone

title: Room Attendant
description:
The Hotel Arts Group is currently looking for a full time Room Attendant to work in our Housekeeping Department. Our guests expect a clean room, fresh linens and exceptional amenities. Do you have what it takes to be a Room Attendant at Hotel Arts? Are you detail oriented, organized and driven by your passion for customer service?

Did you answer yes? Well what are you waiting for, apply now!

Job Requirements: 

  • Previous Hotel/Resort experience an asset
  • High school or equivalent education preferred
  • Ability to operate various pieces of cleaning equipment
  • Standing for long periods and some heavy lifting required
  • Must be available to work weekends

Please email your resume to the attention of the Human Resources Department. Please include in your cover letter your years of experience in housekeeping (if applicable) and why you would be a great fit for our team.

To learn more about Hotel Arts, please visit our website at: www.hotelarts.ca

Applicants who do not already have legal permission to work in Canada will not be considered. 

Please be advised that only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Hotel Arts Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Public Area Attendant (All Shifts)
description:
Overview:

The main purpose of the job is to support and assist the responsible manager to maintain a safe and clean environment. The key role would be to upkeep the cleanliness of the Resort area to a high standard.  Reporting to the Public Areas Manager, the Public Area Attendant will follow task lists that give direction to clean areas within the casino.  

Responsibilities:
  • Respond promptly to requests from guests and other departments.
  • Fill cart with supplies and transport cart to assigned area.
  • Vacuum carpets and corridors
  • Remove trash and empty all waste bins.
  • Empty ashtrays and other service items.
  • Clean glass and mirrors.
  • Sweep and mop floor surfaces.
  • Clean the bathroom and toilet.
  • Clean areas as assigned.
  • Ensure that rooms are odour free.
  • Report anything in need of repair or replacement to the appropriate person.
  • Keep cleaning areas and tidy at all time and cleaning materials safely stored.
  • Maintain polite and good communication with coworkers and customers at all times.
  • Follow all company and safety and security policies and procedures; report any maintenance problems, safety hazards, accidents, or injuries; complete safety training and certifications; properly store flammable materials.
  • Be prepared to receive and undertake further training as required by the center.
  • Turn in all lost and found items.
  • To look out for the safety of yourself, co-workers and to follow all Health and Safety requirements in the workplace.
  • All other duties as assigned
Qualifications:
  • Customer Service Skills: Public Area Attendants need proper customer service skills.
  • Physical Coordination: The position requires physical, repetitive tasks to be completed including the following actions: move, lift, carry, push, pull, sit, bend, crouch, kneel and stand. Must have the ability to lift and carry up to 30 lbs.
  • Able to work as a part of a team.
  • Able to work with little supervision.
  • Ability to work calmly under pressure.

  • Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities:Fast-paced environment, Repetitive tasks, physically demanding, Attention to detail, Combination of sitting, standing, walking, Bending, crouching, kneeling. Must be able to lift/carry up to 30 lbs.

The schedule for this position may vary and would require the ability to work shift work, late nights, weekends and holidays.

 

WE OFFER

  •  A competitive wage and excellent benefits.
  • Shuttle service from West Edmonton location.
  • All associates participate in our â€œCircle of Serviceâ€ program which rewards and empowers individuals who provide outstanding customer service.
  • An opportunity to work within a progressive, exciting team environment.
  • An opportunity to work with a skilled Management team.

title: Room Attendant
description:
7 Star Service is in our DNA and the Canalta Hotel Family is looking for our next secret weapon to join our team. This position won't bore you as everyday will be a new and challenging experience! You'll be immersed in the Canalta Hotel world assisting our guests to ensure they have a Legendary experience through our remarkably clean hotel and looking for opportunities to create smiles. At Canalta we are committed to honesty, hard work, amazing guest service and high standards. You will be empowered to provide a new, unprecedented level of service - one that ranks 7 Stars. We are looking for someone who possesses a Warrior's spirit, a servant's heart and a fun-loving attitude and who is up to the challenge and has a passion to continually learn and grow with our family


Our Mission:

Create "I-can't-believe-they-did-that" guest experiences through remarkably empowered team members


What you will be responsible for:

  • Cleanliness of guest rooms according to Canalta standards
  • Maintaining the highest of cleanliness standards
  • Maintaining a clean and organized workspace
  • Complete required paperwork
  • Complete required training
  • Teamwork
  • Maintain a safe working environment



What we offer you:

  • A fun and dynamic work environment
  • A competitive wage
  • Group benefits including extended health care, long term disability, life insurance, dental, optical and prescriptions for full time positions
  • Use of Canalta managed hotels facilities (pool, waterslide, hot tub, fitness room) for you and your immediate family(based on hotel occupancy)
  • Team member discounts at all Canalta managed hotels.
  • Friends & Family discounts at all Canalta managed hotels.

title: Técnico de Mix Room
description:
Número de Empleo:44130 
Grupo: Magna Exteriors 
División: Decoplas Queretaro Lab Co. 
Tipo de trabajo: Permanente/regular 
Localidad: QUERETARO
 

Descripción del grupo
El catálogo de productos de Magna Exteriorsincluye sistemas de acceso, tales como puerta levadiza, molduras exteriores,sistemas modulares, módulos delanteros que incluyen la fascia, sistemas aerodinámicos activos y otros componentes estructurales ligeros para automóviles, camiones comerciales y otros mercados industriales.

 Reconocida en el mundo como innovadora en todos los aspectos del exterior del vehículo,Magna proporciona todo lo necesario, desde el desarrollo y diseño de materiales hasta la manufactura y el ensamble,para ayudar a los fabricantes de automóviles a crear vehículos elegantes de vanguardia alrededor del mundo.

 

Resumen de la función

Monitorear, medir y controlar el proceso de Preparación de Pintura, previo y durante la producción, en los diferentes turnos, respetando los parámetros y características definidos para los diferentes sistemas de bombeo, con el objetivo de asegurar una producción eficiente y de calidad

 

Responsabilidades clave

- Asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de los sistemas circulatorios y piggables.
- Descarga y carga de materiales de un Sistema Circulatorio.
-Limpieza y/o lavado de un Sistema Circulatorio.
- Carga  y descarga de materiales de un Sistema Piggable.

- Revisión de propiedades de materiales ( Viscosidad/ Temperatura/ Resistividad/RPM´s/Finura).
- Preparación de materiales (Agitación, Solvatación e incorporación)

- Seguimiento de Llenado y Respaldo  de formatos Propiedades y KPI´s .
- Monitoreo y aseguramiento de buen funcionamiento de los sistemas (Circulatorios y Piggables) y comportamiento del material en los mismos.
- Sustracción, almacenaje  y envío de muestras para pruebas.                                                                                                                

- Asegurar el destilado de solventes y abastecimiento del mismo en las cabinas de pintura.
- Revisar, analizar e investigar causas y soluciones a problemas de pintura en línea en conjunto con producción.                          

Calificaciones/requerimientos clave

  • Conocimiento básico en Proceso de Producción.
  • Conocimiento básico en procesos de pintura.
  • Conocimiento en preparación y ajuste de Materiales.
  • Conocimiento en uso y manejo de Sistemas Circulatorios/Piggables.
  • Conocimiento en uso y manejo de Equipo destilador de solventes.
  • Conocimiento de manejo de equipos de Laboratorio para medición de Propiedades y Pruebas.

Información adicional

Disponibilidad para rolar turnos

07--Operations F--Permanent/Regular

title: Housekeeping Associates, Bay Street - Equinox Fitness Clubs
description:
Company Description

OUR STORY

Equinox Group is a high growth collective of the world's most influential, experiential, and differentiated lifestyle brands. We restlessly seek what is next for maximizing life - and boldly grow the lifestyle brands and experiences that define it. In addition to Equinox, our other brands, Blink, Pure Yoga, SoulCycle, Equinox Hotels and Equinox Media are all recognized for inspiring and motivating members and employees to maximize life. Our portfolio of brands is recognized globally with locations within every major city across the United States in addition to London, Toronto, and Vancouver.

OUR CODE

We are passionate about high performance living and we practice what we preach – investing time in our own health and fitness. We believe that everyone has untapped potential within them and it takes a disruptive approach to unleash it. We dream big and don’t settle for the status quo. We sweat the details. We never accept less than 110% to help each other deliver the Equinox experience and enable our members to get great results.  We are obsessed with what’s new, what’s now, what’s next. Never following, always leading, living ahead of the moment in fashion, culture and consumer behavior. We aren’t just a company; we’re a community vested in each other’s success. We value humility and a team approach at every level of the company.

If you are a high performing individual who is passionate about winning and inspiring others then we are excited to discuss career opportunities with you.

Job Description

We are looking for energetic and enthusiastic Housekeeping Associates to join the Equinox team. This is a great position for a candidate looking to make a significant impact in a growing and dynamic organization based in a state-of-the-art, luxury facility in Toronto. 

 

Job responsibilities include but are not limited to the following: 

  • Ensure that the club and exercise equipment are clean and well maintained while providing all members, prospective members, and guests with excellent customer service 
  • Ensure that the sidewalk entrance and lobby are presentable 
  • Clean the locker room and stock all locker room consumables 
  • Clean and organize storage, laundry, exercise, and coat rooms 
  • Maintain an adequate supply of towels on the exercise floor 
  • Provide maintenance for all equipment 
  • Receive and store all deliveries 
  • Assist with special events 
  • Notify the Housekeeping Manager when any rooms or equipment need immediate attention 
Qualifications

The successful candidate must have the following experience, skills, and education: 

  • Must possess a clear understanding of what constitutes a clean and sanitary environment 
  • Prior experience in cleaning and laundry services is highly preferred
  • Ability to service athletic equipment along with previous experience working with cleaning products and hand tools 
  • Strong customer service, organizational, communication, and multi-tasking abilities

 



Additional Information

AS A MEMBER OF THE EQUINOX TEAM YOU WILL RECEIVE:

  • We offer competitive salary, benefits, and industry leading commission opportunities for club employees
  • Complimentary Club membership
  • Perks and incentives with our products and services including Personal Training, Pilates, Spa and Shop

All Equinox Employees are required to be fully vaccinated with a COVID-19 vaccine series, approved by Health Canada or the World Health Organization, as a condition of hire. Should you be the successful candidate, you will be required to comply with Equinox's mandatory Vaccination Policy.

This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities, or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department.

Equinox is an equal opportunity employer. For more information regarding our career opportunities, please visit one of our clubs or our website at https://careers.equinox.com/

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Must have a legal right to work in Canada.

title: Housekeeping Aide - Casual
description:
Position Title: Housekeeping Aide 
Reporting to: Environmental Services Manager
Hours: Casual
Location: Niagara Long Term Care Residence

Are you an individual that has a passion for making a difference? 

At Niagara Long Term Care Residence we are passionate about ‘Making Every Moment Matter.” We are seeking a candidate that shares our values - a person who has a passion to make a difference, who has a strong moral compass and has a commitment to teamwork. 


At the Niagara Long Term Care Residence, we are passionate about providing compassionate care for families loved ones, where the residents of our home come before anything else. Our values at Lancaster follow a ‘People’ focused Philosophy, Participation Excellence Openness Performance Longevity Efficient Use of Resources. This philosophy can be seen in every aspect and level of our home. 


A day in the role as a housekeeping aide at Lancaster Long Term Care Residence:

As a housekeeping aide at Niagara Long Term Care Residence you will be placed in a role with high expectations to provide exemplary housekeeping needs for the residents of our home. Unlike other housekeeping positions in this role, you get to see the effect you have on a person's everyday life. In your role, it is expected that you make personal connections with the residents, as providing them care is our top priority.


In this position you will be apart of our housekeeping team, and will be responsible for but not limited to:

  • Ensuring the daily neatness and cleanliness of residents rooms, offices and common areas,
  • Cleaning, sanitizing, and performing duties, including but not limited to: routine, deep, terminal and discharge cleaning, floor cleaning and maintenance, and waste management according to schedules,
  • Maintaining a clean, safe environment for residents utilizing infection control principles,
  • Checking that supplies are adequate in housekeeping and equipment is in proper working order before commencing daily routine,
  • Carrying out duties in a positive and professional manner within a multidisciplinary team,
  • Performing other duties as assigned.
     

Qualifications:

At the Niagara Long Term Care Residence we take pride in our employees, so your qualifications are important to us. We use them to get to know you and see if we are a good fit for each other. The qualifications needed to join our family at Lancaster are as follows:

  • A positive mindset, as well as a connection with our values,
  • Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills, oral and written, and the demonstrated ability to work independently and collaboratively is essential,
  • Physical and mental requirements needed in the position,
  • Knowledge of housekeeping and experience in the role is an asset,
  • Basic understanding of cleaning equipment,
  • Knowledge of WHMIS and Fire Safety Procedures,
  • Demonstrated commitment to learning and continuous improvement,
  • Candidates that have the ability to effectively communicate both verbally and written in French & English will be given preference if the qualifications are equal,
  • Must have a clear vulnerable sector screen, no older than 6 months, TB test results, less than 6 months old, evidence of flu shot, must be able to provide three work references.


How to apply?

Please submit a resume, cover letter, and references to david.corbett@niagaraltc.ca. We look forward to speaking with you, and making every moment count!

Our organization takes the accessibility needs of employees with disabilities into account during the position summary review process. Employees are required to notify their director manager/supervisor if they have any particular accessibility needs and the organization will work with the employee to address them.

title: Houseperson
description: <section class="cached-bot-fjv-skeletonstyle__CachedSkeletonDescription-sc-gqtazs-0 gbrdjA">Job Description Summary The House Attendant (HA) works with the Housekeeping Management Team to assist Room Attendants on assigned floors or buildings by collecting dirty linens and transporting to the laundry area, delivering clean linens to Room Attendant carts, and retrieving trash throughout the hotel. Assist with the commercial laundry function and/or the cleaning of public area spaces, exterior entrances to the hotel, and parking lot. Will be assigned special projects as assigned by the Housekeeping Manager. Job Description DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Deliver on the promise of Sonesta Service in all interactions with guests and clients according to the Sonesta G.U.E.S.T. standards. Work with Room Attendants with heavy items such as mattresses and linens. Deliver linens and other supplies to Room Attendants. Maintain the cleanliness and organization of floor closets and corridors to include removing trash, wiping down shelves/counters; sweeping, moping and/or vacuuming floors; and removing non-floor closet items and storing in appropriate areas. Respond to guests’ requests such as in a timely and efficient manner. Clean other designated areas such as public restrooms, storage rooms, and other public area spaces. Report needed repairs or unsafe conditions to supervisor. Respond to special requests, guest complaints, and the delivery of housekeeping/room supplies to achieve complete guest satisfaction. Minimize waste of supplies and amenities within all areas of housekeeping. Deliver lost and found items according to established procedures. May regularly assist with deep cleaning projects. When assigned to laundry, monitor laundry supplies and equipment to ensure they are sufficient and in working order. Operate washers and dryers according to hotel standards and manufacturers’ guidelines. Receive soiled linens and inspect for damaged or stained items. Fold and store clean linens, report damages to supervisor. Promote teamwork and quality service through daily communication and coordination with other shifts and departmental management. Ensure compliance with federal, state and local laws regarding health and safety services. Perform other duties as assigned. QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS: Some previous housekeeping experience preferred. Previous background from the extended stay industry preferred. Ability to speak, read, and write fluent English is preferred; other languages beneficial. Basic reading, writing and mathematical abilities are preferred. Frequently standing up, bending, climbing, kneeling, and moving about the facility. Carrying, lifting or pulling items weighing up to 75 pounds. Will be required to regularly use commercial cleaning chemicals. Will be required to work mornings, evening, weekends, and holidays. Additional Job Description The Yorkville Royal Sonesta is a equal opportunity employer. If you require accommodation under AODA please let HR know. Benefits Sonesta recognizes that benefits play a vital role in helping ensure the health and financial security of employees and their families. We offer a variety of benefits to our employees including: Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Health Savings Account with Company Match 401(k) Retirement Plan with Company Match Paid Vacation and Sick Days Sonesta Hotel Discounts Educational Assistance Paid Parental Leave Company Paid Life Insurance Company Paid Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance Various Employee Perks and Discounts Upon submitting your application, please ensure you complete a full application in addition to attaching a resume. Incomplete applications received will not be considered.</section>

title: Room Attendant
description:
Career OpportunityRoom AttendantPOSITION: Room Attendant DEPARTMENT: Housekeeping REPORTS TO: Housekeeping Supervisor STATUS OF POSITION: Seasonal WHO WE ARE: At Horseshoe Resort, we are a team that loves to serve people, priding ourselves on the service that our colleagues deliver to our guests
Horseshoe Resort is always looking for talented individuals to join our growing team of hospitality professionals and recreation enthusiasts
If you are outgoing, friendly and love adventure and the outdoors, you may be the person we are looking for! Position Summary Room Attendants are responsible for cleaning guest rooms
Room Attendants need to maintain a high standard of cleanliness and attention to detail while working in a fast-paced environment
Duties and Responsibilities: Working alone or in pairs, they need to ensure rooms are clean and made to hotel standards prior to guest check-in time
Changing soiled linens, vacuuming, and dusting, cleaning bathrooms and replacing room amenities
Respond to guest inquiries as required Maintain and restock linen cart Qualifications: Be able to be on their feet for a full shift, up to 8 hours or more Be able to move up and down the stairs Be flexible with their schedule, primarily working day shifts and occasionally evening shifts, as business levels require Be able to lift and carry up to 50lbs and push up to 250lbs Be able to twist, bend, and reach while working at a fast pace Join our team today, and enjoy employee perks such as Resort staff pass for yourself and your dependents, retail, lodging, and restaurant discounts, along with additional perks and discounts at our other affiliated resort – Deerhurst Resort in Muskoka
