title: Order Builder
description:
About Us

Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!

Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.

We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love.

We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.

Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Coca-Cola Life™, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy®, and A&W®.

About This Opportunity

Statut : Seasonal contract

Work schedule : Monday to Friday, evening shift, 2pm to 10 pm

Location : 111 Railway Street Kingston, ON, K7K 2M1

Wage : $18.73/hr

Coke Canada Bottling General Labourer’s are responsible for physical handling of product, materials, supplies and equipment. Using an electric pallet jack, you will pick our customers order based on the information you have in your handheld scanner. Once your pallet/order is complete you ensure it is wrapped, labelled and prepared to be shipped.

Responsibilities
  • Responsible for pulling cases of product based on pick ticket information to accurately build orders for loading onto delivery trucks
  • Manually lift and move product to restock and repack ensuring date code accuracy and proper rotation
  • Adhere to all manufacturing practices and safety standards
  • Responsible for meeting productivity requirements
  • Stage completed pallets in designated area
  • Repetitively lift, carry, and position product (weighing up to 50 lbs) above shoulder height without assistance
  • Consistent kneeling, squatting and reaching above the head

Qualifications
  • High School diploma or GED
  • Minimum six (6) months of general work experience
  • Ability to push and pull manual and powered equipment containing product loads for a minimum of 100 yards without assistance
  • Ability to read information in small, medium, and large print
  • Ability to stand and walk for long periods of time

Important

All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification, and driver’s abstract review. In addition, all new employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide Coke Canada with proof of vaccination. Please advise the Talent Acquisition team if you have any questions or concerns in regard to any of the foregoing once you are contacted for further consideration.

Coke Canada Bottling is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce with several programs, policies and resources in place to support our people. For individuals requiring accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-844-383-2653 or email HR@cokecanada.com .

  • A valid driver’s license with a clean driving record with no major violations over the last three (3) years

title: Sales Development Manager, Multi-channel
description:
Facility Location- Regina

Work Location - Regina

Posting Locations - Regina

Department - Regina Generalist Team 1

Job Function - Sales and Marketing

Employee Type - Regular Employee FT Salaried

Shift/Hours –

About Us

Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!

Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.

We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love.

We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.

Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy®, and A&W®.

About This Opportunity

Coke Canada Bottling Sales Development Manager’s (SDM) are responsible for identifying and selling against opportunities within Coke Canada’s local and national large store customers. The SDM is required to maximize profitable sales opportunities by thoroughly understanding the complexity of the channels and building relationships with customers. They are also responsible for finding new local large store customers.

Responsibilities
  • Successfully sell customer promotional plans, incremental displays and equipment placements that include annual Customer Marketing Agreements and align with the customer's and the Coke Canada system’s business objectives and strategies.
  • Evaluate outlet opportunities for new and existing Large Store customers.
  • Develop a customized business plan addressing the critical needs of the customer(s)
  • Work collaboratively with the merchandising Supervisors and order replenishment team to ensure that revenue and profit goals are achieved, and that appropriate inventory levels and merchandising standards are maintained at each store
  • Ensures a high level of customer service and resolves issues promptly
  • Sell in promotional programs and ensure dealer compliance
  • Execute channel and customer promotions/programs that leverage national brand strategies
  • Proactively arrange time and territory to achieve optimum face-to-face selling opportunities
  • Build or modify displays, sections, end caps, racks & coolers in line with Coke Canada Bottling’s standards and programs
  • Be able to lift, carry and position product (weight up to 50lbs or 22kgs) above shoulder height without assistance

Qualifications
  • One to three (1-3) years selling in consumer goods industry required
  • Minimum of one (1) year in consumer products/direct store delivery sales/major account management
  • Strong analytical, organizational, planning, verbal and written communications skills are a must
  • Proficient using a variety of computer programs
  • Valid driver's license and driving record free from any major violations for the past three (3) years
  • Must have access to a personal vehicle for use during working hours
  • Post-secondary education is preferred

Important

All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification, and driver’s abstract review. In addition, all new employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide Coke Canada with proof of vaccination. Please advise the Talent Acquisition team if you have any questions or concerns in regard to any of the foregoing once you are contacted for further consideration.

Coke Canada Bottling is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce with several programs, policies and resources in place to support our people. For individuals requiring accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-844-383-2653 or email HR@cokecanada.com.

For more information about Coke Canada Bottling, please visit cokecanada.com

title: Route Process Administrator
description:
Facility Location- Brampton

Work Location - Brampton

Posting Locations - Brampton

Department - Central Services

Job Function - Other Talent Area

Employee Type - Regular Employee FT Salaried

Shift/Hours –

About Us

Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!

Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.

We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love.

We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.

Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Coca-Cola Life™, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy®, evian® and A&W®.

About This Opportunity

As a Route Process Administrator you eill preform pre-settlement and/or cashiering duties in a Distribution Center in accordance with standard procedures, including driver over/short and post-delivery claim research and resolution.

Currently hybrid, must be ready to return to office full time.

Responsibilities
  • Handle CST ticket and assist with Customer Reconnect calls
  • Review and verify end of day driver paperwork
    • Run daily route status report to verify that all delivery routes settled
    • Send messages to route accounting department regarding settlement issues
    • Check in and check out messages
    • Ensure proof of deliveries are included in driver paperwork (DSD, store stamps, etc.) and maintain Missing Documents Log
    • Perform cashiering duties including ensuring Fed-Ready status of deposit
    • Ensure security of route cash - Validate proper use of cash drop log
    • Receive and verify full-service bag count.
    • Count full-service cash and finalize handheld
    • Prepare driver paperwork for Imaging
  • Maintain driver compliance logs as necessary (DOT, DVR, etc)
    • Maintain cash reconciliation and driver deposit log
    • Maintain records in route accounting system
    • Review settlement exception reports and resolve issues
    • Prepare deposit for pick up by armored car service
    • Troubleshoot handheld issues impacting settlement
    • Work with warehouse inventory personnel to resolve SAP (inventory system) to BASIS (sales accounting system) reconciling items
    • Accountable daily for all mail checks & resolving outstanding items on the clipboard
  • Ability to fill in multiple roles for vacation relie

Qualifications
  • Understanding/prior experience in settlement preferred
  • Ability to travel when deemed necessary
  • Strong communication skills, oral and written, required
  • Ability to handle responsibilities and work both independently and as a team member
  • Strong analytical skills / highly organized
  • Ability to work under pressure and prioritize multiple tasks
  • Experience in BASIS operating system is required, focus on Settlement modules
  • PC Skills – MS Excel, MS Access

Important

All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada Bottling”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification and drivers abstract review. For individuals requiring accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-844-383-2653 or email HR@cokecanada.com .

title: Manager, Demand Planning
description:
Facility Location- Toronto

Work Location -

Posting Locations - Toronto (GTA)

Department - Demand Planning

Job Function - Administrative/Clerical/Office Support

Employee Type - Regular Employee FT Salaried

Shift/Hours –

About Us

Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!

Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.

We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love.

We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.

Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Coca-Cola Life™, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy®, and A&W®.

About This Opportunity

The Manager, Demand Planning will be part of the Demand Planning team reporting to the Director Demand and Revenue Planning. The candidate will take a leadership role in supporting the Postmix demand planning process , they will work closely with stakeholders to develop the required forecast and lead process improvement projects as assigned.

Responsibilities
  • Development of the short- and long-term postmix volume forecast
  • Lead the evaluation of demand tools and processes to support management and improvement of postmix forecast
  • Support the evaluation of postmix business opportunities (innovations, listings, etc.)
  • Support the Demand Review and S&OP process, working with sales, supply and leadership team.
  • Ad hoc projects as assigned.

Qualifications
  • Bachelor's Degree
  • Minimum 5 years in supply chain / demand planning / statistical forecast or related field.
  • Strong analytical, verbal and written communications skills
  • Proven ability to manage needs and concerns of multiple stakeholders across various business systems
  • Computer Modeling: Knowledge of statistical and mathematical computer programs and modeling techniques. Ability to apply and analyze large amounts of data for developing projections and estimates
  • Forecasting: Demand: Knowledge of demand forecasting techniques and inputs (e.g., business trends, seasonality, consumption patterns)
  • Ability to provide insights from data and tell a story
  • Must be strong in Microsoft excel, Access and power point
  • Project management experience is an asset
  • Supply Chain experience in a CPG environment is an asset
  • Must be fluent in English- both written and oral, French is an asset

Important

All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada Bottling”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification and drivers abstract review. title: Account Executive
description:
About Us

Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!

Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.

We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love.

We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.

Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy® and A&W®.

About This Opportunity

The Account Executive is responsible for building and maintaining relationships with narrowly geographically based key customers or within specific channels in order to maximize sales and profit and to ensure proper execution of pricing and promotional programs.

Responsibilities
  • Build, develop and maintain customer relationships with key accounts or channels. Direct calls on customers, sell in initiatives such as new brands and packages, marketing promotions. Resolve customer concerns and issues.
  • Build and execute sales forecasting and ensure proper execution of pricing, promotional programs and Customer Marketing Agreements (CMA) or channel pricing. Assure in-outlet standards are executed per channel direction
  • Develop and implement sales incentive promotions.
  • Execute creative marketing promotions.
  • Obtain authorization from customer to sell and deliver product and/or equipment.
  • Develop and deliver sales presentations.
  • Maintain and assure implementation of ad calendar.
  • Communicate market conditions with internal sales force.
  • Facilitate seamless Bottler alignment across multiple Bottler territories where this situation exists.
  • Work with Category Management to gain key market and customer insights.
  • Acquire new customer information and advise new business representatives.
  • Development of goals for customers based on Business Unit Channel strategy.
  • Renewal of CMAs/contracts as needed.
  • Generate IRR analysis.
  • Partner with Account Development Managers and provide guidance where applicable.
  • Review business results with customers at pre-determined frequencies and agree on business improvement initiatives.
  • Optimize placement and appropriate brand/package availability to ensure assets meet minimum performance requirements.

Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree in business administration or other completed
  • Minimum of two (2) years’ experience in consumer products Direct Store Delivery sales
  • Minimum of two (2) years’ experience in key account/customer service experience
  • Requires experience managing budgets and making customer calls
  • Bilingualism (French and English) required
  • Proven ability to manage needs and concerns of multiple stakeholders across various business systems
  • Demonstrated personal leadership skills and influencing ability
  • Demonstrated negotiation skills and maintain a professional visibility to the customers
  • Ability to recognize issues and turn it into action and solution
  • Effective oral and written communication skills
  • Proven experience collaborating with a multifunctional organization

Important

All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada Bottling”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification and drivers abstract review. Please advise the Talent Acquisition team if you have any questions or concerns in regards to this once you are contacted for further consideration.

Coke Canada Bottling is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce with several programs, policies and resources in place to support our people. For individuals requiring accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-844-383-2653 or email HR@cokecanada.com.

For more information about Coke Canada Bottling, please visit cokecanada.com

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Job ID 1704102 Date posted 04/21/2022

Job title :ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT

Community :KELOWNA

Facility :KELOWNA CHSC

Status :PERMANENT FULL TIME

Position Summary

Interior Health is hiring a permanent full time Administrative Assistant to join the Palliative Care and End of Life Services (PCEOLS) department. This position is based out of our new Community Health and Services Centre office in downtown Kelowna.

What will you work on?

The Administrative Assistant works in a team environment to provide confidential administrative support functions to the Director for the department or program and other management staff as required. This position will support the Medical Assistance in Dying (MAiD) program and will lend support to the PCEOLS Senior Medical Director. The Administrative Assistant serves as a vital linkage and communication source to keep the department or program informed and aligned to its priorities.

Some responsibilities include: coordinating and organizing workflow; determining priorities; composing confidential correspondence for signature; designing and creating correspondence, documents, presentations, orientation packages, and spreadsheets (including data entry) for authorization by the management team; maintaining the integrity and confidentiality of all information which flows through, and is processed for management as it pertains to client care, operations, personnel, labour relations, finance, and public affairs; and supporting the Director in setting the positive, collaborative, efficient tone for the department or program.

How will you create an impact?

Joining our IH team will allow you to challenge yourself professionally while enjoying all the personal pursuits available to you within this fantastic community.

Reasons to Apply at Interior Health... What we can do for you

We offer an exceptional employer-paid benefits package, recognition of previous experience in determining starting salary, and generous vacation entitlement after your first year of employment.

We offer a work environment conducive to growth and development of strong clinical skills. The opportunity to have a balanced lifestyle that allows you to maintain the quality of life you desire.

Qualifications

Education, Training, and Experience:
  • Diploma and graduation from a recognized secretarial program.
  • Three to five years of recent, related experience including experience working with various computer software programs.
  • Or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.
Skills And Abilities
  • Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Ability to organize workload and set priorities.
  • Ability to work without supervision.
  • Ability to type 50 wpm and set up letters, reports, etc. in a professional format.
  • Knowledge of applicable computer hardware and software programs and ability to perform web-based searches.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.
  • Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.
Interior Health values diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to cultivate a workforce rich in culture, experience and knowledge to ensure equitable health outcomes for all of the clients we serve. We are welcoming of all populations including our Aboriginal partners throughout the Interior Health Region. We are committed to increasing our Aboriginal representative workforce to build an engaged, culturally diverse organization focused on the goal of providing high quality, sustainable healthcare through an engaged workforce and healthy workplaces. We build inclusive, trusting and respectful relationships through our partnerships.
skills: ['Three to five years of recent, related experience including experience working with various computer software programs.', 'Or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.']

title: Part Time Merchandiser
description:
About Us

Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!

Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.

We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love.

We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.

Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Coca-Cola Life™, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy®, and A&W®.

About This Opportunity

Coke Canada Bottling Merchandisers work in local grocery stores helping our clients keep Coke Canada Bottling products fully stocked and available to consumers – keeping beverage sections, end caps, racks and displays filled. Merchandisers are our frontline ambassador, providing superior service to clients and consumers.

Responsibilities
  • Maintain and replenish products in store racks, shelves, displays, and coolers by transporting product between backroom/storage room to front-of-store with manual or powered equipment (pallet jack, hand-truck).
  • Build, change or remove product displays while adhering to company standards; maintaining product signage; cleaning product space and securing damaged or defective product.
  • Repetitively lift, carry and position product (weight up to 50lbs or 22kgs) above shoulder height without assistance
  • Consistent kneeling, squatting and reaching above the head
  • Manage backroom by organizing stock (product); identifying, monitoring, and reporting inventory levels; evaluating and processing damaged product; re-packing product; organizing backroom materials (i.e., pallets, product shells etc.); completing any required paperwork
  • Follow all Coke Canada Bottling and Store policies regarding backroom, display floor, replenishment, equipment, and safety
  • Maintain an orderly and clean work area in compliance with Company safety and sanitation requirements.
  • Maintain professional relationships with co-workers and customers.
  • Ability to push and pull manual and powered equipment (i.e. pallet jack, hand-truck etc.) containing product loads for a minimum of 100 yards without assistance
  • Ability to repetitively grasp and manipulate objects of varying size and weight requiring fine motor skills and hand-eye coordination
  • Ability to stand and walk for long periods of time

Qualifications
  • Must have access to a personal vehicle for use during working hours
  • A valid driver’s license with a clean driving record with no major violations over the last three (3) years
  • One (1) year experience working in grocery, retail, warehousing or related field preferred
  • Experience working with manual or powered pallet jacks preferred

Important

All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification, and driver’s abstract review. In addition, all new employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide Coke Canada with proof of vaccination. Please advise the Talent Acquisition team if you have any questions or concerns in regard to any of the foregoing once you are contacted for further consideration.

Coke Canada Bottling is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce with several programs, policies and resources in place to support our people. For individuals requiring accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-844-383-2653 or email HR@cokecanada.com.

For more information about Coke Canada Bottling, please visit cokecanada.com

title: Représentant des ventes
description:
Nous sommes une entreprise fièrement canadienne et indépendante; nous sommes Coke Canada!


La Compagnie d’embouteillage Coca-Cola Canada Limitée est la plus importante entreprise d’embouteillage au Canada. Nous sommes une entreprise indépendante qui compte plus de 5 800 employés et dispose d’un réseau de plus de 50 centres de ventes et de distribution, ainsi que de cinq usines de fabrication, à l’échelle du pays.


Nous comptons 120 ans d’histoire en fabrication, marketing, vente et distribution de produits prêts à boire des marques populaires que les Canadiens aiment tant.


Nous sommes fiers de développer des relations ancrées dans la diversité et la pérennité, avec nos clients, consommateurs, intervenants et communautés, en nous appuyant sur nos valeurs communes : adopter une mentalité entrepreneuriale, collaborer, agir avec intégrité, prendre nos responsabilités, et mettre la qualité et la sécurité à l’avant-plan.


Parmi nos marques, nous comptons Coca-Cola®, Coke Diète®, Coca-Cola® zéro sucre, Coca Cola Life™, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® et vitaminwater®; et parmi celles de nos marques partenaires, Canada Dry®, Monster Energy®, et A&W®.


À propos de cette occasion

Le Représentant des ventes est responsable d'effectuer les visites et les ventes chez nos clients et ce, dans une séquence de visites déjà établies. Il/Elle devra déployer des efforts pour promouvoir la croissance et la profitabilité des comptes existants.


Territoire : Valleyfield/Lacolle/Ormstown


Responsabilités


  • Vendre au client avec succès des plans promotionnels, des étalages supplémentaires et des installations d’équipement assortis d’ententes de marketing avec les clients et alignés sur les objectifs d’affaires et les stratégies du client et du système Coca-Cola.
  • Évaluer les occasions au point de vente pour les nouveaux et actuels clients de petites surfaces. Développer un plan commercial personnalisé qui répond aux besoins du client.
  • Assurer un service à la clientèle de niveau supérieur et résoudre les problèmes rapidement.
  • Vendre des programmes promotionnels et assurer la conformité du détaillant.
  • Exécuter des programmes et promotions, dans le créneau et avec les clients, qui tirent parti des stratégies de marque nationales
  • Gérer de manière proactive son horaire et son territoire, afin d’optimiser les occasions de vente en personne.

Relations et responsabilités en tant qu’ambassadeur :


  • Développer des relations solides, avec les clients et fournisseurs majeurs, qui mènent à des solutions gagnant-gagnant.
  • Adopter des comportements indicateurs de l’alignement de toutes les fonctions et de la franchise au sein du système.
  • Tirer parti des connaissances à l’échelle locale pour jouer d’influence, et tirer parti des forces du réseau pour atteindre des résultats positifs.
  • S’afficher en leader important de la Compagnie d’embouteillage Coca-Cola Canada Limitée, dans le marché et des secteurs d’affaires aux yeux des groupes commerciaux et industriels.



Ce dont vous avez besoin pour réussir à ce poste:


  • Diplôme d’études postsecondaires, préférablement dans un domaine lié aux affaires
  • Minimum de deux (2) à cinq (5) ans d’expérience en ventes dans le secteur des biens de consommation
  • Minimum de deux (2) ans d’expérience en vente/gestion de compte de biens de consommation/livraison directe au magasin
  • Grand sens de l’analyse, de l’organisation, de la planification, et grandes compétences en communication verbale et écrite (obligatoire)
  • Capacité d’utiliser une variété de programmes informatiques
  • Permis de conduire valide et dossier de conduite conforme aux directives de la politique sur le dossier de conduite
  • Capacité d’effectuer des voyages d’une journée pour soutenir les unités de marché jusqu’à 50 % du temps


Toutes les offres d’emploi à la Compagnie d’embouteillage Coca-Cola Canada Limitée (« Coke Canada ») sont assujetties à une vérification des antécédents entreprise par un de nos fournisseurs tiers. Les exigences standard en matière de vérification des antécédents dépendent du poste envisagé et peuvent inclure certaines, voire toutes les vérifications suivantes : vérification des antécédents criminels, des études et des antécédents professionnels, et contrôle du dossier de conduite. De plus, tous les nouveaux employés doivent être complètement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 et fournir à Coke Canada une preuve de vaccination. Veuillez aviser l’équipe d’attraction des talents en cas de questions ou d’inquiétudes concernant ces exigences lorsque vous aurez été contacté pour l’étape suivante du processus de sélection.


Coke Canada s’engage à composer un effectif inclusif et diversifié; l’entreprise compte de nombreux programmes, politiques et ressources, mis en place dans le but de soutenir son personnel. Les personnes handicapées qui ont besoin d’accommodement ou de soutien dans le cadre du processus de recrutement sont priées de communiquer avec l’équipe des services d’attraction de talents par téléphone, au +1 844 383-2653, ou par courriel, au HR@cokecanada.com.

title: Driver Merchandiser
description:
About Us

Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!

Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.

We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love.

We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.

Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Coca-Cola Life™, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy®, and A&W®.

About This Opportunity

Coke Canada Bottling Bulk Drivers are responsible for the delivery of pre-ordered products to assigned accounts. This is a long-haul role and requires overnights. This is a short haul role and all driving will be locally based.

Responsibilities
  • Shift: AM, PM or overnight
  • Deliver pre-ordered products to customers on assigned route using a Coke Canada Bottling fleet truck
  • Check accuracy and stability of truck load
  • Follow all Coke Canada Bottling and Store policies regarding equipment and safety
  • Maintain professional relationships with co-workers and customers.
  • Repetitively lift, carry and position product (weight up to 50lbs or 22kgs) above shoulder height without assistance - most route require product to be offloaded and broght into the customer location.
  • Merchandising product into customer location as needed
  • Ability to push and pull manual and powered equipment (i.e. pallet jack, hand-truck etc.) containing product loads for a minimum of 100 yards without assistance
  • Collect company property
  • Follow all Coke Canada Bottling and Store policies regarding backroom, display floor, replenishment, equipment, and safety
  • Maintain professional relationships with co-workers and customers

Qualifications
  • Commercial License with Air (Class 1 or AZ) with no major violations over the last three (3) years
  • One (1) plus year of commercial driving experience
  • One to three years of general work experience
  • Local delivery experience preferred
  • Ability to repetitively lift, carry and position product (weight up to 50lbs or 22kgs) above shoulder height without assistance

Important

All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada Bottling”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification and drivers abstract review. Please advise the Talent Acquisition team if you have any questions or concerns in regards to this once you are contacted for further consideration.

Coke Canada Bottling is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce with several programs, policies and resources in place to support our people. For individuals requiring accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-844-383-2653 or email HR@cokecanada.com .

title: Merchandiser - Part-Time (Drayton Valley)
description:
Facility Location- Edmonton

Work Location -

Posting Locations - Edmonton

Department - Northern Alberta Generalist Team 3

Job Function - Merchandiser

Employee Type - Temporary PT Hourly

Shift/Hours –

About Us

Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!

Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.

We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love.

We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.

Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy®, and A&W®.

About This Opportunity

Coke Canada Bottling Merchandisers work in local grocery stores helping our clients keep Coke Canada Bottling products fully stocked and available to consumers – keeping beverage sections, end caps, racks and displays filled. Merchandisers are our frontline ambassador, providing superior service to clients and consumers.

Responsibilities
  • Maintain and replenish products in store racks, shelves, displays, and coolers by transporting product between backroom/storage room to front-of-store with manual or powered equipment (pallet jack, hand-truck).
  • Build, change or remove product displays while adhering to company standards; maintaining product signage; cleaning product space and securing damaged or defective product.
  • Repetitively lift, carry and position product (weight up to 50lbs or 22kgs) above shoulder height without assistance
  • Consistent kneeling, squatting and reaching above the head
  • Manage backroom by organizing stock (product); identifying, monitoring, and reporting inventory levels; evaluating and processing damaged product; re-packing product; organizing backroom materials (i.e., pallets, product shells etc.); completing any required paperwork
  • Follow all Coke Canada Bottling and Store policies regarding backroom, display floor, replenishment, equipment, and safety
  • Maintain an orderly and clean work area in compliance with Company safety and sanitation requirements.
  • Maintain professional relationships with co-workers and customers.
  • Ability to push and pull manual and powered equipment (i.e. pallet jack, hand-truck etc.) containing product loads for a minimum of 100 yards without assistance
  • Ability to repetitively grasp and manipulate objects of varying size and weight requiring fine motor skills and hand-eye coordination
  • Ability to stand and walk for long periods of time

Qualifications
  • Must have access to a personal vehicle for use during working hours
  • A valid driver’s license with a clean driving record with no major violations over the last three (3) years
  • One (1) year experience working in grocery, retail, warehousing or related field preferred
  • Experience working with manual or powered pallet jacks preferred

Important

All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification, and driver’s abstract review. In addition, all new employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide Coke Canada with proof of vaccination. Please advise the Talent Acquisition team if you have any questions or concerns in regard to any of the foregoing once you are contacted for further consideration.

Coke Canada Bottling is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce with several programs, policies and resources in place to support our people. For individuals requiring accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-844-383-2653 or email HR@cokecanada.com.

For more information about Coke Canada Bottling, please visit cokecanada.com

title: Finance Business Manager
description:
About Us

Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!

Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.

We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love.

We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.

Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Coca-Cola Life™, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy®, evian® and A&W®.

About This Opportunity

This position works as the key finance liaison with the Hamilton and London Market Units within the Central Canada Operating Unit. It includes being a key contributor in monthly forecasting, monthly profit & loss statement reviews, reporting, and annual business planning. This position will be responsible for interpreting, analyzing and actioning revenue and operating expense variances and forecasting results for the remaining year. In this role you will prepare analysis that provides operational insight at both an Operating Unit level as well as across various Market Units. The role will assist Operations extensively in maximizing market unit profitability and efficiency. You will be involved in the annual budget creation inclusive of full operating expenditure planning and phasing. The role is highly operational focused and understanding the business is key in the success of this role.

Responsibilities
  • Prepare and enhance standardized weekly and monthly finance and operational reports
  • Assist the OU Controller with reporting out impacts of revenue and cost variances versus budget for sales, distribution and warehousing and explaining why the variances occurred
  • Complete month-end and year-end closing functions that pertain to profit and loss statement management and provide coverage for other team members which includes participating in month end routines inclusive of detailed Profit and Loss analysis for two Market Units, booking journal entries and performing reconciliations
  • Working with project team members to understand initiatives and to provide logic and templates for tracking productivity initiatives savings
  • Verify productivity initiative savings reported by project owners
  • Volume/price/mix analysis on Market Unit and Operating Unit revenue
  • Work with the team in preparing a detailed annual budget with business partners and other cross functional teams, scaling and presentation process (creation and delivery)
  • Focus on continual process improvement and ensure compliance and control, create if/as needed, standard procedures and policies to drive efficiencies and savings
  • Develop and maintain solid partnerships with stakeholders including finance counterparts, general managers, operations managers and capability leads
  • Participate and manage ad-hoc projects and other duties as required

Qualifications

Education
  • Bachelor's Degree in Finance or Accounting
  • MBA and or CPA preferred

Professional Experience
  • Minimum one to three years of experience in accounting or finance
  • Excellent knowledge of Excel
  • Excellent analytical approach with an understanding of revenue and spend management
  • Ability to work effectively in a team environment and collaborate with others
  • Strong communication and business writing skills
  • Flexibility to adjust workload and hours when necessary
  • SAP experience is an asset
  • Experience with a National Retail, Wholesale or Manufacturing organization would be considered an asset

Foundation Skills
  • Collaboration – Work effectively in a team environment and with business partners
  • Critical Thinking - Analyze information to provide clear and concise recommendations to drive improvement and profitability
  • Exercising Judgment – Generate alternatives and assist in selecting the best option
  • Prioritizing – Ensure the timely completion of designated objectives
  • Speaking and Writing – Clearly articulate relevant ideas, opinions and information
  • Potential to travel up to 10% of time within Canada.

Important

All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada Bottling”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification and drivers abstract review. Please advise the Talent Acquisition team if you have any questions or concerns in regards to this once you are contacted for further consideration.

Coke Canada Bottling is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce with several programs, policies and resources in place to support our people. For individuals requiring accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-844-383-2653 or email HR@cokecanada.com .

For more information about Coke Canada Bottling, please visit cokecanada.com

title: Manager, Customer Marketing
description:
Facility Location- Calgary

Work Location -

Posting Locations - Calgary

Department - West OU Sales Team

Job Function - Sales and Marketing

Employee Type - Regular Employee FT Salaried

Shift/Hours –

About Us

Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!

Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.

We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love.

We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.

Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy®, and A&W®.

About This Opportunity

The Customer Marketing Manager is responsible for the development and execution of Customer and Channel specific marketing plans. Working closely with the sales team and our customers, the CMM plays a key role in driving revenue and profit for the system, while helping achieve our goal of becoming the Customer's most valued supplier.

Responsibilities
  • Ensure the activation of national marketing initiatives with Regional Customers.
  • Develop and execute channel and customer marketing programs that integrate national brand strategies and consumer insights to drive increased consumer preference and customer activities.
  • Identify customer and channel marketing opportunities using shopper insights.
  • Partner with Coca-Cola Company stakeholders to implement customer/channel insights and initiatives within the Regional customer portfolio.
  • Develop execution plans for new product launches and line extensions to ensure that specific distribution, pricing, shelving and merchandising objectives are achieved.
  • Partner with Key Account Team to develop, execution and follow - up of sales plans of assigned customer base.
  • Actively participate in annual sales/customer planning.
  • Ensure that all marketing initiatives and plans are financially feasible – responsible for managing the customer/channel marketing P&L.
  • Partner with the Key Account teams to develop and present initiatives.
  • Assisting customers to achieve their customer plan on by offering merchandising solutions.
  • Manage and address customer issues/opportunities promptly.
  • Building relationships with marketing contacts of key customers.

Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree required; Business or Marketing preferred
  • Minimum of three (3) to five (5) years in a consumer-packaged goods company, preferably in both customer development and marketing roles
  • Ability to recognize, understand, and interpret shopper behaviour, brand strategies, channel and customer needs, and turn this knowledge into action and results
  • A combination of brand, channel and or customer marketing experience is required
  • Marketing experience in the Fast Moving Consumer Packaged Goods Industry is an asset.
  • Demonstrated personal leadership skills and influencing ability
  • Brand merchandising knowledge
  • Demonstrated creative and strategic thinking ability
  • Effective oral and written communications skills
  • Ability to travel approximately 20-30% of the time.

Important

All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification, and driver’s abstract review. In addition, all new employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide Coke Canada with proof of vaccination. Please advise the Talent Acquisition team if you have any questions or concerns in regard to any of the foregoing once you are contacted for further consideration.

Coke Canada Bottling is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce with several programs, policies and resources in place to support our people. For individuals requiring accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-844-383-2653 or email HR@cokecanada.com.

For more information about Coke Canada Bottling, please visit cokecanada.com

title: Analyst, Equipment Operations
description:
About Us

Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!

Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.

We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love.

We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.

Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Coca-Cola Life™, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy®, and A&W®.

About This Opportunity

The Equipment Service Analyst will be responsible for providing, reporting solutions, analytics and SAP/FSL management for the Equipment Service Department.

The Equipment Service Analyst will have a strong analytical role in the ensuring the quality of SAP Business Intelligence data as well as supplying analytical support to the entire Equipment Service Group. In addition, the role will design, create and maintain standard quality reports for key service level agreements and operational metrics.

The Successful candidate will leverage their knowledge to improve business processes or to develop new capabilities in reporting and analysis thereby insuring a world class experience for our customers. In addition, this role will work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs and translate their data into high quality, accurate business insights.

The Equipment Analyst will have a functional user knowledge of SAP. They will collaborate with IT, Service Dispatch and Planning and Make Ready Centers. The individual will also be required to develop, create, manage and maintain data in Microsoft applications.

Shift: Monday to Friday, Day. This is a hybrid position.

Responsibilities
  • Identify best practices and business process improvements, then develop, document and maintain detailed Standard Operating Procedures where needed
  • Running and Identifying trends using SAP BI reports and ensuring all reporting schedules are met.
  • Participate in weekly and monthly review meetings in a presenter capacity to large groups
  • Focus on increasing knowledge on data quality management and influence how we support our internal and external clients using analytics.
  • Project Management

Qualifications
  • BA degree in realavent field preferred
  • 2 years in a position involving data entry and management some experience in data mining i.e. relational databases and excel with skill in macro writing. Candidate should have experience working within SAP
  • Report Development: Knowledge of report writing tools and technologies i.e. Enterprise Data Warehouse or SAP HANA. Candidate will have the ability to use the tools and technologies to create, write and compile reports within SAP BI environment.
  • Robust knowledge in Microsoft Excel and its applications, As well as experience in SAP or other ERP systems.
  • 3+ years of experience working in an intense data hungry environment using SAP BI tools.
  • 3+ years of experience in supplying feedback on analytical findings, and presenting said finding to groups of stakeholders
  • Proven keyboarding skills, Constant 40+ Words Per Minute with Zero Errors
  • Bilingual (French, English) is also preferred yet not mandatory

Important

All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada Bottling”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification and drivers abstract review. Please advise the Talent Acquisition team if you have any questions or concerns in regards to this once you are contacted for further consideration.

Coke Canada Bottling is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce with several programs, policies and resources in place to support our people. For individuals requiring accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-844-383-2653

For more information about Coke Canada Bottling, please visit cokecanada.com

For more information about Coke Canada Bottling, please visit cokecanada.com

title: Quality Control Technician - Temporary - Peterborough
description:
• This role will provide temporary coverage for the summer.
Why Join Coca-Cola North America?

It’s an exciting time to work in The Coca-Cola Company’s flagship market. We’re accelerating our momentum as the fastest-growing large consumer goods company in North America by putting people at the heart of our business and everything we do – whether we’re innovating to give consumers the drinks and packaging sizes they want, or building our eCommerce capabilities. People are our focus when we’re collaborating with our diverse network of locally-connected bottling partners, and when we’re returning every drop of water we use to communities and nature. And people – with the different backgrounds, skills and perspectives they bring to our workplace – are helping transform our business, one big idea at a time. We empower our employees to challenge the status quo, make bold recommendations, experiment and adapt, so we can grow together and make a great business even better.

About the role?

Responsibilities
  • Ability to perform all test procedures as described in The Minute Maid Analytical Methods manual.
  • Sampling of products for testing and conformance to specifications for ingredients, pre-checks and finished product from the line.
  • Sample and inspect for conformance of packaging materials.
  • Microbiological sampling, plating and data interpretation of wate , product, ingredients and processes.
  • Sample collection and packaging for shipments.
  • Ability to make calculations and recommendations for batch adjustments.
  • Cleaning, routine maintenance, calibration and troubleshooting of lab test equipment and procedures.
  • Monitor process parameters and report issues to Supervisors and Managers.
  • Preparation of analytical data in a complete, precise and professional manner.
  • Preparation of standard solutions for wet chemistry methods.
  • Maintain the lab in a clean state at all times.
  • To follow up on problem areas and to assist to final resolution- working with all QC technicians and Production associates in a team spirit.
  • Technical understanding of juices and the application of Good manufacturing Practices, WHMIS, cleaning procedures and safe handling of chemicals.
  • Set up new master formula into excel spreadsheet Base and Frozen Formula Adjustments
  • Complete concentrate log weekly for production pulls
  • Average sweeteners and OJ loads weekly for formulizing the following weeks production
  • Work with Supply Planner in releasing formula to production and any changes that need to be made
  • Able to do excel calculation sheet for every product each week
  • Complete blend envelopes with appropriate worksheets and formula for production and lab daily
  • Log into SAP and fill information in the Process Orders using t-code MD04
  • Access all process orders (PrcOrd) for each batch scheduled and an (OrdRes)for finished goods
  • Complete process orders by filling in number of KG of each ingredient indicated on excel spreadsheet
  • Able to make formula adjustments when an alternate ingredient is to be used
  • Release all process orders once they have been set up
  • Able to adjust quantities in SAP and in each process order as needed
  • Check shortage reports
  • Use t-code YPSR2 to do bar code sheets for lab and production
  • Sort process orders by number and amounts of each run
  • Complete staging of ingredients in SAP using LP10
  • Take completed formula down to lab daily
  • Pick up previous days production files and taste samples from lab daily
  • Record all frozen and base products into the Frozen/Base production log book in order that products were made with dates. Record brix and acid on base products in logbook
  • Able to find quantity of frozen product produced in SAP using t-code YPSR2
  • Able to find quantity of base product produced by referring to base fill logs
  • Able to fill out hold logs when holds have occurred
  • Update annual hold list
  • Record the average test results from the product files into the Average Quality Results file in excel
Qualifications
  • Must possess a graduation diploma from an accredited Community College specializing in a life science or laboratory science technician program or Bachelor of Science degree in biology, microbiology, chemistry, food science of other science discipline.
  • Previous experience in a laboratory environment (work or school).
  • Knowledge of analytical techniques, chemistry, microbiology, math and basic computer skills.
  • Possess strong analytical, organizational and judgement skills.
  • Must be able to pass certification process (upgrade to take effect upon certification).
  • Possess good verbal and written communication skills to follow instructions, review manuals and complete required on line documentation.
  • Must be able to lift heavy weights ( 20-50lbs).
  • Must have a satisfactory work, safety and attendance record.
  • Must be able to pass a Qualification Certification Process (QCP). Testing will involve verbal, written and hands-on operation of equipment and machinery
Coca-Cola Limited is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce. We have a number of programs and policies in place to support this goal. If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please contact our HR Shared Service team by calling 1-877-677-6774. Coca-Cola Limited will consult with all applicants with a disability who request accommodation during the recruitment process to ensure that the accommodation provided takes into account the applicants individual accessibility needs.

Our Purpose And Growth Culture

We are taking deliberate action to nurture an inclusive culture that is grounded in our company purpose, to refresh the world and make a difference. We act with a growth mindset, take an expansive approach to what’s possible and believe in continuous learning to improve our business and ourselves. We focus on four key behaviors - curious, empowered, inclusive and agile - and value how we work as much as what we achieve. We believe that our culture is one of the reasons our company continues to thrive after 130+ years. Visit Our Purpose and Vision to learn more about these behaviors and how you can bring them to life in your next role at Coca-Cola.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. When we collect your personal information as part of a job application or offer of employment, we do so in accordance with industry standards and best practices and in compliance with applicable privacy laws.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
About Us

Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, We are Coke Canada!
  • Cola Canada Bottling Limited is Canada’s premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centers, and 5 production facilities nationwide.

We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love.

Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Coca-Cola Life™, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq’s®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and Vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy® and A&W®.

We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.

About This Opportunity

A key member of Canada’s Financial Planning and Analysis organization, supporting the preparation of the strategic long-term forecast, annual budget, monthly forecasts and reporting on actuals against budget and forecast.

Strong communication and leadership skills are required to connect with stakeholders across the organization

Responsibilities
  • Drive the annual financial planning process by creating templates and identifying areas to streamline financial planning activities
  • Directly support monthly reporting and forecasting to Corporate and Senior Leadership Team by performing analytics on the financial performance of the business
  • Leverage various sources of company data to provide financial insights and reconcile data as needed
  • Prepare moderately complex reports/analyses to summarize current and projected company financial information
  • Drive the monthly Recycling deposits process by analyzing the data and filing government -mandatory reports
  • Other ad hoc projects and reports to support the business as required
  • Strong candidates will have a sound understanding of accounting principles and its application to financial planning and analysis

Qualifications
  • Ability to provide value-added financial insights and analysis
  • Attention to detail
  • Proven effective written, oral and financial information communication skills
  • 1 – 3 years professional work experience in accounting or financial analysis role required (3+ years preferred)
  • Intermediate Microsoft Excel skills required
  • SAP work experience preferred
  • Bachelor’s Degree required with a concentration in Accounting or Finance preferred

Important

All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification and driver’s abstract review. Please advise the Talent Acquisition team if you have any questions or concerns in regard to this once you are contacted for further consideration.

Coke Canada is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce with a number of programs, policies and resources in place to support our people.

For individuals with disabilities, should you require accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-844-383-2653 or email HR@cokecanada.com.

For more information about Coke Canada Bottling, please visit cokecanada.com

title: Sales Development Manager, Small Store
description:
Facility Location- Calgary

Work Location -

Posting Locations - Calgary

Department - Southern Alberta Small Format Team East

Job Function - Sales and Marketing

Employee Type - Regular Employee FT Salaried

Shift/Hours –

About Us

Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!

Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.

We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love.

We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.

Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy®, evian® and A&W®.

About This Opportunity

Coke Canada Bottling Sales Development Manager’s (SDM) are field sales representatives responsible for identifying and selling against opportunities within Coke Canada Bottling’s local and national small store customers, which includes Gas, Convenience, Restaurants & Bars, Food Service on premise, and Wholesale customers. The SDM is required to maximize profitable sales opportunities by thoroughly understanding the complexity of the channels and building relationships with customers. The SDM is also responsible for prospecting for new business and growing the business within their designated territory. Current territory will be Airdrie, Crossfield and parts of NE Calgary. This is subject to change in the future.

Responsibilities
  • Successfully sell customer promotional plans, incremental displays and equipment placements that include annual Customer Marketing Agreements and align with the customer's and the Coke Canada Bottling system’s business objectives and strategies
  • Prospect for new business within assigned territory
  • Evaluate outlet opportunities for new and existing small store customers
  • Develop a customized business plan addressing the critical needs of the customer(s)
  • Proactively arrange time and territory to achieve optimum face-to-face selling opportunities
  • Manage orders and inventoryto ensure that revenue and profit goals are achieved and merchandising standards are maintained at each store
  • Work collaboratively with the merchandising Supervisors and order replenishment team to ensure that revenue and profit goals are achieved, and that appropriate inventory levels and merchandising standards are maintained at each store
  • Ensures a high level of customer service and resolves issues promptly
  • Sell in promotional programs and ensure dealer compliance
  • Execute channel and customer promotions/programs that leverage national brand strategies
  • Be able to lift, carry and position product (weight up to 50lbs or 22kgs) above shoulder height without assistance

Qualifications
  • 1-3 years selling in consumer goods industry required
  • Minimum of 1 years in consumer products/direct store delivery sales/major account management
  • Strong analytical, organizational, planning, verbal and written communications skills are a must
  • Proficient using a variety of computer programs
  • Valid driver's license and driving record free from any violations for the past 3 years
  • Post secondary education is preferred

Important

All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification, and driver’s abstract review. In addition, all new employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide Coke Canada with proof of vaccination. Please advise the Talent Acquisition team if you have any questions or concerns in regard to any of the foregoing once you are contacted for further consideration.

Coke Canada Bottling is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce with several programs, policies and resources in place to support our people. For individuals requiring accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-844-383-2653 or email HR@cokecanada.com.

title: Merchandiser
description:
About Us

Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!

Coke Canada Bottling is Canada's premier bottling company. We are an independently owned business encompassing over 5,800 associates, more than 50 sales and distribution centres, and five production facilities nationwide.

We have a 120-year heritage of manufacturing, marketing, selling, and distributing the major branded ready-to-drink products Canadians love.

We pride ourselves on building diverse and sustainable relationships with our customers, consumers, stakeholders, and communities through our shared values: lead with an entrepreneurial mindset, collaboration, integrity, accountability, quality and safety.

Our brands include: Coca-Cola®, Diet Coke®, Coca-Cola® Zero Sugar, Coca-Cola Life™, Sprite®, Fanta®, Barq's®, NESTEA®, POWERADE®, Minute Maid®, DASANI® and vitaminwater®; and our partner brands: Canada Dry®, Monster Energy®, and A&W®.

About This Opportunity

Coke Canada Bottling Merchandisers work in local grocery stores helping our clients keep Coke Canada Bottling products fully stocked and available to consumers – keeping beverage sections, end caps, racks and displays filled. Merchandisers are our frontline ambassador, providing superior service to clients and consumers.

Responsibilities
  • Maintain and replenish products in store racks, shelves, displays, and coolers by transporting product between backroom/storage room to front-of-store with manual or powered equipment (pallet jack, hand-truck).
  • Build, change or remove product displays while adhering to company standards; maintaining product signage; cleaning product space and securing damaged or defective product.
  • Repetitively lift, carry and position product (weight up to 50lbs or 22kgs) above shoulder height without assistance
  • Consistent kneeling, squatting and reaching above the head
  • Manage backroom by organizing stock (product); identifying, monitoring, and reporting inventory levels; evaluating and processing damaged product; re-packing product; organizing backroom materials (i.e., pallets, product shells etc.); completing any required paperwork
  • Follow all Coke Canada Bottling and Store policies regarding backroom, display floor, replenishment, equipment, and safety
  • Maintain an orderly and clean work area in compliance with Company safety and sanitation requirements.
  • Maintain professional relationships with co-workers and customers.
  • Ability to push and pull manual and powered equipment (i.e. pallet jack, hand-truck etc.) containing product loads for a minimum of 100 yards without assistance
  • Ability to repetitively grasp and manipulate objects of varying size and weight requiring fine motor skills and hand-eye coordination
  • Ability to stand and walk for long periods of time

Qualifications
  • Must have access to a personal vehicle for use during working hours
  • A valid driver’s license with a clean driving record with no major violations over the last three (3) years
  • One (1) year experience working in grocery, retail, warehousing or related field preferred
  • Experience working with manual or powered pallet jacks preferred

Important

All offers of employment at Coca-Cola Canada Bottling Limited (“Coke Canada”) are conditional upon a successful background clearance obtained through our contracted third-party vendor. The standard clearance requirements depend on the position and may include some or all of the following: criminal clearance, employment verification, education verification, and driver’s abstract review. In addition, all new employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide Coke Canada with proof of vaccination. Please advise the Talent Acquisition team if you have any questions or concerns in regard to any of the foregoing once you are contacted for further consideration.

Coke Canada Bottling is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce with several programs, policies and resources in place to support our people. For individuals requiring accommodations or support throughout the recruitment process please contact our Talent Acquisition Services team by calling 1-844-383-2653 or email HR@cokecanada.com.

About Us

Proudly Canadian and Independently Owned, we are Coke Canada Bottling!

About This Opportunity

Coke Canada Bottling Bulk Drivers are responsible for the delivery of pre-ordered products to assigned accounts.

Wage is $30.03/hr after probation
  • ( 4x 10hr) shifts, flex schedule Monday to Friday.
  • must be available to work night shift, day shift and overnights if necessary
  • Benefits are competitive from Day 1
  • Employee & Family Assistance Program resources
  • Boot Allowance provided each year
  • New Uniforms provided each year
  • 3 weeks paid vacation after 1 year
  • Partnered with Perkopolis for employee discounts

Responsibilities
  • Shift: AM, PM or overnight
  • Deliver pre-ordered products to customers on assigned route using a Coke Canada Bottling fleet truck
  • Check accuracy and stability of truck load
  • Follow all Coke Canada Bottling and Store policies regarding equipment and safety
  • Maintain professional relationships with co-workers and customers.
  • Repetitively lift, carry and position product (weight up to 50lbs or 22kgs) above shoulder height without assistance - most route require product to be offloaded and broght into the customer location.
  • Merchandising product into customer location as needed
  • Ability to push and pull manual and powered equipment (i.e. pallet jack, hand-truck etc.) containing product loads for a minimum of 100 yards without assistance
  • Collect company property
  • Follow all Coke Canada Bottling and Store policies regarding backroom, display floor, replenishment, equipment, and safety
  • Maintain professional relationships with co-workers and customers

Qualifications
  • Commercial License with Air (Class 1 or AZ) with no major violations over the last three (3) years
  • One to three years of general work experience
  • Local delivery experience preferred
  • Ability to repetitively lift, carry and position product (weight up to 50lbs or 22kgs) above shoulder height without assistance
